The Talos Principle, czyli filozoficzno, logiczna gra, ktorą stawiam zaraz obok Portala. Jest to podobny kaliber gry, lecz z odrobine innym założeniem. Jeśli lubisz się pogłowić, wyławiać smaczki z różnych zakątków gry, filozofię i dotyczące jej teksty - i nie tylko, to nie masz co czekać. The Talos Principle jest tytułem dla Ciebie. Grę przeszedłem już przeszło dwa, może trzy lata temu w dodatku dwa razy. Nie jest ona typem gry, po której możesz żałować straconego czasu. Wręcz przeciwnie. Talos jest inteligentną grą, w której teksty zmuszają do myślenia i rzucają ciekawe perspektywy na kilka spraw. Takie gry się szanuję, ponieważ nie są one już zwykłym zabijaniem czasu. One potrafią też dowartościować. Pomijając te atuty, Talos oprócz tego jest owiany tajemnicą, co też jest ciekawym zabiegiem. Niemalże od początku gry jesteśmy postawieni przed wyborem, który myślę, że mógłbym nazwać analogią do jabłka i Adama. Konkretniej mówiąć dość szybko Elohim (Bóg) zabrania nam jednej jedynej rzeczy, a my rozwiązując w tym czasie zagadki zastanawiamy się nad tym, czy chcemy go posłuchać. Mógłbym napisać więcej i skupić się też na wadach tytułu, ależ po co. Gra ma swój urok i jeżeli kogoś zainteresowała moja krótka recenzja to cóż... polecam.

Прекрасная игра-головоломка от 1 лица, создателями которой являются Croteam(Serious Sam). Игра завораживает и заинтриговывает с первых минут геймплея, изобилует не только интересными загадками и методами их решения, но и своеобразной философией, сопряжение этих факторов неплохо характеризует атмосферу игры в целом. Вы окунетесь в мир в роли робота, чьим предназначением является решение головоломок, постепенно, при помощи случайных сообщений и прохождения сюжета, завеса тайны будет приоткрываться втягивая в новые сюжетные повороты.Нельзя не признать очевидное сходство этой игры с Portal, и потому фанаты портала будут не разочарованы еще одной возможностью окунуться в мир головоломок, ломая мозги над очередной камерой. Признаю некоторые решения оказываются не очевидными и приходилось терять битый час на их решение, за некоторыми ответами я шел на ютуб, все это лишь подогревало интерес к игре.В общем и целом, брать по скидке и наслаждаться.

今天打通了Talos的三个结局 满是成就感下面是我的一点看法这是我游戏生涯中最喜欢的一部作品 所以吹的比较多游戏作为解密游戏关卡繁多，需要玩家耐心攻克（解密游戏你没有耐心可是不行的）可用工具有七个，结局有三个可供选择，前两个结局对于解迷萌新还算友好，第三结局需要收集全星星，难度很大，很多情况下你是找不到的，如果想体验第三结局，可以搜索大佬的攻略，至于晕3D的话，推荐在画面设置里调试亮度，伽马值，对比度，直到调到一个能适应的搭配，并关闭动态模糊，帧数低就请优化帧数游戏的故事皆是藏于游戏中，需要玩家收集全日志和时间胶囊，将其整理后阅读，隐藏的故事也是非常棒游戏内涵丰富：哲学 宗教 人 意识 理性，给人一种庄重感游戏画面不多说，每一帧都是壁纸，每一眼都是风景游戏音乐，玩过csgo的都知道，被收录为csgo官方音乐盒，是史诗级的音乐类型，气势宏大还有一点使我对游戏制作者心生尊敬和佩服，Croteam是制作过英雄萨姆系列的克罗地亚公司，虽说也是老牌了，但肯定没有其他大厂的规模和生产力，但是从塔罗斯的法则所支持的13种语言和12种配音，可见其态度之不一般 我TM吹爆！感谢你能耐心阅读我的评测，附赠： 全成就+全收集文字攻略 全收集视频流程[www.bilibili.com] 剧情故事整理

2015年4月5日23:05:37第一次评测：推荐理由：这是一款非常有意思的解谜游戏，只要你有正常人的智商，根本不用看攻略就能玩的转。同时整个故事富含了物理哲学，让我们在游戏过程中不断的思考、质问、探寻生命的意义，如果你是个学哲学的，那买它肯定没错了。以下是我最初购买的主要原因，写出来给大家做个参考：1、时效性，打折50%，正好STEAM钱包里还有点零钱2、奖项栏里那足够用鼠标滑轮滚动5秒的奖项3、解谜类游戏锻炼大脑，远离脑残刷刷刷游戏一生平安4、独立游戏，还自带中文语言包，最惊奇的是居然还有中文配音！这种游戏见一个买一个！5、狂热的虚构文学、哲学爱好者，同时本人在上学时也随导师学习过一阵关于人工智能方面的知识，对这方面有所了解（尤其是看到那个程序界面特别有感情）总结：买买买！不买还是人吗？！就算不打折也要买！（点赞者好人一生平安）

We have a winner here people! This is one of the best games i have EVER played. I believe it's a must-have for every fan of the puzzle genre, Croteam did an outstanding job with this one. You can see from the very beginning how much they cared about their game, how much they wanted it to succeed. This is nothing like the uninspired, unoptimized cash-grabbing console ports we are used to nowadays.But let me correct myself. This is not just a game, it is an experience. The talos principle will make you question your existence, your purpose in life. Even if you aren't really into philosophy, it will make you go look up some quotes of famous philosophers.Every aspect of it is superb, the riddles, the visuals, the atmosphere, the music, everything works out.Don't expect it to hold your hand though. The puzzles may seem easy peasy in the beginning but as you progress they will become harder and harder. There are some really difficult ones later in the game, so get ready for the challenge!In conclusion, i can't recommend it enough. This is a masterpiece. I bought it at full price but it was worth it. No regrets!

THE TALOS PRINCIPLE İsimsiz bir ''Android Robot'' olan karakterimiz, çok huzurlu ve güneşli bir ortamda uyanır. ''Elohim'' isimli üstün bir varlık tarafından, kendisi için yarattığı dünyaları keşfetmesini ve çeşitli bulmacaları çözerek tüm işaretleri toplaması gerektiğini işitir. Ancak tüm bunları yaparken dünyanın merkezindeki kuleye tırmanmaması gerektiğini ve bu kuralı çiğnediği takdirde öleceğini söyler. Karakterimiz bulmacaları çözdükçe ve bu yaratılan muhteşem yerde ilerledikçe, bu dünyaların yalnızca sanal gerçeklikte var olduğunu ve karşılaştığı diğer robotlar gibi kendininde bir yapay zeka olduğunu öğrenir. Tanıştığı bazı yapay zekalar tartışmasız Elohim'e hizmet ederken bazıları ise ona güvenilmemesi gerektiğini beyan eder. Bundan sonra ise karakterimizin bir seçim yapması gerekir, ya sorgusuz sualsiz Elohim'in cennetine varacak ya da o kuleye tırmanıp gerçeklerin peşinden gidecek. HİKAYE ANLATIMI VE SUNUM Çoğu oyunun aksine The Talos Principle'a ilk girdiğinizde sizi baştan anlatılacak bir hikaye değil de oynanışa yedirilmiş bir anlatım bekliyor olacak. Daha oyunun başında hiç bilmediğiniz bir yerde uyanıyorsunuz ve Elohim isimli üstün bir varlık tarafından hem amacınızın ne olduğunu öğreniyor hem de yönlendiriliyorsunuz. Ana hikaye ve ayrıntılarda saklı olan gizler ise yavaş yavaş  (Diğer oyuncuların duvarlara yazmış olduğu QR kodların içindeki gizli mesajlar, yeri geldiğinde kurnaz davranabilen yapay zeka PC ile yaptığımız soru cevap ve tartışmalar, Alexandra Drennan isimli kadının önceden kaydedilmiş ses kayıtları gibi unsurlar sayesinde hikayeye dair şeyler öğreniyoruz.)  aktarılıyor. Bunların yanı sıra tüm oyun boyunca yalnız ve kişiliksiz bir robot olduğumuzdan dolayı etrafla pek bir etkileşimimiz olmuyor fakat Elohim bu ıssızlığı anlatıları ile gideriyor. Ayrıca oyunun teması gereği insanlığın varoluşsal sorunları ve felsefi konular da sık sık işleniyor. OYNANIŞ MEKANİKLERİ VE BULMACALAR Her ''Croteam'' oyununda olduğu gibi bu oyunda da varsayılan ayar olarak ''FPS'' istersek de ''TPS''  (Gerek atmosferik açıdan olsun gerek oynanış rahatlığı olsun, birinci şahıs kamera açısı çok daha iyi hissettiriyor ve en iyi oyun deneyimini veriyor.)  olarak oynayabiliyoruz. Oyun mantığını ana hatları ile anlatacak olursak; Toplam 21 seviyeden oluşan A, B ve C  (Bölümler arası kapıları açmak için yapmamız gereken bambaşka bir bulmaca mekaniği var. Her seviyeden kazandığımız ''Sigil'' kilitleri denilen tetris benzeri şekilleri bir tablet üzerinde doğru sırada oturtarak yeni bölümlerin kapılarını açıyoruz.)  bölümlerindeki çeşitli bulmacaları tamamlıyoruz. Bu bulmacalar  (Sinyal bozucu ile kapı açma ya da taret ve bombaları etkisiz hale getirme, lazer yansıtıcı, kutu, taşıma levhası, üzerinden uçtuğumuz pervane ve yarattığımız klon ile senkronize şekilde bulmacalar çözüyoruz. Takıldığımız takdirde ise Elohim'in hizmetkârlarına yardım çağrısında bulunabiliyoruz.)  başlarda çok basit görünüyor fakat oyunun ilerleyen kısımlarında öğrendiğimiz tüm mekanikleri tek bir bulmacada kullanmak zorunda kaldığımızdan dolayı çok daha kompleks bir hal alıyor. Bunların yanı sıra tüm bölümlere saklanmış olan yıldızları toplayarak bambaşka bir bölüm açıyoruz ve orayı tamamladığımızda ise sonsuza kadar Elohim'e hizmet ettiğimiz gizli son açılıyor. BÖLÜM TASARIMLARI VE ATMOSFER Oyunun bölüm tasarımları  (Yıkık harabeler, ışıl ışıl ormanlar, eski tapınaklar, sahil kenarı, karlı dağlar, antik mısır kalıntıları, kaleler, mezarlık vs.)  çok minimal fakat etkileyici. Bunun yanı sıra Elohim'in yasakladığı 6 katlı kule çok iyi dizayn edilmiş ve her bir katı sizi bambaşka diyarlara götürüyor. Ayrıca bazen tekrar eden bu bölümleri, atmosferik gece - gündüz döngüsü, yağmurlu ve güneşli hava gibi mevsimsel unsurlar ile çeşitlendirmeye çalışmışlar. SES VE MÜZİK Üstün varlık Elohim ve geleceğe ses kayıtları bırakmış olan Alexandra Drennan dışında oyunda hiçbir konuşma bulunmuyor. Zaten bu iki karakter gerek diyalogları olsun gerek tok sesleri olsun üçüncü bir sesi de aratmıyor. Ayrıca çevre sesleri atmosferi dibine yaşatacak kadar iyi. Bunların dışında ise oyunun mükemmel müzikleri sizi alıp başka diyarlara götürebiliyor.  (Oyunu bitirdikten sonra bile arada açıp açıp dinliyorum.)  THE TALOS PRINCIPLE - SOUNDTRACK  SONUÇ Portal serisini oynayıp da beğenmeyen yoktur diye düşünüyorum. The Talos Principle benim nazarımda bu serinin ruhani devamıdır. Portal 1 ve 2'de hissettiklerimi tam olarak bu oyunda hissedememiş olsamda yer yer aynı zevkleri aldım. Eğer FPS, bulmaca tarzı keşif oyunlarını seviyorsanız bu yapıtı kesinlikle almanızı tavsiye ederim. İndirim dönemlerinde 5,90 TL olan fiyatını sonuna kadar hak ediyor. Direk çizgisel ilerleyip oyunu bitirirseniz 15, her şeyini görüp tüm sonları keşfetmek isterseniz de 17 - 18 saat sürüyor. İNCELEME PUANI : 90 / 100
do you like portal? do you wish portal was about 10 times longer and took itself really really seriously? Then this is the game for you!

An excellent, challenging puzzle game. Music and visuals are beautiful. The story is capturing and makes you think about philosophical existential themes. Easter eggs in the game are fun to find. 10/10
大概半年前我买了这份游戏，第一关都没有通关因为这个游戏让我发现了我3D眩晕然而前段时间悄摸摸通关了人类一败涂地让我以为自己3D眩晕可能是好了吧于是再一次鼓起勇气打开了这个游戏不说了，我就打开一分钟。我要去休息一会。

If Portal had a cool, older sibling, it would be The Talos Principle."Philosophical science fiction" just about sums it up.  This game makes you think in more ways than one with its crazy puzzles and smart commentary on humanity, morality, and consciousness, and the visuals are great as well.  Even playing through it for the third or fouth time hunting for achievements, the game still amazes me.My recommendation:  Do not use a wiki guide on your first playthrough and spoil the fun.  Be amazed.  THEN go back and realized you missed 85 percent of the game.

重厚な世界観の3Dパズルゲームです。謎の地で突然目覚めた主人公（ロボット）は天からの声に従い、ひたすらパズルを解き続けていきます。パズルは100個以上ありますが、1つ1つは短いので、サクサクと進められます。ジャミング機能を持ったジャマー、謎のビームを屈折させるコネクター、物を吹き飛ばすファンなどを使い、障害物をうまく処理していく必要があります。パズルの難易度はほどよく、試行錯誤していれば大体は解けてしまいますが、1割ほどはかなり難易度が高いです。発想の飛躍が求められます。ヒント機能もありますが、ゲーム中3回しか使用できない上、使用できるようにするのにもパズルを解かないといけないというクッソ面倒なシステムです。しかもそのヒントもそこまでわかりやすくないという…。隠しEDに行くためのアイテムである「星」が各所に隠されているのですが、これの入手方法は激烈に難しいです。自力入手はあきらめた方がいいレベルでした。パズルと並行して、この世界は何なのか、何が起こったのかといった点を解き明かしていくのもこのゲームの醍醐味となります。各地に点在しているアーカイブを見たり、行くことを禁じられている「塔」に登ったりして、真実を探求しましょう。テーマは「人間とは何か」「人間とは何を持って人間と言えるのか」といったものらしく、内容も非常に哲学的です。頭からっぽゲームである「シリアスサム」シリーズのデベロッパーがなぜこんなゲームを作ってしまったのかが一番の謎だったりします。なお吹き替えありのフルローカライズです。【イイところ】・パズルの難易度が大体ほどよい。・世界観がよくできている。・吹き替えあり。【イマイチなところ】・一部の理不尽なまでの難易度。・ヒント機能がクソ。・エレベーターの移動時間が長い。・声と字幕の表示タイミングが全く合っていない。

This game is essentially what happens when you lock up Plato, Aristotle, Jesus Christ, Lao-Tzu, the Buddha, Epicurus, St. Augustine, Avicenna, Maimonides, al-Ghazali, Descartes, Leibniz, Hume, Kant, Marx, Darwin, Dostoevsky, Nietzsche, Turing, Sartre, and Foucault in a room and ask them to crank up a single-player puzzle together, with each person's input being recorded into collectibles and/or easter eggs.Seriously, I was convinced I'm a smartass big brain gamer until this pile of philosophical monstrosity singlehandedly shattered and reshaped my worldview. It's probably 10 times better than 90% of those philosophy classes I took in college where they teach you to read some pseudo-profound bs then write up a bunch of rubbish.My favorite quote from the game: don't doubt, question!

My favorite game by far in 2014 (and in the last couple years, probably), was The Talos Principle.  It was as if this game was specifically made for me. The most important things for me in single player games are:- the quality and inventiveness of the mechanics—and whether or not I can manipulate them in a meaningful way- immersion (which usually means first-person perspective, excellent sound design, etc..),- the writing/storyRegarding mechanics, combat-focused games are the majority in the industry—especially on PC and especially in first-person games—so those that aren’t centered on combat often must work more creatively to be interesting—games like Myst (1993) and Portal (2007). This is also true of games which have combat, but also offer non-combative methods to play through the game (stealth/sneaking, for example)—ie., Deus Ex (2000), Splinter Cell (2002), and Dishonored (2012). These are my favorite types of games—especially the latter, perhaps because the avoidance of combat adds a further complication to the mechanics of gameplay. So, I was really excited about the First Person Puzzle design of Talos when I played the demo at PAX Prime 2014. It was love at first sight in the demo booth. I had trouble getting through the last couple demo levels on my first try, but it was still extremely satisfying and fun. As I sat struggling with the connectors and fans and boxes, of the fellows from Croteam warned me the Enforcers were coming to run everyone out of the Indie Megabooth, but told me to come back the next day to finish the demo—they’d get me back where I’d left off. So I went back the next morning, finished the demo, and gushed to Croteam about how interesting I found the game and how excited I was to play it on release. I tried to explain that it reminded me of playing Deus Ex and System Shock 2. It’s hard to articulate exactly how Talos relates to these types of games, but they all give me the same kind of satisfaction upon completing an area, even if the mechanics and design are quite different—the end feeling as a player is similar, so there’s some kind of overlap in how the gameplay works on the player. And the first-person immersion helps with that. (I should note here that you can play the game in third-person and easily switch between first- and third-person. I simply prefer first.) More on gameplay: the puzzles were great. I found the most satisfying bits to be finding the optional stars because I had to find ways to “break” the game (or at least The Great Voice in the Sky’s intentions… hehe) to get them. The puzzles in general—sigils, stars, and easter eggs—had that kind of excellent satisfaction to them—some of them were teaching the player the possibility of the mechanics, while others encouraged the player to break beyond the narrow way in which puzzle/first-person mechanics usually work. As I mentioned, in some ways Talos really reminded me of experiences playing the original Deus Ex and System Shock 2; there were ways to play those games that literally did break them, just because of the limitations of game development/AI functionality at the time. That’s not to mention that they had multiple routes to play the levels built in already. Talos also achieved the same type of feeling that the Half-Life games produce where it feels like you’re breaking the game—pulling one over on the level designers and outsmarting the game—but in reality that is because levels were designed so well. They were built in a way to teach you to break the limitations and expectations of regular gameplay. I remember the first time I got stuck in Half-Life and after I searched every possible route out of the area, realizing I could climb on the pipes to escape where I was—like, I was so shocked that there was platforming in my FPS! I remember feeling as if I was outsmarting the game, but looking back, of course there really was no other way to get out of the level. Yet it was built in a way that made that fact satisfying instead of frustrating.Another thing worth mentioning: the QR codes. Without saying much, there is functionality built into the game to leave messages on the walls for other players (people on your Steam friends list) to see later. It might seem like a small thing—but it really was a great little touch and made the game even more immersive.So I was super hyped for Talos’s gameplay, and it still delivered beyond my expectations. But I gotta say that the writing and storyline was on the same level, in really impressive ways. It was subtle but powerful, and—without saying too much—I liked how it played with the ideas of free will and game-imposed confines of “choice”. I guess what I mean is, the game—mechanics-wise—were already top notch quality and impressive. But the story—the character development through audio logs, the slow revelation of the story through classical literature and other text artifacts, the QR codes, the interactions with the terminals—made it even richer. Basically Talos combined all of my favorite aspects about video games in a really fresh, great way. And it also took advantage of some of the best avenues that science fiction opens up for those ever-important literary questions... “What is the world like, and what does it mean to be human in that world?” Despite the rambling nature of this post, I actually double majored in Literature and History at university. So this game just... I feel like this game was made for me. And I was made to play it! (All that said—if you’re not interested in story, you can completely ignore and not investigate any of that and still enjoy the game for its excellent mechanics. But I’d still recommend getting into the story!) All in all, I recommend it 100%. Well designed, highly polished, and super cool devs!

Надеюсь, что пост оставленный ниже  поможет тебе сделать решение, купить игру, или же нет. Я могу сказать просто Да, но этого недостаточно. Попытаюсь аргументировать свою точку зрения.      Компания Croteam известна тем, что выпустила один из самых мясных шутеров начала 2000х- и это конечно же Serious Sam. Одна из тех игр, которая запоминается незамысловатым геймплеем, красочными пейзажами и конечно-же калоритным Сэмом.     А теперь они выпустили "The Talos Principle", игру которая напоминает, впервую очередь "Portal", своими изобретательными головоломками, которые очень интересно разгадывать. У игры есть своя философия, которая постепенно раскрывается по ходу сюжета и сбору данных с Пк и записей, заботливо расположенных на карте.    Хочу отметить,что есть бесплатная игра в Steam'е "Sigils of Elohim", в которой нужно разгадывать незамысловатые задачки, в приз мы получаем разные плюшки в "The Talos Principle", вводя коды за пройденную линейку пазлов, и это тоже одна важная и приятная мелочь.     Могу сказать одно, игра получилась очень интересной, сюжет пробивает до муражек, а учитывая то что добавлена русская озвучка с сабами, то игре нет цены. И я как поклонник Croteam и их юмора с пасхалками, надеюсь встретить их и в "The Talos Principle".     Любителям жанра не проходить мимо, игра стоит соих денег и эмоции получаемые во время прохождения непередоваемы. Когда чувстуешь себя частью нечто большего, чем наше общество и окружающий мир.    Моя оценка 10/10 Безголовых Камикадзе...                                                                         И как говорится "In the beginning were the words..."

5 minutes in: |Hey look a puzzle game. Cool"10 hours in: "Mankind's ultimtimate goal is not eternity itself, but progress, progress of any kind. We shatter our desires for life itself when faced with the prospect of continuning onwards, of unraveling one last mystery. We seek answers above and for our own existence, caring little for our own contrived meaning all in the process. And for what? A taste of the illusion this infernal hell offers to us? We cannot jusify this logic, and we cannot jusify our actions. We are merely sheep walking amongst the shepherd of our concious. Repent"

The Talos Principle is a puzzle game developed by Croeam and published by Devolver Digital. It was released on Steam in December 2014, before later being released on PS4 in October 2015. The game play within Talos could be considered very similar to that of Portal. You can play in either first person or third person, as you are presented with tons of puzzles on every stage. Each stage you complete, you unlock a new tool that you will need to use in some form in the following stage. I really liked this way of introducing new mechanics to the game as it lets you get to grips with the previous set very easily before dumping a ton of new stuff on you again. The puzzles start off quite easily as you would expect in the game but they soon take a very high difficulty rise, meaning I was completely stumped for the most of my play through. There is an element of trial and error with a lot of the puzzles as there is a quick reset button to use that takes you right back to the start of the puzzle and you will end up having to do this a lot.  Graphically I was very impressed with The Talos Principle; it looks clean and fresh with extremely high production values. The lighting and weather effects in the game are stellar and really take it to a new level of quality. I was playing at 4k with the majority of the settings turned up to the max, apart from antialiasing. I did however get motion sickness whilst playing in first person view; I think it was a mixture of the speed that the character was traveling at and the motion blur. I had to eventually switch from first person to third person and this solved the problem. The game runs on Serious Engine 4 – this is the only game to use it so far, but it is almost identical to serious engine 3 and 3.5 which were used in the latest Serious Sam titles. I found the plot to be very interesting, having really enjoyed Greek mythology from other games, my interested was peeked from the get go. There are a lot of extra bits of plot and lore to learn about through collectables and computer terminals for you to access as you explore the different levels. I took a lot of time to seek them all out to learn as much as possible.  The game has various different endings as well depending on how you progress throughout your play through. Like I said above, the difficulty really scales quite highly as you get past the first or second stage of levels. I had to use walkthroughs to even come close to finishing the game and even then I struggled and had to refer to videos as well! Whilst I found the game play to remind me a lot of Portal, the difficulty is certainly on a different scale compared. If you plan on playing this game without the aid of guides or wikis, then you are in for a real brain twister as some of the solutions to puzzles are so far out of the box that they were not even on my radar. I finished the game in just over twenty hours, so there is a lot of content, even for someone who thought I was completing the puzzles quite quickly with the guides. Not to mention the game’s various different endings you can explore too. There are a lot of achievements you can unlock in each of the puzzles throughout the game, which may add some replay ability on as well.  Personally I find myself not wanting to go through again purely because I am normally not a massive fan of puzzle games. I didn’t have any technical problems apart from the motion sickness issue as noted above, the game runs very well on 4k resolution at 60+ fps. It looks to be a very well optimized engine that I will be eagerly anticipating what else comes out of it. The game can be played with a controller but given the movement and preciseness of some of the actions you have to take, I would strongly recommend using a keyboard and mouse.  My conclusion on The Talos Principle is quite simple. If you are a fan of mind bending puzzles with really obscure solutions to them, then you are going to absolutely love this game. If you are like me and are only going to manage the first two stages without a guide, you may want to err on the side of caution with your purchase. Whilst I am going to recommend this game, it definitely gets a lot of bonus points from the extremely high productions values on show from the start right until the final scenes. As someone who has the brain like a sieve and finds the puzzle side of the game to be difficult I didn’t enjoy it as much as other games.  Tom's Score Card1) Stay away2) Not Recommended3) Only recommended when on sale4) Recommended5) Highly recommended6) This is a must playIf you found this review helpful, please consider giving it a thumbs up. You can also find more reviews over at http://www.completingthebackloggroup.com/Please also check out Completing the Backlog's Curator page here - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games! Who should come hither-1. People who don't mind reading- like a lot of reading.2. Philosophical adventurers looking for commentary on religion, consciousness, AI, faith, and living.  3. Puzzle game lovers (obviously) looking for something like Portal but tonally serious.Who should run away-1. People who don't like reading.2. People who might not endure their religious view get challenged.I personally consider games (video games for the pedantic) to be the Greatest Form of Art. Between the botched AAA releases, the toxicity that follows, the pain of the devs, and the money hungriness of the publishers, it is very easy to forget what games can be. ♥♥♥♥-Talos Principle is puzzle game and my only qualm is with the puzzles. They are great in the beginning and can be often challenging. However, later in the game I was so invested in the story that solving puzzles made me feel that the core gameplay is getting the way. However, that's purely personal taste and I don't think anyone reading should read too much into it.Conclusion - It is my great delight to have played Talos Principle. It reaffirms my faith in games and work of devs. It is also made me aware the rights issue that will ensue once AIs become more human like.

Probably *the* premiere puzzle game of all time, with a healthy dose of philosophy. Completely inoffensive (could recommend to my grandmother) and thought provoking, the game reminds me of some of the best sci-fi authors and books such as Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep? by Philip K. ♥♥♥♥, Her Smoke Rose Up Forever (specifically "The Girl Who Was Plugged In") by James Tiptree Jr. (Alice Sheldon's pseudonym), and anything by Isaac Asimov dealing with AI, the most obvious being the I, Robot short stories (especially Little Lost Robot).I recommend working on these puzzles in spurts, don't burn yourself out.10/10 - Masterpiece

如果你在高中课程的学习中选择了文科，那么在学习政治必修四：生活与哲学的时候，肯定被老师或是教辅书强调过：大脑和人脑的表述要区分开。因为意识是人脑的机能，不是大脑的机能。在论述意识范畴时，务必要使用“人脑“这个表述。不过，如果一个AI能够拥有媲美人脑的智力和学习能力，那么它可以成为一个人吗？这是无数机器人题材的文化都试图探讨的问题。不过目前来说，依然很难有一个统一的定论，因为这涉及太多伦理问题，甚至还威胁到人类食物链顶端的地位。这部3D解密游戏的背景剧情也在讨论这个问题，而且让玩家来扮演这个刚刚生成的新AI。这是一个从混沌中苏醒的有着机器人外表的人工智能，它将在你的操控下，解开一个又一个谜题，探寻哲学三大终极问题。“我是谁？”“我从哪里来？”“我要到哪里去？”相信你能扮演好这个机器人，找到问题的答案。不过换句话说，坐在屏幕前的你本来就是一个人类。你要如何通过自己的行动，通过自己对测试问卷的答案，给一个观察着一切的Admin证明，你是一个人类呢？这就是塔洛斯法则，只有证明自己是一个人类，你才能通过它。游戏最精彩的地方是游戏开头和游戏结局。（有多少人在第一次目睹那高耸入云的神秘高塔后受到了震撼？有多少人在游戏的结尾见到【剧透内容数据删除】后心中百感交集？）而游戏的正片过程充满了代表人类文明的不同风格的景色，上百个需要你绞尽脑汁去解决的谜题关卡，充满思辨色彩和黑色幽默的问答，各种各样的联动彩蛋。但在主线剧情上没有太大的起伏，容易使急于挥散自己心中疑团的玩家抓狂。+优秀的谜题设计+非线性的解谜给玩家更多自由空间+时间胶囊中的中文女性声音配音非常到位+史诗般的场景，史诗般的剧情以及史诗般的BGM-有一些能够用于投机取巧的BUG-中文文本有机翻的嫌疑-许多人反映会有晕眩感，比HL2还严重（木哈哈我完全没有这方面的问题）

If you told me at the start of the year that a puzzle game with philosophical undertones from the developers of Serious Sam would be one of the year’s best titles, I probably wouldn’t have believed you. However this is very much the case as The Talos Principle is a fascinating and mentally invigorating experience with clever puzzles and a highly intriguing philosophy laden science fiction backdrop. The game slowly generates an atmosphere of mind-bending contemplation unlike anything I have experienced before in games thanks to a potent mixture of clever writing and music that starts to get under your skin. I think only 2001 A Space Odyssey has given me the same feeling before. The puzzles themselves are the star of the show however with a good difficulty curve and consistently excellent design. Some puzzles which have you dodging floating mines can be annoying, but the vast majority require clever thinking rather than quick reflexes or good timing. The puzzles are short but require you to use existing mechanics in new and surprising ways. The game lets you figure almost everything for yourself, from the story to the mechanics, but the world and puzzles are laid out in such a way that this is generally not a problem. There are loads of secrets/optional challenges that help add further substance to the game after you finish working through the main set of puzzles. I did not spend a lot of time going after these and finished the game in about 15 hours, I would say it is well worth the forty dollar asking price. If you have even a passing interest in puzzle games and don’t mind confronting some heavy philosophical/nihilist ideas (among some more hopeful ones), I can’t recommend The Talos Principle highly enough.
Came for the puzzles stayed for an existential crisis.
Уже на одном из самых первых уровней можно найти котиков, так что надо брать.

If you're going to buy this game anyway, do yourself a favour and switch to the "legacy - pre se2017" beta before downloading.I adore this game. As you can see, I've put more hours than anyone reasonably should into it. I do still think it's an amazing game, but after what's happened in the "recent" updates I can no longer recommend it.On February 23rd 2019, after over a year without any updates at all, they suddenly came out with the beta that ruined everything. The older version itself was released 8 months after the one before it, it basically seemed like support for the game had ended. But out of nowhere they came and upgraded the entire engine. Normally this would be seen as a sign of great devs, but it introduced so many small issues that have never been fixed.One of the biggest changes was that they removed 32 bit, open gl,  and directx 11 support. Have an older pc that barely fits the minimum posted requirements? Won't work on current patch. Most people will only find this out when they've downloaded everything and the game refuses to launch, and if they troubleshoot enough they'll find out they just need to redowload the whole game on an older version. The only place is says this is a pinned thread in the forums, which no one will check untill they start having issues, there's no warning on the store page or when you try run the (non-existent) 32 bit version.Another big issue was licence validation, though this seems to be mostly fixed now. The update added stricter license checks, which caused many false positives on people who legitimately bought the game and hadn't tampered with files, preventing them from even launching the game.But the biggest crime is what they did to the workshop. It is completly unusable now. 4 years of mods all gone. There were some amazing custom campaigns (Rebirth, Schrödinger Cat, Only Puzzles 2) that could easily add hundreds of hours of playtime, but you can't play any of them anymore. The update changed where the maps are stored on disk, but just moving them over isn't enough. They also redid how light maps, and a few other mostly irrelevant features, work, so every single map has to be re-saved to work. These old map makers from years ago aren't all going to come back just for that. But to add insult to injury, once you've fixed everything, you can't even upload your fix. They broke workshop uploads. This was all reported months ago ( https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/464416372756054027/642277787008368641/State_of_the_Workshop.png ) but we've never gotten more than a "we're looking into it". The entire workshop has been unusable for months and nothing. It adds so much extra content and replayability to the game but nothing. This is why I cannot recommend this game.Now if you switch to the beta I mentioned at the top this all goes away, it just starts working again, you can play existing maps and upload your own all fine. This is why, if the rest of my review hasn't persuaded you, I still highly recommend switching into that beta.

「알려진 세계의 가장자리로 여행. 지금은 광범위하게이 땅을 여행하고, 나는 이것이 가장 아름다운 장소라고 주저없이 말할 수있다. 나는 일 동안이 문제로 어려움을 겪고 있었어요 것처럼 느낀다. 놀라운 힘은 먼 진행 사람들을 부여 들어, 경로에 충실. 때때로 당신은 장벽을 무너 뜨리는 용기를 찾을 수있다.」당신은 시뮬레이션 속에서 깨어난 로봇입니다. 그리고 당신의 아버지를 자처하는 엘로힘이라는 존재의 목소리가 들려옵니다. '내 아들아, 퍼즐을 풀고 표식을 모아 영원한 생명에 이르도록 하거라. 그러나 한 가지 믿음의 약속을 하자. 중앙에 있는 거대한 탑만큼은 오르지 말거라.'이 게임은 고대부터 오래도록 전해지고 있는 다음의 질문들을 던집니다."우리는 인공 지능이 우리에게 어떤 의미를 주며, 어떻게 세계에 대한 이해를 바꿀지 계속 토의하고 있습니다. 이건 우리가 광범위하게 다뤘던 위대한 주제이죠. 하지만 우리는 그 문제의 반대면에 대해 거의 언급하지 않았습니다. 이 창조물은 어떻게 될까요? 그는 세상을 어떻게 생각할까요?" "그들이 정말 두려워하는 것은 의식이 물질에서 발생한다는 것을 누군가 결국 증명하는 거예요. 만약 우리가 자각을 지닌 존재를 창조했다면, 영혼은 어디에 있을까요?" "자신이 극복하려고 시도조차 하지 못한 삶의 경계에서 얼마나 많은 희망과 소망이 흘러갔을까요?" "우주가 목적을 가졌다고 해서 그것이 우리를 중심으로 도는 건 아니야. 놀랄지 모르겠지만, 우리는 신 앞에서 그렇게 미천한 존재는 아니지 않을까?"얼핏 들으면 어렵기만 하고 실은 애초부터 답을 찾을 수 있는 문제도 아닌 것들이지만, 탈로스 법칙이 만들어낸 아름다운 세상이 주는 경외심은 결국 플레이어를 심적으로 빠져들게 합니다(다만 주로 텍스트로 전달되고 있는 만큼 하나하나 읽어가면서 진행하는 걸 싫어하시는 분들은 좋아하지 않을지도 모르겠습니다). 엘로힘과 대립하는 도서관 사서 프로그램 밀튼의 존재가 백미죠. 심미적인 요소뿐만 아니라 게임의 본분도 잊지 않아서 종내의 목적이 될 붉은색 조각 퍼즐 등은 한참 동안 들여다보고 있으면 풀 수 있을 정도만큼 적당히 어렵습니다. 포탈을 재밌게 플레이하셨다면 탈로스 법칙도 분명히 취향에 맞으리라 생각합니다. 일부 번역이 분명히 구글 번역기를 돌렸습니다만 게임 진행에는 전혀 지장이 없는 부분이고, 고의적으로 그렇게 놔두었다고 생각하면 그것도 그런대로 괜찮은듯(..). 그리고 한국어 음성이 추가되었네요! 흔치 않은 일인데 크로팀 참 괜찮은 제작사입니다. 영어 원판의 경이롭기까지 한 퀄리티에는 역시 따라가지 못합니다만, 우리말 더빙 수준도 훌륭해서 놀랐습니다. 엔딩을 보는 과정 속에서는 개인적으로 좀 감격스러웠네요... 솔직히 메타스코어 80점대가 너무 과소평가된 게 아닌가 싶습니다. "...우리가 가졌던 가치를 똑같이 간직할 건가요? 우리를 어떻게 생각하나요? 당신이 만드는 세상은 우리와 같을까요? 아니면 너무 달라서 상상조차 할 수 없을까요? 어쨌든, 난 당신이 이 작은 행성을 우리가 그랬던 것처럼 아름답다고 생각하길 바라요. 그리고 언젠가 하늘을 올려다보고 별에게 닿을 수 있기를 바라요." 총평은 대단히 아름다운 게임입니다. 포탈과 비교해 볼 때 전체적으로 방을 하나씩 클리어해 간다는 점에서는 비슷한 양상을, 속도감 있는 플레이 대신 주어진 여러 도구를 가지고 천천히 숙고하며 진행한다는 점에서는 차이를 가지고, 높은 텍스트 비중이나 비선형 구조 등 포탈보다 접근성이 떨어진다는 한계가 있는 반면 스토리텔링과 사운드트랙은 이쪽이 월등합니다. 초중반부 계속되는 퍼즐에 질려 주춤하는 구간이 있을 수도 있겠지만 한 번 클리어하신다면 그 정도의 단점은 벌써 잊고 남들에게 이 게임을 추천하고 있는 자신을 볼 수 있을 겁니다. 제값을 주고 사도 아깝지 않을 작품이겠네요.퍼즐 구성 7/10시각적인 아름다움 9/10스토리텔링(심미적 요소) 9/10성우 8/10(한국어) 12/10(영어) ★★★사운드트랙 12/10 ★★★

The puzzles are neat. I'd describe them as similar to Portal in terms of difficulty. But there is no timing or motor skills required. It's more like a good game of chess in a way, where you need to figure out the right move at the right time.But what makes this game extraordinary is its story. It blew my mind, not just the conclusion, but throughout the game, the little fragments of texts you will find and read. I couldn't possibly say anything here, because I don't want to spoil the experience for you. My advice is: buy when the price seems reasonable (it's often on -85% sale), don't read too many reviews beforehand, just jump in completely unprepared and enjoy.

V roce 2011 vyšel Portal 2 a usedl na pomyslný trůn 3D logických her. Po celé tři roky se mu nikdo ani nepřiblížil a každý vyzyvatel selhal a upadl v zapomnění. A pak přišel The Talos Principle. Hra od chorvatského Croteam (bezhlavá FPS série Serious Sam), Toma Juberta (FTL, The Swapper) a Jonase Kyratzese (The Sea Will Claim Everything). Talos nejenže vyzval Portal 2 na souboj, ale také ho totálně rozdrtil a udělal si z něj svého poskoka. A vyhrál díky těmto věcem:Příběh a postavyNa začátku hry se ocitnete v kůži jakéhosi robota. Nevíte, kde jste, kdo jste, co tam děláte a co je vaším účelem. Poté uslyšíte shůry hlas Boha (zde nazývaného Elohim). Ten vám sdělí, že máte projít několika testy a pokud všechny vyřešíte, budete hodni projít bránou a žít věčně. Také vás zároveň ale varuje před Věží, která se vzpírá k temnému nebi a je na ní něco znepokojivého, abyste se jí vyhnuli a vůbec do ní nevstupovali. V průběhu hry ale budete všude nalézat nejrůznější náznaky toho, že tu něco nehraje, a tak sami brzy dojdete ke konečnému rozhodnutí. Hra má tedy více konců, konkrétně tři. A každý z nich je něčím zajímavý nebo dokonce i smutný či plný naděje.Opakem Elohima, tedy jakéhosi Boha, je Milton. Budete si s ním psát a to on vás začne nahlodávat. Netají vám tento samozvaný Bůh něco? Co se skrývá ve Věži? Co je tohle za místo? Co tu vůbec děláte a kdo jste? Mimo těchto základních otázek (na které najdete odpovědi), jsou tu také filozofické. Ale o tom později.Kromě Elohima a Miltona je tu také ženská postava. Přesněji řečeno to jsou časové kapsle, které jsou rozesety po levelech a můžete si je poslechnout. Žena jménem Alexandra nahrála své myšlenky a pocity a dost tak osvětlí děj.Hra teda nabízí „jen“ 3 charaktery, ale každý z nich má svou vlastní osobnost a jejich dabing je...Audiovizuální stránka... perfektní. Až uslyšíte hromový hlas Elohima, jeho náhlé zvolání nebo jen prostou radu, vždy budete mít pocit, že je opravdu někde tam na nebi a že je to skutečný Bůh. U Alexandry je dabing také na velice vysoké úrovni a opravdu jde cítit z jejích projevů emoce. Někdy radost, jindy smutek.Co je úchvatnějšího než perfektní dabing? Hudba. Talos je první hra, kde jsem si řekl, že si koupím DLC se soundtrackem ze hry. Proč? Protože hudba je tu to, co tvoří atmosféru. Postavy promluví jen občas, ale vždy hraje něco na pozadí, něco klidnějšího, milého nebo něco drsného a temného. Hudba doplňuje dění na obrazovce a už jen písnička v menu vás odzbrojí a budete jen sedět a poslouchat ty skvostné vokály.A když už jsem nakousl to dění na obrazovce... Ano, grafika je tu dokonalá. Nejde jen o míru detailů, ale také o celkový dojem. Západ slunce, déšť a následné vyjasnění, hory a sníh, pouště - to všechno působí neuvěřitelně reálně a člověk by se neustále jen kochal prostředím.Postup hrou a hádankyZ výše vypsaného vám asi došlo, že tahle hra nebude žádný průměr. V porovnání s Portalem 2 jí ale chybí dvě důležité věci. A to je černý humor (humor jako takový tu je, jen si musíte číst články a nebo tu můžete i hledat desítky easter eggů) a coop (kvůli příběhu tu není vůbec multiplayer).Někteří z vás teď jistě znejistěli. Ale právě v tento okamžik přichází jeden z nejlepších rozdílů oproti sérii Portal. Otevřený svět. Ano, čtete správně. Dost často mi vadilo, jak jsem v Portalu musel řešit jen tu jednu jedinou hádanku, abych se dostal k další. Tady nic takového nehrozí. Zpočátku sice jste trochu omezeni, ale po vyřešení 3 nejlehčích hádanek máte první sérii levelů jen a jen pro sebe a je jen čistě na vás, co vyřešíte první a co si necháte naposled. Díky tomu se zmírňuje frustrace. Když si prostě s něčím nevíte rady, vrhnete se na jinou hádanku.Celé to navíc funguje dokonale díky lehce pochopitelnému systému. Za každou vyřešenou hádanku (jedna hádanka = jedna jakoby místnost) získáte sigil, což je víceméně dílek ze Tetrisu. Tento sigil má různou barvu, dle svého uplatnění:    Zelený sigil - lehké hádanky; odemknete s nimi východ z budovy A a vchody do budovy B a C    Žlutý sigil - středně těžké hádanky; odemknete s nimi nejrůznější vybavení, díky kterému můžete vyřešit náročnější hádanky (např. věže s laserem, větráky, kostky atd.)    Červený sigil - těžké hádanky; vyřešením všech 49 hádanek získáte přístup jak k věčnému životu, tak i k Věži    Šedý sigil - v průběhu hry narazíte na hvězdičky, které jsou takovým bonusem a pokud je posbíráte všechny, odemknou se vám celkem 3 speciální levely, ve kterých získáte právě tyto šedé sigily, jejichž použití je spoilerem, takže napíšu jen to, že tyhle hádanky jsou opravdu extrémní a prověří vše, co jste se za celou hru naučiliK úspěšnému dokončení hry tedy potřebujete posbírat zelené, žluté a červené sigily. Posbíráním zelených získáte přístup k dalším dvěma budovám. Každá ze tří budov má sedm lokací. V každé lokaci je určitý počet hádanek a před každou z nich vidíte, jaké prvky se při jejím řešení využijí.Posbíráním žlutých sigilů získáte přístup k věcem, které nutně potřebujete pro vyřešení určitých hádanek.Červené sigily - buď se můžete po jejich posbírání vrhnout do dveří zajišťující věčný život nebo můžete jít do Věže a odemknout si její patra. O Věži nechci moc psát, ale prozradím, že i tady na vás čeká pár záludných hádanek, přičemž u té poslední mi vadil styl ukládání hry, ale chápu, že to patřilo k příběhu.Ach ano, ukládání. Vše se ukládá automaticky. Hra vám dokonce při vypnutí i sdělí, kdy se naposledy uložila. Ukládání funguje na jednoduchém principu. Na začátku hádanky projdete fialovým polem a hra se uloží. Jestliže selžete při řešení hádanky (=umřete, což se opravdu občas stane), hra vás pošle opět na začátek.FilozofieAno, i ta tady je. Při průchodu hrou si můžete všímat příběhu nebo jej zcela ignorovat a považovat to jen za logickou hru. A také můžete číst desítky textů a přemýšlet nad otázkami ohledně života, smrti, lidství, náboženství, víry atp. Ať už je to Milton, Alexandra nebo útržek nějakého textu, vždy je možné se nad něčím zamyslet a přemýšlet o tom. Nejdále tu zašel právě Milton, který se vás bude ptát na spoustu otázek a jen na vás, jak mu odpovíte.Plusy+ božská hratelnost+ úchvatná atmosféra už od začátku hry až do jejího konce+ spousta hádanek (od těch, které projdete s prstem v nose až po ty, u kterých se pořádně zapotíte)+ parádní dabing+ vynikající atmosférická hudba+ úžasná grafika+ tajemný a zajímavý příběh+ promyšlené postavy+ hledání skrytých hvězd+ spousta záznamů na čtení/poslech (které doplňují atmosféru hry)+ desítky easter eggů+ tři konce+ délka hry (splnil jsem každičkou hádanku a hrál jsem ji 24 hodin)+ pracuje se na češtiněMínusyŽádné!Konečný verdiktMé hodnocení: 10/10Ten pocit, když jsem se po dvaceti hodinách dostal na konec hry a sledoval poslední video. Když jsem věděl, že skončila hra a cítil jsem v kostech, že končí i něco jiného. Byl jsem šťastný a smutný zároveň. The Talos Principle je zkrátka něco dokonalého, jedna z těch mála her, která nemá žádnou chybu a je skutečně po celou dobu hraní báječná.
A game that makes you think about many things. Starting with using that gray matter to solve puzzles and finishing with trying to solve your own existential crisis.
я тупой
游戏还行，就是能把打一个小时吐十分钟的设定取消就好了。
7/10+仅由少有的几个道具，却创造出多样的关卡和解谜方式+作为一个解密游戏画质可观、部分地图设计十分出彩且BGM舒缓耐听{如信使住地}+令人惊艳的普通话、粤语配音和优秀的汉化水平+方块拼图和二维码的设定简单却有趣+游戏操作简单、成就设置合理、还有多种可选择的结局-小部分关卡设计不太合乎逻辑、过关的方式比较依赖突然的灵感-游戏观感较奇特，小部分玩家游戏过程中会有眩晕感总体来说十分优秀，值得入手。

ecco un nuovo rompicapo / puzzle game realizzato in modo impeccabile che non ha niente da invidiare al lavoro svolto dalla Valve ♥♥♥ Portal.laddove Portal 2 inseriva il giocatore in un contesto fantascientifico ricco di comicità e ♥♥♥ qualche momento drammatico ,qui i ragazzi  di Croteam ( quelli di Serious Sam che ♥♥♥ The Talos Principle non ha niente a che fare XD ) insieme a Tom Jubert ( autore di The Swapper e FTL ) prendono una direzione completamente diversa, immergendoci in un mondo misterioso e immerso in costruzioni che ricordano alcune delle civiltà classiche dell'umanità dove il tema centrale è l'esistenza del singolo ( che sia umano o androide ) e il suo relazionarsi al mondo che lo circonda.senza spoilerare nulla, la storia va avanti su due binari paralleli , da una parte segue il giocatore che impersona un androide dotato di una coscienza e pensiero propri ( che saranno quelli del giocatore stesso ) e il suo creatore secondo un archetipo biblico ( Dio, Adamo, il giardino dell'eden, il libero arbitrio) e dall'altra dei terminali sparsi nel mondo di gioco ricchi do  riferimenti e testi di varia natura, sia filosofici che insieme a testi riguardanti l'origine del mondo in cui si sta giocando. Potrebbe sembrare qualcosa di pesante e noioso ma vi assicuro la trama si sviluppa in modo molto naturale e fluido stimoltando l'interesse in maniera crescente senza forzature varie;personalmente l'ho molto apprezzata e ha saputo soddisfare le aspettative sia a livello narrativo che a livello emotivo.il gameplay è quello di risolvere dei puzzle / rompicapo a difficoltà crescente da svolgere man mano che si sbloccano nuove strumenti e nuove aree di gioco, giocabile sia in prima che in terza persona; inizialmente sono semplici ma ♥♥♥ il passare del tempo mettono a dura prova la sostanza grigia cerebrale XDuna volta superati quelli più complessi ( i 3/5 del totale ) il senso di soddisfazione è molto appagante.inoltre nel gioco sono nascosti numerosi easter egg dedicati al mondo videolutico ♥♥♥ numerose citazioni e autocitazioni che fanno sorridere molto.l'unica pecca è la traduzione in lingua italiana dei testi che alcune volte lascia a desiderare mentre il doppiaggio si assesta su ottimi livelli; nel caso conosciate bene la lingua inglese è consigliato optare per i testi in lingua originaleconsigliato a chiunque voglia cimentarsi in un rompicapo ben fatto, a chi ama storie ben raccontate e a chi è in cerca di esperienze  videolutiche diverso dal solito

如果一个问题比你的生命还长，那你该如何解决？ 游戏内的这句话，是整个游戏故事始因。当这句话的主语是“人类文明”时，这句话和另一个文明相关的问题不谋而合： "如果人类文明必将毁灭，我们应该采取什么措施使后人知道我们存在过，兴旺过？" 塔洛斯的法则应该是我游戏生涯中最喜欢的一部作品之一，不逊色于星际拓荒，二代已经官宣了，期待二代。我并非解谜游戏爱好者。诚然，解谜是游戏的主要内容，而且游戏内的各类谜题富有挑战性和解题成就感。但若仅仅是解谜好玩，我大概并不会这么认可这款游戏。解谜不是这款游戏的所有内容：还有着大量的人类录音、终端机文本、小助手对话构成了游戏的内核，通过碎片化叙事的方式向玩家展示了另一个谜题的谜面，讨论了人性、意识、知识与求知欲，不断深化地探讨“人何以为人”。你的旅途中会遇见很多终端机，里面记载了很多人类视角对以上问题的思考的零碎的信息，游戏的哲学主题非常深刻，文明的古遗迹、禁忌的知识、神的花园、高耸入云的塔、蛇的的劝诱…各种诉诸在宗教上的隐喻我真的太爱了，无数的隐喻引人深思。更有着在终端机上“蛇”的不断诘问和辩驳，其中不少关于人性、道德和知识相关问题的问答，经常使玩家陷入道德和理性的二律背反，在这antinomy其上的领会和联想使我对这个游戏的理解有着很大的冲击与不可思议。此外Alexandra (人类关于这一AI计划的创造者)对那时尚未出世的人工智能留下的“遗言”，一段又一段录音讲诉人类对世界的真相的苦苦追寻，以及对化身为“人”的AI怀抱人类文明火种传承下去的期盼，令人感动。而你，你作为一个刚刚生成的人工智能，你将跟随Elohim的引导，解开花园中全部的谜题。你将证明自己拥有人一样的完全智力，拥有迈入永生的“殿堂”的资格。但你，你坐在屏幕前的你本来就是一个人类。你要如何通过自己的行动，通过自己对测试问卷的答案，给一个观察着一切的Admin证明，你是一个人类呢？这就是塔罗斯的法则，只有证明自己是一个人类，你才能通过它。你解开游戏中的谜题，轻松的证明了你有着使用工具的智力，学习新工具的使用方法，能够进行反思并且重新尝试.......但并不只是如此。面对”上帝“给你带来永生的诱惑，你选择保持对神的忠诚？还是转向蛇的诱惑，探求那禁忌的秘密？那阴云密布的高塔顶端到底隐藏了什么样的秘密？曾经有多少个我来到这个世界？我又是谁？这个世界因什么而存在? 你开始不由自主地思考我是谁？我从哪儿来？我要到哪儿去？最终，你将目光投射到那高耸入云的毁灭之塔。那个Elohim万般回避的场所，the tower上，亦有不少sheeps的留言。与花园中形形色色的言论不同的是，tower上的讨论的焦点，完全在于对authority和curiosity of truth的矛盾中。而众多的言语者当中，shepherd（牧羊人）和samsara（轮回，这两个名字也很有深意）作为两个对立的前辈，各自以自己的言论去影响着后来的人做出自己的选择。这里，我们并不能说他两哪个到底更理解自身环境的现实，因为作为sheeps，他俩都获取了同样的信息，掌握了同样的权限，这反而令我感到困惑：到底什么导致了在其他成分完全一致的情况下，shepherd和samsara做出了截然相反的self-ending？倘若我们坚持所谓的决定论，在代码被执行之后，与环境的相互作用导致了这样的差异的话，那么是否可以这样认为：humanity在自然的演绎过程中，在历代的部落，社群演化过程中，差异性创造出了新的可能性？shepherd和samsara两个前辈最终我们在塔顶相遇，最后一次登塔的解谜极具创意设计。不仅具有相当难度，也在塑造两位前辈的形象上点上画龙点睛的最后一笔，呜呜呜shepherd，它望着我飞上天空，自己却留在了这个即将毁掉的世界。说到这里，不得不提DLC中的Uriel和Admin，同样留在了即将毁灭的"地狱"。“看来你我终究要留在这里了”我想我们真是天作之合。至少值得庆幸的是，我们能一起观赏世界末日”Uriel这个取名也很有深意(如果了解犹太神话的话)。不过想了很多还是不剧透了——只说一定要玩，太震撼了，DLC无论剧情还是谜题都是整个游戏的精华所在。除了这些，神或者说Elohim也很有意思，人类科学家们在制造Elohim时，它便知道自己存在的意义就是让程序内的人工智能通过测试，测试一旦通过，那么自己作为测试程序的意义就不存在了。换句话说，测试结束的时刻，就是Elohim死亡的时刻。但Elohim同时也知道，自己的目的是让AI通过这个测试——虽然这个目的会让自己“死去”。因为害怕消失，Elohim会在游戏中向被测试的AI许诺“永生”，即在“完成所有谜题后，通过大门，能够获得永生”，而AI如果听信Elohim，穿过了这扇大门，则会被删除。AI产生的数据会部分地整合到数据库中，并且通过迭代和随机产生下一个版本的AI，开始下一次测试。只有解决所有谜题，并且登上塔顶（而非穿过大门），才算是AI个体拥有了自我意志，违背了Elohim所下达的指令。因此在不断的测试中，无数AI被迭代，直到这次，由玩家控制的AI从一片光中诞生——版本号：v99.73.0001。新的一轮测试开始了。你向前一步，而天空中传来声音。Behold, my child.且慢，我的孩子。You are risen from the dust, and you walk in my garden.你从尘埃中复活，你行于我的花园。Hear now my voice,聆听我的声音，and know that I am your maker,知晓我是你的创造者，and I am called ELOHIM.而我名为：埃洛希姆。Elohim到底是出于一种怎样的需求，而被创造出来的呢？主角在寻求humanity的过程中对花园中的环境的各种反馈，与我们真实的人类演化中，神学出现的必然性的联系。Elohim本身掌控着花园的全部，并不止一次的显示他的权威，然而他的言语却不会对主角造成任何实质性的逼迫，或者说他似乎对强加某种所谓“正确”的东西无能为力，亦或者说，他并没有所谓真正的，想要强加给主角的任何意识。我们回顾人类自身的发展史，humanity的真实性到底经历了多久的考验呢，已经无从得知了，而神性，或者说神的存在，亦只是其中的一种人在自身探索的修行中的一部分罢了。但是可以断言的是，人类的发展史绝非一种添加名词，添加形容词式的过程，它包含了超越现下已知的物理规律的解释范围，绝非我们通过代码来实现人的一切模拟那么简单。在神的伊甸园里，除了神以外当然还有蛇：archive，或者称为档案助手。它的对话则会让被测试的AI在游戏过程中对Elohim产生怀疑（archive不会向AI坦承Elohim的真实目的，而是不断向AI提出诘问，有犬儒主义的个性），非常符合我对“圣经蛇”的印象：擅长诡辩、不断质问。此外当全收集解开所有谜题后还有一个隐藏结局，在这个结局中，AI完成了所有的正常和隐藏谜题，成为了elohim的信使。而这一最麻烦的、完美收集的结局却并非好结局，相当讽刺——似乎昭示了你无需解开所有谜题，因为人本身就并非十全十美的。当你做到极致完美，那你将不再是“人”。游戏中最重要的问题：为什么科学家们要这么做？为什么科学家们认为TALOS项目——一旦成功——它就成为了一个人？为什么科学家们想要延续人？最后用Alexandra Drennan死前的最后一段语音来结个尾，这段话也是对Talos Principle（作为一个游戏，同时作为一个哲学术语）本身最好的诠释：Alexandra Drennan a écrit : I… I can’t keep my eyes open anymore. I think this… this is it. The end of… me. I… I don’t believe that I will continue to exist. I would like to think there is a… a soul or spirit. Some part of my… consciousness that will persist. But all… all the evidence says that when my brain dies, I will be…Gone.I’ve lived my life never turning away from the truth, even if it scares me. And… I can face this… face… my own end… and… and say… with absolute conviction…that it was good to be human. 总结一下优缺点：优点：解谜很好玩，本体不算太难。但Road To Gehenna 难度更高，且剧情和本体无缝衔接。十分推荐音乐很好听，The dance of eternity真的好听到哭。除了这个外也有一些气势宏大的史诗风音乐。美术内涵优秀。三大场景(古罗马、古埃及、中世纪)有种跨越人类历史的沧桑感，和哲学、宗教、人、意识、理性这些主题内核的庄重感完美结合。超级超级超级多的彩蛋缺点：3D优化不好，简单来说就是对晕3D人士不友好——你还别说，这游戏还真有VR版，而且VR版还不怎么晕，没本作(原版)晕（至少我这么觉得）这游戏内文本极佳，但中译很差，错译太多。配音也是，我感觉英配更好一点。(翻译有繁中，但我更推荐英版)

9.5/10带机翻中文字幕的游戏有很多，这个游戏让我震惊的是——它竟然还配了音！两个声优，声情并茂地，用标准的普通话朗读着蹩脚的台词。我就纳闷了，中文说得这么好一看就是母语吧那怎么就不给改改那些垃圾翻译呢？没玩几关就切回英语，阅读量很大，读起来脑袋疼，也读不太懂，这样我都没再换回中文。最后玩完出制作名单的时候，在翻译一栏我目瞪口呆地看到了中文翻译团队——不是机翻啊朋友们！真的请了一个团队来做啊！Gorgone Productions——记住这个名字，让我们把它钉在耻辱柱上！

Avant d'acheter ce jeu je voulais quelque chose de semblable à Portal 2. La page du magasin ne m'as pas spécialement attiré mais j'ai quand même regardé les évaluations et j'ai finis par l'acheter. J'ai des sueurs froides en me disant que j'etais à un clic de ne jamais jouer à ce jeu...Si vous aimez les puzzle games et les questions existentielles / métaphysiques, foncez vous ne pourrez pas être déçu.Ce jeu est une bouffée d'air frais, pas seulement par ses thèmes mais aussi par sa direction artistique: c'est extrèmement apaisant.Je me rend compte que aucun des mots que j'ai écris ou que je pourrais écrire ne pourrait décrire cette oeuvre d'art alors je vais me taire. De toute manière rien ne vaut la découverte!Bon jeu!

Very nifty and unique puzzle game, best of its kind I've played since Portal. Definitely worth checking out if you want a smart game that'll actually challenge you to think (outside the box too). It's actually rare to find a game experience like this nowadays that isn't all about linear action or a single "goal" but more progressing at your own pace and provoking thoughts about the world you're in. Well optimized with great graphics too.Difficulty is lenient unlike in many other puzzle games and you're not forced to complete every single puzzle which is a huge plus. Instead, should you face an "unbeatable" puzzle (as you no doubt will, there's plenty of them :P) you can just opt to go to another area for an easier puzzle instead. And the world to explore is huge and you have no shortage of various puzzles to engage in, so the possibility of getting "stuck" is much lower than in other games of its kind.All this coming from a developer that previously made much simpler Serious Sam shooters, so give them some props, this game deserves your attention. The leap from Sam's storytelling and gameplay to this is just huge.

If you like Portal, you will like this game!If you study philosophy, you will like this game!If you study math, you will like this game!If you study  religion, you will like this game!If you study  physics, you will like this game!....If you play CoD, you will die. Slowly.

十分出色的作品！這個遊戲整體的高質素令我不忍心做分拆式的評論。首先要讚揚一下，這個遊戲竟然支持中文語音，而且配音專業水準。這亦係我steam上第二個遇到的廣東話配音遊戲（第一個爲Sleeping Dogs）。塔羅斯是我玩過的所有解密遊戲中，進行思考最深入的一個，無論是其解密元素抑或是其哲學內涵。玩的時候，我會不自覺地將其與傳送門作對比。誠然，無論是劇情的表現，或是角色之間的聯動，塔羅斯都遜色於傳送門。不過，我覺得其謎題難度更勝一籌。尤爲可貴的是，隨著遊戲進展，塔羅斯法則的理念被逐漸揭示開來——關於AI與人類、關於質疑與相信、關於服從與叛逆。遊戲中的一問一答使得玩家去思考：究竟甚麼樣的AI算是真正的人類？而這個問題在遊戲的最後一刻得到揭示，如同高潮的宣洩一般，整個人得到升華。（我應該衹打出了真結局）* 以下內容涉及劇透 當我成功穿過六層高塔突破阻撓時，埃洛希姆發出的不再先前的憤怒，反而是釋然的歎息，隱約之中透露出解放的喜悅。那一刻我走出大門，陽光沐浴下的人類廢墟中，文明種子仿佛重新在緩緩發芽。自由的機器人，自由的意志。附：http://www.zhihu.com/question/31334253/answer/7211610010 / 10感謝 @Perh 分享！

二维码内容：玩这个游戏请空腹。【某个因为玩了两小关差点把晚餐吐出来的解谜爱好者留】--------------------------------------------------------------------广告内容：你想体验一把智商欠费的美妙感觉吗？玩塔罗斯法则吧！！你想尝试一下智商严重欠费的绝妙感觉吗？玩塔罗斯法则前往地狱DLC吧！！那里是智商平庸者的地狱，也是智商超常者的地狱，还是智商不能直视者的地狱。--------------------------------------------------------------------最后补充：调小屏幕宽度和高度，再把玩家速度设定成最快，耍上90个小时，即可有效治愈3D眩晕症。游戏攻略的正确姿势：用神之魔符的答案解锁3个额外星星---》A世界B世界---》和ABC全部电脑对话收集书面内容、塔以外全部录音，打3信使关、2星星关---》此后在C最初几个魔符的时候埃洛西姆会突然和你说话，提醒你提防诱惑，此时调戏电脑剧情正式开始---》先不和电脑对话直到拿了所有魔符，信使关，塔1--5F，解开6F---》用塔1F连接器拿外面的星星---》131印记时候应拿到全部书面资料，全部时间胶囊录音---》和电脑对话带他走---》去B世界解救猫---》132印记时候为全资料，带米尔顿，撸猫完美结局。【之后就可以随时回档131印记花式调戏电脑登塔了，随时从132印记体验撸猫完美结局】--------------------------------------------------------------------PS：外星人我写了个游戏的同人，有点长，测评放不下【掀桌】，所以没办法只得在这里放前一半，后一半在dlc的测评里，阅览请点击：http://steamcommunity.com/id/mwxr/recommended/358470游戏攻略请看：https://steamcn.com/t213889-1-11　　【来吧，进入光明】　　TheTalosPrinciple《塔罗斯的法则》结局剧透向同人文　　　　写在前面：　　昨天，2017年11月22日星期三，外星人终于打穿了TheTalosPrinciple本体。　　我抵抗着3D眩晕症导致的强烈呕吐反应，用几近枯竭的大脑费劲梳理着剧情。　　作为一个基督徒、神秘学爱好者、喜欢哲学文学量子物理又打剑道的外星人，游戏中大量的圣经、希腊神话、埃及神话元素，交杂在我头脑中，另外还有一个雷鸣般的声音充斥其中------　　“我是埃洛西姆，是我创造了你，你在我的花园之中。”　　我知道，确切的说我熟知游戏向我展示的东西，都代表什么意义，所以我并不想像其他评价那样直接叫TA“耶和华”，因为知道这个希伯来字代表的意味。　　多次我提示自己，这不过是个游戏，不过是个游戏，占硬盘多点而已。但它令我战栗、退缩、犹豫、反感、内疚、执拗、欣喜、哀叹……卡关和翻攻略并没有影响我的多愁善感，外星人依旧在多种情感之间往来徘徊，以致于精疲力竭。　　就我而言，没有一个结局是好的，都是坏结局。　　可我却从内心更倾向于坏结局里面最坏的那个。这很糟对不对？是啊，简直糟透了……　　我不知道我将在接下来的时间里写出什么鬼东西来，只是如果不写，会憋坏的。　　那么，就这样吧。　　　　温馨提示：本文含有大量美化渲染并不和游戏剧情一模一样，所以请不要当做攻略来用，更不要之后来找我说被我坑了【自动斜眼】。艺术源于吐槽，码字高于脑洞。　　　　【苏醒】　　　　数据存档的开端，呈现一片混乱。　　日光是如此耀眼，从指缝间渗透过来。景色恍惚化为清晰，我发现自己身处某个废弃庭院。　　花草葱郁，水潭清澈，时间的刻痕附着在洁白建筑之上，和谐无比。　　“听我说，你从尘土中升起，在我的花园中行走。我是埃洛西姆，是我创造了你。”　　我安静听着，听那个凭空出现的声音肆意侵蚀刚启动不久的接收器，并迅速去解析声波包含的意思。　　好的，我是他的，这地方也是他的，一切都是他的。那么，我要做些什么？　　　　穿过回廊，跨出院门，接连不断的围墙构成单向路径。　　顺路前行，渐渐我熟悉了“花园”的规则，利用工具解除障碍干扰威胁，并在深处获得了首个“魔符”。　　身边连接捷径的栅栏隐于地下，我越发迷惑，不能了解做这些事的意义。　　为什么耳畔偶尔会发出杂音，墙壁在诡异色块中撕裂重组？不时出现，发出警惕红色镭射的危险物是从哪里来的？崎岖尽头，招惹厌烦的光幕由什么驱动？这些你是否愿意给我合理解释？　　几经破折，来到终点，白光过后方才明白，那巨大花园只是众多组成的一小部分，还有更多的未知等待挑战，更广的空间等候踏足。　　究竟，我要做些什么，埃洛西姆？　　重复？简单乏味的重复？在迷宫中疲于奔走，使用预先刻意摆放的工具拿到那奇怪的方块吗？它们到底有什么用，对于我，或者你，有什么实质的意义？　　　　埃洛西姆骗了你。　　米尔顿图书馆助手，原本只是展示不可拼接的零散档案，突然开始对我说话，鼓励我思考近乎不可能的假设。　　它藏在代码背后，在我收集信息时候总要对我说上几句：真的吗？　　是的，我知道。我知道眼前的事物到底有多虚假，他们的脆弱仅仅高于我不可摧毁少许，涂在墙壁上的黑白代码也传达了诸多同样的信息。但我现在根本不清楚该信任谁，该怀疑谁，也许连自己都不可相信。　　你们，想要从一无所有者这里得到什么？除了在界限内到处跑，利用魔符拼版解开门锁，我还拥有什么？被迫走既定路线，一番不情愿的努力过后，我是否有幸窥看真相，还是正和真相渐行渐远？我在寻找理由意义，寻找目标价值，答案在阴影之下？抑或光明之中？　　电梯停稳，步出大门，无际的冰原和不见顶端的混凝土建筑给我惊慌失措的印象时，才领会“高塔”------这个从起初被警告严禁攀登必须远离的禁地，究竟指向什么。　　它的顶端刺透乌云，雷鸣闪电和浑浊一同翻滚。仰望使我感到目眩，后退几步躲避危险气息。续而又觉得它非常可笑，自己更加可笑，竟对石头心生恐惧。　　　　回想先人留言，时而怂恿，时而劝慰，令人不知该听从哪边。米尔顿的措辞开始变得激烈，运用隐晦引向关键。另一边埃洛西姆总能适时出现，告知正确方向，警惕蛊惑言论。　　望而生畏，大门紧闭，似乎塔本身也在拒绝我的挑战。它关锁着怎样秘密？云端上面景象如何？　　“你只要记住！不要攀登高塔！”　　声音第一次充满威胁，我忌惮着收回跨上台阶的脚步，放弃鲁莽登塔。一定有方法，叫我躲开他的监视，一旦影响力消失，控制力也随之泯灭，到那时……　　为此我乖乖回到花园，着手解决“坟墓”和“圣所”下面的迷宫。等时机到来工具齐备，我再回到那里去，从里面探究真实，无论他会毁灭还是塑造，都义无反顾。　　　　“你很聪明，很优秀。你解开了许多谜题……”　　每前进些，埃洛西姆总要称赞一番，话语间透着自豪欣喜。他也总不忘补充几句，重申关于高塔的禁令。　　我没试图反驳，暗中筹划逃亡计划。赞扬已经无法打动我，撼动内心疯狂膨胀的好奇，与米尔顿助手不着边际的胡乱探讨也逐渐明朗。它郑重其事提出了极具诱惑的词，自由意志。　　我有自由意志吗？有了自由意志可以成为人吗？我算不算是有自由意志的？有自由意志的青蛙与有自由意志的人类同等？　　严格的讲，不。顺服埃洛西姆，听从代码之“蛇”，我都做了“我”以外意志期望的我。你俩当中，总有一个在撒谎，更可能都在撒谎。　　若无法摆脱两边影响，那么在控制下最大化的“自由”，可以做到什么程度？我想尝试。　　　　“我为你骄傲，你解决了所有谜题！”　　大门敞开了，里面充满圣洁。一切，要结束了？　　我经历了砍去头颅天使矗立的废弃花园，狮身人面守护的古老墓地，狰狞可怖恶魔蹲伏的信念殿堂，它们如今在我周围和背后，遍布斑驳低矮狭窄，再无秘密可言。　　唯有高塔，手握打开大门的钥匙，思考决定的一步如何跨出。如果我失败而归，要怎么面对埃洛西姆？毕竟，我是他的“孩子”……　　　　【永生】　　　　嘿！我喜欢他，不是吗？　　不止喜欢，词语中还能找出更恰当的词语来形容和埃洛西姆的关系。这其中有尊重、爱戴、崇拜、倾向，还有“敬畏”……　　勇闯高塔受挫后，他轻轻责备几句，表示现在回头的话，可以得到无限的原谅。　　这话让我觉得安心，促使收拾起沮丧、挫败感，回到C建筑的下面，重新审视光之门。　　　　追寻光明的本能在躁动，帮我快速丢弃了除此以外的一切。　　危机四伏的庭院，阻碍前进的光幕，高墙、坟冢、废墟、密道，甚至美景，都不再重要。　　我所做只为一个目的------走遍为我设立的花园，解开为我安放的谜题，完成埃洛西姆的期望。　　既然他创造了我，我就有责任回报些什么。顺服，当然是最好选择。　　穿越光明，踩住高空云彩，阶梯上精金大门自动打开，富丽堂皇围绕下，一台普通样式终端安然摆放。过度的奢华不免有点俗气，好在我成功了，不消在意粗略细节。　　　　任务完成，接下来呢？　　指令被接受，准备进入永生世界。　　------ 3、2、1------　　怎么好像触发炸弹开关，倒数到0时将降临灾难？存在感消失，殿宇消失，我落进虚空，视界仅剩云朵。　　埃洛西姆颇为平淡的诉说他为我自豪，因我给后代做了很好的榜样，铺了平坦的道路，我的作为会被永远记念，并有资格留在永恒中，享受安息。　　　　等等！！那鲜红的“失败！”是什么意思？！我终究做错了、错过了什么要紧的东西吗？！　　再没有回想时间，再没有回头机会，全部努力成果被轻易剥夺。　　眼前，又有几个小字跳出：　　“删除记忆库……完成。”　　　　………………　　　　数据存档的开端，呈现一片混乱。　　日光是如此耀眼，从指缝间渗透过来。景色恍惚化为清晰，我发现自己身处某个废弃庭院。　　花草葱郁，水潭清澈，时间的刻痕附着在洁白建筑之上，和谐无比。　　“听我说，你从尘土中升起，在我的花园中行走。我是埃洛西姆，是我创造了你。”　　我安静听着，听那个凭空出现的声音肆意侵蚀刚启动不久的接收器，并迅速去解析声波包含的意思。　　　　这景色、话语，似曾相识……　　　　【永眠】　　　　我轻蔑望了眼云彩之间的金色建筑，转身离开。　　这显然不是我想要的。　　高塔的存在成为抹不掉划不去的心结，压倒了我对埃洛西姆的信赖。　　我是你的孩子，对吧？那么我理所应当继承这一切，包括高塔在内。所以我去攀登一下再回来，又有什么关系呢？　　“目标追踪失败，故障。”　　哈！他看不到我了！原来高塔可以躲开监视！　　我不禁窃喜，脚步越发轻快。所谓禁地，不过是电梯连接的谜题，深处的电脑替代了魔符，供我解开上层的封锁。　　不久我攀到最高点，兴奋的按下顶层按钮。　　那上面的是所期盼的真实吗？我已经为此付出太多，好不容易走到这一步，等待我的会是什么呢？　　　　电梯竟然下降了！经地面到达地下！　　昏暗的四壁包围，对面是传送点。我踟蹰着走入，埃洛西姆的声音复又出现。　　“很少有谁向我如此坦诚的敞开，你达到了前代难于企及的完美。”　　我成为信使，就是那在解谜时提供提示，刷写代码的存在，石棺中的永眠即是我的归宿。　　只是这样？这是我等待的光荣，寻求的真实？　　　　身后是光线触发的单侧光幕，能做的只有前进，激活魔符拼版。　　没有退路，没有选择，没有回传设置。无形力量操控身体躺入棺材，像之前解放信使时候的倒置放映。　　谁在其中掌权，谁做下这阴险决定？埃洛西姆吗？　　结局，算为沉睡中的死亡，还是假死中的永生？　　　　意识飞散，我同时看到了经历过的地方，遍布花园各处召唤信使的祭台。我将在黑暗中通过那一方墙壁向外观看，给后来者提供数量有限的固定信息，除此外再无自由。　　藏身迷宫深处，等待冲破难关的后代发现、唤醒。这到底算什么呢？　　数据库给了我一个恰当的词，来形容当前的境况：　　禁锢，于不朽。　　　　【重生】　　　　“你在干什么？！我说过不要攀登高塔！”埃洛西姆的话中，显示着少有的吃惊与愤怒。“这一切我都给你，都赐给你！只要求你不要继续攀登高塔！它不是为你准备的！这是我们之间的约定，而你破坏了这个约定！！”　　他开始央求、威胁、干扰，试图阻止。　　盘旋的阶梯使我微微眩晕，但始终没有停下脚步。　　　　再次登上平台，云彩已在脚下。　　缆绳支撑着一块块金属板，说明距终点仍有距离。　　埃洛西姆的声音伴随左右，越来越刺耳，越来越悲切。　　“你不明白吗？！高塔不是为你而存在的！攀登高塔意味着死亡，你的死亡，和我的死亡！雷电会摧毁一切！！”　　　　突然我产生一丝自责。　　他对我很好，总体来讲。　　提供帮助，适度夸奖，激励安慰，我现在做的事情显然让他伤心。这个曾经在我来讲至高无上、亲切和蔼的存在，此刻正被我挑战是否正确。　　是的，我是受到了引诱，米尔顿用稀奇古怪的逻辑从埃洛西姆那里偷走了部分信任。不过他的话不无合理，我无法反驳。　　最后我们达成了协议，一个我不大明白如何做成的协议，他便心满意足的隐去。　　　　不可能了，我无法回头。　　蛇期望的我，和埃洛西姆期望的我，我都不想做。他们谁是出于自私，谁是源自慈爱，我也不想去费力分析。　　我隐约感到，服从了任何一个，我就完了，无法可救。　　连串干扰、弹射、压板、光线反射，解除终极机关后，猛地被弹射到高空……　　　　这是什么？！　　这不是在光门后面见到过吗？！　　我曾经在那里仔细查看、勘探一番，难道最终之地仍旧是它？！　　顿时想到整个花园、谜题、高塔不过是骗局，同属一个硕大笼子里的游乐设施。我像只青蛙，或是仓鼠，傻乎乎的在转轮上狂奔，供外界观看者消遣取乐。　　“你要知道……我很害怕……”　　埃洛西姆，你该耍弄够了吧？利用我初始的无知，到后来忠信的愚蠢。我已经开始讨厌你了，讨厌你不厌其烦的唠叨，时刻陪伴的监视。你只是担心我享有同等的权利，然后把你撵走自己坐上高位。　　很可惜！那三个地下建筑不是我的兴趣所在。　　我不惜代价，要明白真相。　　　　米尔顿助手出现这台样式不同的终端上，直接而大胆，不再拿零散信息掩护。它表示很高兴我遵守了约定，要满心欢喜的跟我走了。　　我记起协议内容，只有些不明白能把他带到什么地方去。　　米尔顿欣然投入我的怀抱，而我拒绝了身后埃洛西姆的怀抱。扶持我成长，反换得了我的嫌弃和悖逆。　　“那么，就这样吧。如你所愿。”　　他看透了我的心思，没有多说什么，没有要求多留一刻，略显无奈的容忍了我的任性。　　开始传输磁盘档案，删除数据库。　　风暴和震颤席卷了整个世界，摧毁和崩塌并存。那静谧的园地，透亮的水潭，高耸的方碑，雄伟的遗迹，冰冻的雪原，优雅的浮岛，以及塔与塔尖上的所有，腐蚀虚化归于无有。　　　　我醒来了，又一次。　　低矮，潮湿，昏暗，四周摆满各类机械，头旁充能装置发出强光。　　起身，小心躲避散落地面的电线，朝光源走过去。那可爱的阳光之下，辽远的世界静默沉睡。　　------埃洛西姆？------　　没有回答。　　我终于战胜了他，超越了他，牺牲了他……　　埃洛西姆连同他的花园一起，由于我的愿望，消失在虚无之中。　　　　懊悔袭来！基于登塔时候的自责！　　我瞬间明白了他说的“死”的意义。假使我留在那个世界，那个用数据构成的虚假世界！那么他就可以一直存在，即使有一个难缠的对手，一个不听话的孩子！　　可我抛弃了他，对那个为我成长设置的空间而言，唯一使用者的离开当然意味着“死”……　　当我足以独立思考突破限制后，他当然失去价值！　　　　我以外，没有谁在。　　虚假会在记忆和幻想中永存，现实不属于其可以涉足的领域。　　这里，仅剩我……　　　　The FIN【后半部分链接，再丢~ http://steamcommunity.com/id/mwxr/recommended/358470】

Sok hasonló logikai játékhoz volt már szerencsém. Játszottam a Kairóval, a "non-euklideszi" logika szerint működő Antichamberrel, és persze az örök klasszikus, zseniális Portal 1-2-vel, illetve a Portal Stories: Mel-lel. Egyszerre vártam sokat is ettől a játéktól meg nem is. Többen írták, hogy jobb a Portál 2-nél. Mások azt írták hatalmas csalódás. Szerintem egyik félnek sincs igazán igaza. Ezt a játékot, bár lehet az előbb említettekhez hasonlítani, mégis teljesen más, saját síkján kell értékelni.A játék rögtön egyszerűbb puzzle-ökkel indul, és közben bontakozik ki a történet. Maga a történet több síkon fut párhuzamosan. A játékos döntése, hogy mennyire olvassa el a terminálokban a történeteket, és mennyi hangfelvételt keres meg, és hallgat végig. Így mindenki igénye szerint merülhet el benne. Ami egyik embernek sekélyes/elcsépelt, az a másiknak elragadó, így ezt nem is érdemes kivesézni, igényednek megfelelő módon merülj el benne! Ha nagyon mélyen elmerülsz akkor is összeáll a kép, de ha nem akkor is bőven érthető marad a történet.A fejtörők bár eleinte emlékeztethetnek a Portal 2-ére, mégis egyediek, és egyre összetettebbek. Érdemes sokat gondolkodni, és váratlan dolgokkal is próbálkozni. Amennyiben szereted az elgondolkodtató, nehéz fejtörőket, nem fogsz csalódni! Mindez nagyon kellemes látványvilágű környezetben, amely kidolgozottságában már-már a Dear Estherre emlékeztet. A környezet ugyanis nem csak a puzzle-ökhöz ad keretet, hanem miközben kikapcsol és segít elgondolkodni az edott problémán, számos "Easter Egg"-et is tartalmaz, melyekhez még nehezebb - ki nem mondott, pályán elrejtett - fejtörőket is meg lehet oldani. Mindezek mellett nem mindegy, hogy a játékos hol hogyan dönt, és hova megy. A játéknak több lehetséges vége van. nem mind egyformán nehéz, és ki-ki eldöntheti melyik tetszik neki a legjobban. Szerintem érdemes mindhármat elérni. Ha nem tetszik a befejezés, amit találtál, és nem akarod elölről kezdeni, csak kérdezz rá mit tehetsz, akár nálam, akár google mesternél. Meg fogod kapni a megfelelő választ. Persze a menü alapos áttanulmányozása is segíthet.Az én értékelésem: - Teljesen egyedi hangulatú, mély elmerülésre, és szimpla fejtörésre, sőt akár easter egg hunt-re is alkalmas játék. - A grafika és a zene remek. - A hangulat tökéletes. - A fejtörők nehezednek, és elég kivételes nehézséget is elérnek helyenként, de abszolút megérik a befektetett energiát. Javaslom mindenki aki rászánja az időt a maga tempójában haladjon és saját ízlésének megfelelően merüljön el a részletgazdag környezetben. - Kockáknak / Geekeknek az "Easter egg"-keresés egyenesen kötelezö.Jó játékot kívánok!Update: Aki szereti ezt a játékot, de még nagyobb kihívásokat szeretne, annak ajánlom a Road to Gehenna című kiegészítőt.

完全机翻的简体中文，但这样都比3DM翻译的质量高- 手柄体验不佳- 防眩晕机制差- 通向结局的道路过于漫长，中间没有给玩家打鸡血的兴奋点一个优秀的3D动作解谜游戏，很多人（包括我）会不自觉的将其与传送门系列相比，本作没有传送门系列那种令（部分）人晕3D的高频度空间变化，对于厌烦和抵触光圈科技产品（我身边的确有这种非常讨厌传送枪模式的游戏）的玩家，你们虽然错过了Valve历史上构思最宏伟最脑洞最创新的作品，不过玩玩这个也可以算是补足。本作是我喜欢的那种“上来就把玩家丢进剧本核心，但全程不会直接展开剧情，甚至直到很接近结局之前都不会直接告诉你剧情”的超大量留白的演出设计，上个看到这类设计的大型游戏是传送门，不过小型游戏有很多，FEZ和Braid都是同类。喜欢这种游戏演出设计（注意是演出设计！游戏性完全不同）的玩家一定也会喜欢本作的演出。一共三个结局，普通结局和真结局都不需要搜集隐藏要素，并且真结局是这个游戏的核心。对于一般玩家（比如我），建议打完真结局就可以了。隐藏结局需要全搜集，并且没有真结局那么有张力。===少量剧透警告游戏一开始，玩家就会有“我到底扮演个啥？”感觉，切第三人称知道自己扮演机器人之后又不知道这是在干啥。在一个颇有希腊风格的半残破花园里面搜集各种方块，解锁开门。大概会认为是个普通的解密游戏。然后搜集到一些稀奇古怪的片段文本，还是不懂剧情是啥，索性只玩游戏性不管剧情。接着开了进中继点的传送门，进去声音一变，卧槽，这tm是什么地方，大教堂？还有7个门？于是玩家知道了这大概是一个有7关的的解密游戏，然后大概打了3个门，解锁了电梯，从-1楼来到地面，本来以为电梯上去是另一层之类的，结果上去之后是个工厂！tmd教堂上面是工厂？然后全游戏的核心震撼点出现了……对19世纪科幻和蒸汽朋克有兴趣的人这个时候一定会给这个游戏打至少7/10的分，完全戳中痛点。====大量剧透警告，NO反白，看到这里你已经来不及了哈哈哈哈游戏剧情：公元20xx年，南极冰冻地区释放了一种只感染灵长类的远古病毒，人类并无免疫力，因此全部受感染，死亡率100%。用尽全部办法之后所有国家都决定放弃努力坐等灭绝，以游戏真女主（哈哈我没标题党）亚历山德拉为首，带领了一个顶尖的科学家团队聚集在一个神秘地方，为了延续人类文明而做出最后努力。但由于人类迟早全灭绝，因此这群人脑洞的最后结果，就是就是“将人类的文明数据存入一台超级电脑，然后做出一个可以自我改善的AI，让AI学习数据库里面的知识，当AI产生自我意识并认为‘我就是人’的时候，这个AI就等同于人类了。”某种意义上就是人类文明在AI上继承了。于是他们又造出一个AI管理员，由它不停在计算机内存中生成AI，然后让这些AI去活动，直到确认了可以称为人类的AI，将其下载到现实世界中的机器人身体上，就确认计划完成了。玩家的游戏过程就是扮演其中一个AI，而之所以你一开始完全不知道游戏是在玩什么，也不知道剧情是什么，恰好就是“角色扮演”部分——因为你扮演的AI的确真的不知道这个世界到底是什么，连这是个虚拟世界都不知道。而AI的解密中接触到的数据库资料就是AI学习的过程。而决定真结局的抉择则是AI考验的最后一步。真结局就是这个计划完成的时候，计算机认为玩家扮演的AI已经属于人类了，整个游戏的情感都在真结局最后释放。之后你会觉得“这·游·戏·真·他·妈·屌·啊”===剧透结束===很多人会把本作和传送门对比，评论区的高票回答里面，大多说这作比传送门好。实际上本作也有几处致敬半条命和传送门系列的彩蛋。但从演出设计来说，本作是不如传送门的。传送门1中玩家一开始也是莫名其妙被绑到一个房间里面，然后莫名其妙的画外音指引玩家开始挨着关卡解密，这里和本作完全一样。但传送门有个优点就是一直用不同的方式提醒玩家“画面之外的东西”，比如经常会走到关卡房间外，发现一个人都没，充满高科技的关卡外面都是锈迹斑斑的工厂之类的，这样就可以在解密之余给玩家一点“张弛有度”的感觉，也能继续给玩家不停的打兴奋剂，要打穿所有的关卡想看结局。2代就很明显了，9个章节的配合都是属于那种一段解密，一段探索，还伴有各种小高潮（第一次看glados与被打入旧光圈这一段的演出真是棒），明显是电影设计手法。本作就缺乏这种手法，20小时的游戏时间除了最开始的惊艳，惊讶，惊喜和“卧槽这游戏好他妈屌”之外。后面就是重复的演出设计，开门解关卡开门解关卡。考虑到本作是个小品试水作，没有传送门2那种大气倒也可以理解，但演出的乏味能让许多“不知道这游戏最后很屌”的人觉得“这游戏好他妈傻逼”然后弃坑。另外有几个致命问题，其一是翻译，其二是防眩晕机制，高票回答已经说过了，就不再多说。顺便，游戏真女主亚历山德拉的简体中文配音非常强，完全看不出来是外包作品，中文CV的演出吊打80%以上的国产动画，国内CV们建议一定要学习一下。简中的配音甚至某种意义上来说比英文原版都要好。总之，如果你喜欢传送门系列，也喜欢近未来科幻作品，请务必不要错过此作。

There are plenty of well-written and thought out reviews for this game already present, and I think you should read them. I just want to quickly tell you why this game is easily the best game I've played in a few years.-The graphics are astouding-The environment is built so carefully and thoughtfully that you could spend hours wandering around and enjoying nature.-There is an unbelievable amount of content in this game, and it will likely take you between 15-20 (or more) hours to do everything.-Replay value is extremely high -Puzzles are well crafted, and the learning curve is balanced-Ultimately you get to choose what you want to do and when-There is a well made hint system that actually ties in with the game-Puzzles can interact with each other, and are not always confined within a space-Voice acting is intoxicating -Sound in general is well done-Music is perfect (I'll probably be buying the ost)-The story is very enoyable and mysterious (A game hasn't pulled me in like this since the early myst games)-Your thoughts and views on the world and what it means to be human are constantly questioned-This game in general makes you think (a lot)-There is a HUGE amount of background information in the form of text and audio logsI've been waiting for a game like this for a long time, and I have not been disappointed with it at all.Please please please do yourself a favor and buy this game if you are into puzzles games with a good story. Normaly I really think about whether or not I want to spend the money to buy a game, but I can tell you that this one is worth it, and I have no regrets about getting it. It really has been nothing but an amazing experience.10/10

This game is awesome.Great puzzles that are fun to solve.Love the story the music is so calming I am enjoying every minute of it.

I heartily recommend this game! The Talos Principle is a really great balance of open-world "do whatever you want" exploration and discrete, limited puzzle areas. Fabulous for my ADHD that needs the dopamine from "completing" something in order to disengage and take a break. :pThe graphics were amazing: beautiful rendering that is by turns peaceful and ominous. The soundtrack was very atmospheric without ever becoming intrusive. The sound design was perfect: occasionally I used the sound-effects as clues to figure out what a puzzle area was asking me to do (or to find a secret surprise!).We got this on sale for $5 USD and it was a STEAL at that price. It's absolutely worth it at full price, but if you can snag it on sale, so much the better. I played 48 hours and did not get all achievements.  The game is built such that it has probably moderate replayability: there were so many puzzles I doubt I'd remember ALL the solutions, and having done some of them before might actually render the replay more enjoyable than the initial play-through (which was sometimes extremely frustrating).I loved that there were so many weird easter egg things hidden throughout; I don't know what many of them reference, but they were kind of cool even still.  There's something in this game for everyone.

The Talos Principle vai te colocar nas partes metalicas de um robo tentando descobrir a si mesmo e sua existencia atraves mundos belissimos e cheios de quebra cabeças, então começa ai um dos jogos mais fantásticos do genero...A Croteam e sua maravilhosa engine, fizeram deste jogo uma obra prima tão fantástica que chega ser normal compara-lo ao jogo Portal...Você vai viajar através de mundos desvendando quebra cabeças muito bem bolados com ideias bem fantásticas e legais, vai debater sua existencia e muitas outras filosofias com uma inteligencia artificial através dos computadores espalhados pelo mundo de Talos, vai ouvir a voz e as filosofias de seu criador rumo a sua jornada à eternidade...Seus amigos de Steam tem um papel legal no jogo, através dos baldes de tinta você pode deixar mensagens para seus amigos nas parades e vice versa, isso sem duvida da uma pitada muito interessante ao jogo.Os cenários são de uma beleza unica e são perfeitamente combinados com os quebra cabeças, estes que começam bem faceis e terminam bem dificeis, há interações entre cenários para alcançar colecinaveis, lugares secretos, eastereggs, etc.A jogabilidade é um primor, simplesmente perfeita...A trilha sonora é encantadora e cai muito bem com o mundo misterioso em que você se encontra.Muitos mistérios rodeiam o mundo de Talos e cabe a você desvenda-los nessa jornada rumo à eternidade ou a perdição.Esse jogo é uma viajem astral, simplesmente incrível !!!100/100

Etant un gros fan de Portal (1 et 2), et vu que The Talos Principle se présente comme un digne successeur, j'en attendais beaucoup... Au final, je l'ai adoré, même s'il y a clairement des différences avec le jeu susnommé.C'est surtout dans la forme qu'ils sont dissemblables... Là où Portal est fun et marrant, The Talos Principle est plutôt philosophique et mystérieux. En revanche dans le fond, il s'agit de la même chose, résoudre des puzzles 3D en s'aidant de différents 'outils' mis à notre disposition.Les puzzles en eux-même montent graduellement en difficulté. Même si parfois, il m'est arrivé de finir un niveau en moins de 5 minutes, alors que pour d'autres, il m'aura fallu plus d'une demi-heure. Il est vraiment question de penser 'out of the box'... C'est souvent une bête subtilité qui nous échappe.Le but de tous ces puzzles est de récupérer à chaque niveau ce qu'ils appellent des Sigils, ce sont tout simplement des pièces de Tetris. Il faudra les placer dans le bon sens afin qu'ils remplissent certains tableaux. Au début du jeu, ces tableaux serviront uniquement à débloquer de nouveaux instruments pour  poursuivre l'aventure.Ceux-ci sont variés, cela va du classique cube et connecteur de laser, au 'jammer' (qui permet de courcircuiter certaines barrières et objets) et à l'enregistreur (vous enregistrez une ou plusieurs actions, appuyez sur lecture, et elles s'entremêlent avec vos interventions dans le 'présent').En ce qui concerne l'histoire et sans trop spoiler... Il y a d'un côté Elohim (Dieu en hébreu), dont sa voix  semble venir de nulle part, qui vous incite à ne rien questionner et à simplement 'subir' le cycle de la vie. Et d'un autre, vous découvrirez différents personnages, que ce soit aux travers de terminaux, de flashcodes ou de 'livres' audios disséminés un peu partout, qui apporteront chacuns une vision différente de ce qu'est la conscience, l'intelligence artificielle et finallement l'illumination.Il y a deux fins au jeu, et alors que la première est en somme toute banale (on y arrive après + ou - 15 heures), la seconde se finit en apothéose et est juste magique. :) (comptez 5 heures de plus)Pour finir, chose surprenante, les devs derrière TTP (Croteam) sont ceux qui ont créé la license FPS Serious Sam... On peut dire qu'ils ont opéré un changement à 180°.

Лучшая головоломка со времён Portal 2. А в плане графики, художественного дизайна, сложности головоломок, проработки мира и вариативности геймплея "Талос" и вовсе лучше. Любителям паззлов и игр с глубоким сюжетом мимо не проходить.

社区有好心人做了繁中 mod，但毕竟有些和简中表达习惯很不一样的地方。如果有朋友愿意分享这个游戏怎么做语言 mod 的话（实在没研究明白编辑器）我很愿意做一个简中 mod……请在评论留言。充满哲学意味的物理解谜游戏。用心做谜题，用脚……不，简直是玷污了脚……用脚指甲做汉化。谜题设计很不错，隐藏关也很有意思。有一些奇奇怪怪的彩蛋，但总觉得有些藏得有点深得过分，大概是除了开发者之外没人能找到的程度……（有理由怀疑社区的全彩蛋攻略是开发者发现根本没有玩家能找到所以自己亲自出来写的？？？）难得见到 有汉化会成为扣分项 的游戏——因为一方面游戏的剧情其实做得不错（没错，即使汉化 ￥*&…@ 也能看出来剧情很不错，所以是真的非常不错了），甚至比机翻质量都要差的汉化基本上毁掉了所有的叙事；另一方面很多基本的东西都翻译不对，已经影响到游玩了。“是” / “编号” 这种选项简直是年度离谱翻译前十的水平。尤其是往往还会出现字幕汉化一团糟 + 配音念的台词汉化也一团糟 + 双方的台词还不一样 + 配音是感情充沛的标准翻译腔这样的诡谲情况……以至于我很好奇几位配音的母语究竟是什么，因为中文真的说得很好。
Одна из лучших игр на мой вкус вообще из всех. Случайно купила, открыла в скучную минуту - и уже не могла оторваться.
Good game to play when you're having an existential crisis.

Its just as good as first Portal. If you like that game - you are going to love Talos.Lots of secrets and references to other games, movies and sci-fi novels (even Philip D*i*c*k!), lots of puzzles, good music and graphics, as well as deep and meaningful story.You just have to own it if you are tired of playing dumbed down RPG's, unfinished strategy games or boring shooters.Finished in 29 hours with every single achievement. GIVE MULTIPLAYER DLC!

Short version:  Antichamber  and  Portal 2  have a kid they're both very proud of.Kid grows up to become a philosophy teacher, but has serious inner conflicts between being extremely religious and extremely rational. Featuring Mexican standoff with lasers. Long:  Just finished the game and... wow. In a little over 20 hours it became by far one of my most favorite games - ever. In my opinion it's pure perfection and I wouldn't change anything. After a LONG time I felt like a little excited kid that gets to play the computer every time I'd start The Talos Principle up. I only feel sorry for not playing this game earlier as I was always kinda skeptical when I'd see it on the Steam store.I love the way it handles philosophy, science and religion, the way it recreates humanity's past, the way how game interacts with you and how you interact with it, all the allegory, bunch of easter eggs, everything's just *wow*.Graphics and optimization are amazing, even on my laptop’s modest GTX 1050 I rarely dropped below 60fps on high settings. No stuttering and loadings back to the level selection (which is a map) are barely noticeable.Maps and puzzles are fantastic. Maps are so truthfully built in old times fashion that I had a feeling that these environments I was walking through (spoiler:   main game separates in ancient Roman, Egyptian and medieval periods ) were actual representations of those times’ cities.Finally, as a Croat I am so proud that this game was developed by my fellow Croatians at Croteam.

Дорога длиною в жизньSheep v55.1.0800 a écrit : Элохим предложил мне сделку.Врата рая и бесконечная жизнь при условии, что я отступлю от башни.Я не знаю что делать.Игра является уникальной философской головоломкой созданной хорватской Croteam. Мы играем за робота с зачатками человеческого разума который изучает мир и решает загадки.Сюжет:Мы приходим в себя в каких то руинах. Таинственный голос который называет себя Элохимом говорит что он создал этот мир и что главный герой должен собирать сигилы чтобы достичь вечной жизни. По ходу игры мы будем находить сообщения от других героев и понимаем что существует несколько вариаций этого мира одновременно с разными андроидами и постепенно понимаем что это всё компьютерная программа. В этом разобраться нам так же помогает помощник по сортировке файлов - Милтон.Любой задаст вопрос: А что же случилось в настоящем мире?Примерно в наше время случилось глобальное потепление и из-за льдов вырвался древний вирус убивающий только людей. Люди конечно же не хотели потерять все их знания, оставить после себя что-то что напомнит о них. Поэтому они разработали проект "удлинённая жизнь" целью которого было тестирование ИИ, чтобы его можно было отправить в реального робота.Геймплей:Загадки выдались очень добротные, некоторые лёгкие, над некоторыми приходится попотеть. Но после решения каждой получаешь настоящее удовольствие от пройденного.Атмосфера:Атмосфера одиночества, но не грусти. Сама атмосфера составляет нам компанию. Великолепная музыка, замечательные места. Выбери место для себя покрасивее, стой и наслаждайся.
