Отличная игра с потрясающим сюжетом и проработкой головоломок. Однозначное 10/10 от студии Croteam.Был крайне рад пройти "Принцип" впервые и не могу оторваться от повторного прохождения с другой концовкой.Всем удачи в поиске сигилов и путей Элохима.

Quite possibly the best game I have ever played11/10I bought this game a year ago today, and I do not regret it at all. The puzzles are very well done on their own, and if it weren't for the following, it would still be a very good game, but not the true masterpiece it is. The combination of stunning visuals, a deep, emotional soundtrack, and very immersive story make it not only an amazing game, but a true work of art. The visual aspect was so intriguing, I often forgot I was staring at a computer screen, especially in the first, Greco-Roman world. The soundtrack touches you right down to your soul. It brings out emotions I have often not felt before, and truly immerse you in the game, bringing out thoughts of philosophy. The story, oh the story. Not so much the 'common story element', but more so, what it is all about. It is metaphysically enchanting. It is playing this game that I experienced some of the deepest philosophical ideas I have ever had. The game makes you question what it is to be human, it makes you question the world, and everything around you, but in a truly spectacular way.On the outside, the game appears to be a puzzle game with nice graphics by Croteam, but in reality, it is so much more. Hold on a minute, you just spent all that time reading that when you could have been buying the game??!? don't waste any more time! Buy it now! Unless it isn't on sale, then maybe wait for it to go on sale, since even though it is a truly amazing game, $44 is a bit much, the price is the only ♥♥♥. Then again, I'm pretty sure it was a lot cheaper a year ago, and if you have the money, and are willing, use it!

I first person puzzler sono un po' il mio genere videoludico preferito e credo di averli giocati quasi tutti, dai capolavori come Portal a quelli meno riusciti. Poi un giorno ecco comparire dal nulla The Talos Principle, realizzato da Croteam che finora ha fatto tutto meno fpp, che non senza sorprese scala prepotentemente la classifica e va a piazzarsi tra i migliori esponenti del genere. In TTP vestiamo i panni di un automa che si risveglia in un luogo sconosciuto ed è accolto dal suo creatore Elohim, il quale lo sottopone a molte prove per vedere se è degno. L'automa può quindi muoversi liberamente nel giardino dei mondi di Elohim, ma come la Bibbia insegna, la tentazione è dietro l'angolo ed è qui rappresentata da una torre apparentemente senza fine, il cui ingresso è severamente vietato. Cosa c'è davvero in cima alla torre? E in quale luogo ci troviamo? E qual è lo scopo dell'ambiguo Milton, l'assistente bibliotecario ♥♥♥ cui dialoghiamo attraverso i terminali? Il gioco si articola attraverso 3 mondi, ognuno ♥♥♥ 7 livelli principali (più altri segreti) di grandezza variabile contenenti a loro volta diverse stanze ad enigmi, che una volta risolte ci fanno ottenere un tetramino, da usare poi assieme ad altri per sbloccare nuove zone o meccanismi da utilizzare. Per superare queste stanze si dovranno usare svariati marchingegni tra cui cubi, jammer e connettori laser, spesso da combinare assieme in maniera intelligente e cervellotica. La curva di difficoltà è abbastanza morbida, ogni volta che si ottiene una cosa nuova ci sono almeno un paio di livelli semplici di tutorial per farci capire come funziona, ma via via che si prosegue i puzzle diventano sempre più diabolici. Nonostante il loro numero non risultano però mai noiosi, non sono tutti originalissimi ma c'è una buona varietà.  Ma ciò che pone TTP un gradino sopra gli altri, oltre alla qualità degli enigmi, è anche la sensazione di libertà fornita al giocatore. I livelli sono quasi tutti abbastanza grandi e apparentemente vuoti, ma in realtà pieni di segreti ottenibili ♥♥♥ una buona dose di follia. Un po' come molti giochi degli anni '90, anche qui è possibile spesso e volentieri superare i confini del livello tramite salti azzardati e raggiungere (♥♥♥ i suoi limiti) luoghi in cui non si dovrebbe stare. Ma al contrario di quelli, in cui queste cose si potevano fare per difetti di programmazione, in TTP è voluto e incoraggiato e il giocatore viene ricompensato per questo, visto che come detto vi sono un sacco di easter eggs difficilissime da trovare e non ultime le temibili stelle nascoste, apparentemente impossibili da prendere a prima vista ma che costringono a sfruttare al massimo il proprio spirito di osservazione, l'intuito e la creatività se si cerca di ottenerle senza sbirciare in una guida. Sono comunque facoltative, ma sbloccano uno dei tre finali. Riguardo la trama, narrata quasi esclusivamente tramite documenti e log da leggere, è anch'essa molto ben scritta e interessante e permette man mano di farsi un'idea di ciò che è successo e del luogo in cui ci troviamo, risposte che però troveranno conferma solo nel vero finale. Dialogando ♥♥♥ Milton inoltre non ci si risparmia nemmeno delle digressioni tutt'altro che banali sulla filosofia, la morale e cosa significa essere una"persona". In questo però emerge l'unico difetto del gioco, ovvero una traduzione italiana scadente. A quanto pare infatti la parte scritta è stata curata da uno studio multilingua pagato probabilmente due spicci, e anche se alcuni documenti sono scritti bene (perché presi pari pari dagli originali), il 90% del resto odora di Google Translate tanto che viene da chiedersi chi ha veramente fatto il proofreading sbandierato nei credits. Ma se questo è accettabile in altri giochi più frivoli, qui diventa un problema visto che spesso i dialoghi e i botta e risposta vertono su argomenti complessi, resi spesso ancora più incomprensibili dalla traduzione a casaccio. Perciò vi consiglio di settare almeno la parte scritta in inglese, forse più difficile da capire, ma almeno scritta correttamente. Il doppiaggio invece potete pure lasciarlo in italiano, è fatto bene. EDIT: ho avuto modo di fixare la traduzione italiana, adesso dovrebbe essere tutto corretto se non ho mancato qualche svarione per caso. :) Giocatelo pure in italiano, e fatemi sapere!TTP è quindi un gioco originale e vagamente simbolico, che strizza l'occhio a molte altre produzioni del passato, al mondo di Internet e non solo, ma lo fa in modo consapevole e intelligente. Per tutti questi motivi arriva ad essere anche uno degli esponenti migliori del genere a cui appartiene, perciò se amate i giochi in prima persona esplorativi tipo Portal ♥♥♥ anche una spruzzata di filosofia e un mare di segreti, compratelo a occhi chiusi, sono soldi ben spesi.E poi ci sono anche dei gattini!

J'avais adore Portal & Portal 2... J'ai encore d'avantage aime Talos Principle qui, en plus de continuer a vous stimuler le cerveau avec des puzzles challenging mais pas impossible, initie de par son scenario tout un chacun a ce qu'on appelle l'epistemologie, ou philosophie de la science... avec cette question centrale, qu'est ce que l'intelligence artificielle... Ou... qu'est ce que l'humanite ? Ou se trouve la frontiere ? Mais... qui etes vous au fait ?

Meine wärmste Empfehlung für alle Hobby-Philosophen und Rätzelliebhaber.Ich habe vorher noch nie eine Review verfasst, also mal schauen wie's wird.Kurzes Vorwort:Dieses Spiel wurde von dem Kroatischen Entwicklerstudio CroTeam entwickelt, welche eigentlich Schnetzel- und Ballerorgien wie Serious Sam entwickelten. Und solch ein Team wagt sich an einem Rätzelspiel mit Philosophischem Tiefgang? Können sie das überhaupt? Also um ehrlich zu sein, ..OH JA! DAS KÖNNEN SIE :DStory:Man wacht als Menschgleicher Roboter in einer merkwürdigen Tempelanlage auf. Wissen tut man so gut wie garnix. Außer dass, was uns eine mysteriöse Stimme im Himmel das ganze Spiel über sagt. Diese Stimme sagt uns zum Anfang der Spieles, dass sie unser Erschaffer sei, welche auf den Namen ELOHIM hört, der uns in seinem (wie er es nennt) "Garten" Prüfungen auferlegt, welche uns nach korrekter Absolvierung das ewige Leben versprechen.Ich weiß, sehr ♥♥♥♥ aufgetragen, aber na ja, wer will den nicht EWIG leben?Oder auch nicht?Gameplay (I):Nun ja, dies ist nur eine von vielen immer wieder gestellten Fragen. Einige sind Leichter, andere schwieriger zu beantworten, aber dazu später mehr...Aber hauptsächlich (zu 60% meiner Meinung nach) geht es um die Rätzel, welche manchmal an Valves Sci-Fi Knobelspiel Portal I/II erinnern. Dennoch werden manche eigene Idee eingebracht, wie das erschaffen eines Klons, welcher eine Platte nimmt um sie dann, als richtiger Spieler, als Transportmittel zu nutzen. Manche dieser Rätzel enthalten mehrere Elemente gleichzeitig, von den Klassischen Kisten, bis hin zu Lichtsensoren und Jammer (Störer).Grafik:Das Spiel läuft auf der Serious Engine III und somit ist eine gewisse Ähnlichkeit zu Serious Sam 3 unverwechselbar (zumindest was den groben Look entspricht) Die Engine selbst kann heute (meiner Meinung nach) nur noch mit den guten Schatten und Lichtverhältnissen etwas leisten. Aber dennoch sind die einzelnen Gebiete sehr vielseitig und realistisch aufgebaut. Man hat bei den meisten antiken Baustrukturen immer das Gefühl, dass diese genauso in der realen Welt umsetzbar währen.Die Efeckte sind stimmig, es existiert ein Tag und Nachtwechsel sowie passende Regeneffekte.Jedoch wirkt diese Welt, so real sie auch mal sein mag, etwas statisch, zumindest fielen mir kaum irgendwelche Bewegungen von der Vegetation oder den Bäumen auf. Und sonst trifft man neben seinen eigens erschaffenen Klonen ( und Projektionen) auf keine anderen Lebewesen und oder Lebenden Kreaturen.Gameplay (II):Der andere Teil des Spieles bezieht sich auf nicht nur gute Philosophische Ansätze, sondern auch mit noch härten und Weltbildzerstörerischen Ansätzen, als die schon ohnehin Kopfexplodierenden Rätzel. Ihr Spielt im Übrigen eine Maschine, was nicht wirklich ein großer Spoiler ist, da ihr das mit der Third-Person Perspektive sowieso schon herausgefunden habt. Aber ihr Handelt wie ein Mensch. Also müsste die Maschine doch ein Mensch sein? Aber wenn eine Maschine doch ein Mensch ist, ist dann der Mensch auch eine Maschine. Klar, der Mensch hat eine Seele, aber was macht den die Seele aus, wenn beide gleich interagieren?Solche noch recht einfache Fragen (Und glaubt mir, dass sind sie wirklich) begleiten uns immer wieder im Spiel. Hinzu finden wir auf der Karte verteilt viele Computer, welche uns Dokumente von Philosophen und Professoren geben, welche über noch viel Tiefgründiger Fragen diskutieren.Hinzu können wir mit einer KI, oder einem Menschen, das weiß ich nicht einmal wirklich selber (wenn ihr es Spielt, wisst ihr was ich meine :) ) die uns viele Fragen stellen werden, die (um es ganz leicht zu übertreiben) unser ganzes Weltbild erschüttern kann. Denn die Anregungen und den Wille vieles kritisch zu hinterfragen, lehrt dieses Spiel extrem und begleitet uns das ganze Spiel über und das weit über das eigentliche Spiel hinaus. Und sowas, von einem Entwickler, welcher (im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes) "Killerspiele" entwickelte.Fazit:Hinter dem Talos Prinzip steckt doch mehr als man denk, und selbst wenn man nicht so viel denkt, schafft das Spiel es bei weitem einem soweit zum denken anzuregen. Die Grafik ist keine Snowdrop XII Engine, aber sorgt für eine gute Atmosphäre. Die Stimmung ist recht melancholisch und nachdenklich gehalten. Und die fragen können einen mehr den Kopf verdrehen als das Ende von Interstellar (na ja, nicht ganz aber fast :D)Hinzu besitzt es eines von angeblich drei Enden, wobei ich nur zwei erlebt habe und das zweite beim erneuten durchspielen mir einen richtigen Mindf*ck eingebracht hat, danke Spiel, hast du fein gemacht! Empfehlung:An alle Hobbie-Philosophen und Mythologieinteressenten sowie Rätzelenthusiasten ist das Spiel wärmstens zu empfehlen.Aber nur wer sich wirklich darauf einlässt und auch mal seinen Glaube in die Welt, der Dinge und seiner Religion kritisch hinterfragt, wird mehr als nur einmal die Worte Gottes und der Menschen von einer ganz anderen Seite betrachten.Bewertung:Story:             6/10Gameplay:      9/10Grafik:            5/10Extrapunkte*: 6/10------------------------Fazit:             26/40*Extrapunkte für: 1. den extrem tiefgründigen Philosophischen Hintergedanke2. ein gutes und ein sehr krasses Ende3. die alleinige Umsetzung eines so tiefgründigen Knobelspiels von einem Ego-Shooter Entwicklerteam

never in my eleventy billion years of vidya has a single game ever challenged every single one of my morals in such a discreet yet succinct way. it's an existential crisis disguised as a walking simulator disguised as a puzzle game and is 500% worth your time

CroTeam решили оставить Сэмюэля Стоуна в покое и занялись созданием игры в другом жанре, немного узкоспециализированном. Это головоломки, коих не так много известно. Что из этого получилось, можно сейчас разобраться. Графика. Красивая, выполненная на движке Serious Engine, который был использован в Serious Sam 3: BFE. Даже дизайн локаций не стали придумывать, а взяли из третьего Сэма и запихнули сюда. Не считаю за недостаток. Интерфейс очень схож с третьим Сэмом. Озвучка. Хорошая русская озвучка. Музыка хорошая. Сюжет. Как такового, сюжета здесь нет. Просто демонстрируем свои способности Всевышнему.  Геймплей. На протяжении всей игры нам нужно разгадывать головоломки, используя разные подручные средства и свои мозговые клетки с большим количеством серого вещества. Загадок здесь достаточно много, все они интересные для разгадывания. Есть и среди них загадки, где не сразу поймёшь ход решения, но для меня таких было немного. Если сравнивать с Portal, то она стоит с ней вровень, как мне кажется. Разработчики просто молодцы. Они доказали, что помимо крутых мясных шутеров они умеют делать интересные головоломки, используя старый движок и те же локации. В ней интересно провести время. Любителям головоломок взять стоит:)

I completed TTP about six months ago, but I've been thinking about it recently. The feel of it really sticks. Amazing soundtrack, interesting puzzles (which I'm not usually a fan of), and a literally awesome atmosphere. I remember wanting to leave a review just before the final sequence of events, which at the time felt like such a mix of curiosity and regret to be at the end, but I got too caried away and just went and finished it. I probably would have sounded like I was about to board a ship to Valinor. It's easily in my top 5 story experiences across any sort of media (novels included).A reviewer once said that if you like philosophy, then get this game. That's good advice. And it's got overwhelmingly positive reviews for a reason, so I don't really need to spruik it any further. In hindsight, I'd pay the full $40. That's $1-$2 per hour of very good playtime so you should definitely prepare your favourite beverage and buy this game immediately.(Does anyone else really miss the Milton Library Assistant?)

The Talos Principle is one of the best puzzle games of all time, featuring insanely good, creative, interesting, and mind-blowing puzzles with different mechanics, tools, and ways to solve them. This makes it a truly challenging and enjoyable experience, even for enthusiasts of the genre.However, in my opinion, what makes The Talos Principle stand out even more than other games is its story and the abundance of philosophical approaches and content within it. The game presents the player with a profound exploration of various ideas, such as the meaning and nature of life, reality, consciousness, knowledge, ethics of progress, and AIs. The way the story is presented is really well done, being told only through dialogues of an important character for the plot and texts you can read on the game's terminals. This leaves the player to interpret and understand the game's universe, all while seamlessly intertwining the game plot with pure philosophy. The Talos Principle is one of the purest examples of how video games can truly be considered art.

Completion of this game should be required for basic education.  If we're too dumb to teach our kids logic and existential philosophy, lets at least give them a fighting chance by letting a game do it.
Literally my favorite game
the real puzzle was the existential crisis we had along the way

Интереснейшая первая часть игры-головоломки в стиле Portal 2 со своими фишками и изюминкой на множестве красочных локаций, неплохой сюжет, достижения и карточки. Рекомендовано взять на распродажах со скидкой 80-90%, загадки и головоломки с местным колоритом стоят того!!!Недавно вышла и вторая часть игры, но такими большими скидками как первая часть, пока не может похвастаться, однозначно стоит пополнить свою библиотеку этой игрой.

从听CSGO的塔罗斯法则音乐盒认识的这款游戏。当时就感觉音乐风格有那么点像英雄萨姆系列（同开发商Croteam的另一系列作品），在询问了好友的评价后就毫不犹豫的入手了。游戏方面，这是一款十分优秀的3D解谜游戏，虽然没有Portal传来传去那么玄但作为3D解谜也将空间的运用做的十分到位。游戏上手还算简单，前中期也经常会有一些指示性关卡来引导你新得到的道具应该怎么用或者有没有一些你一开始想不到的骚操作。A世界和B世界难度相对适中，适合绝大部分人，C世界的难度可能就需要不少人去查攻略了（比如本菜鸡），但总体也没有难得出格，而且到了C世界和塔顶才体现出游戏精湛的关卡设计水平。对于喜欢烧脑的玩家游戏也提供了丰富的隐藏收集要素和各种彩蛋，达成全收集结局也是极有挑战性的。剧情方面共有三个结局，但真结局并不是全收集结局，请放心游玩。游戏剧情通过零碎的信息片段来推进，配合后启示录的风格来引发玩家的思考。但毁了这一切的就是游戏最大的缺点——简中版本的机翻翻译。游戏的中配语音水平很高，就是翻译水平实在不敢恭维，甚至会影响大部分玩家理解剧情。据说繁中版本会好一些，推荐一试。除此之外就是游戏的BUG相对较多，但好像大多是些可以降低关卡难度的BUG...无伤大雅。最后吐槽下Croteam快开发新引擎呀，使用SeriousEngine3的游戏多半是会让人有点晕的，还好这作有抗晕眩设置玩起来舒服一些，但英雄萨姆3好像就不那么幸运咯。

I have got to say that its been really hard to piece together the words to express how this game makes me feel. And maybe that's the idea. Maybe its all meant to fit into how the game reminds you that life is in itself a puzzle, that the nature of humanity is an aspect that's very tricky to translate into the languages we've come and developed over the many years of our species' existance, that even in our advances, even with all the new tools we'll come and develop or aquire for ourselves, even through all the knew mechanics we'll establish for us and our fellow man, life...is just always going to feel like nothing but a never-ending series of puzzles to ponder over, and no matter how many different ways you try to look at it, or how many ways you try placing that box or that jammer, and no matter how many times you'll wander around in the vain hope of finding just one last laser reflector...THIS DOESN'T MAKE ANY SENSE. THIS PUZZLE IS IMPOSSIBLE AND MAKES NO SENSE. THIS IS STUPID..........Dear god, this game is brilliant. This is the most amazing puzzle experience you'll ever go through. From its questions to humanity, to its overarching mystery, to its mind-bending puzzles, its a game that will keep you thinking from the beginning all the way to the end.This is coming from a person who normally shuns puzzle games and is eagerly awaiting the arrival of Croteam's Serious Sam 4 more than anything: THIS SHOULD HAVE BEEN GAME OF THE YEAR. Absolutely sublime piece of software - a complete masterpiece.

I went in expecting a neat little puzzle game similar to Portal, came out questioning my very own existence and the meaning of life...This game is amazing: Looks beautiful, plays great, soundtrack is so peaceful and relaxing you can listen to it for hours, masterfully designed puzzles that strike almost perfect balance between challenging and frustrating and a philosophical story that mentally challenges you in ways you didn't think was possible for a game.In short just do me a favor and buy the damn game already or at least on a sale but just do it !
Im sad because there will never be another game that will give me the same experience that talos did. Also get the Witness.

İlk 10 15 dakika: "Hah basit bir puzzle oyunu galiba"İlk terminali bulunca: " Bu da neydi şimdi" A'nın altındaki kapı portalına gelince: "OHAA, yok artık " Mükemmel manzaralar arasındaki kısmi açık dünyada gezerken çok uzaklaşınca: "Ha....r , o ne lan" Acaip acaip şeyler olmaya başlayınca : Bir kaç kere ufak çaplı kalp krizi ve sonrasında hep pür dikkat oluş.Her yeni terminalde, Her MLA ile sohbette kendimi, hayatı, varlığı, yokluğu felsefenenin kendisini sorgulamalara dalmak..Şu anda oyunu daha yarılamadım bile ve hiç bitmemesi için dua ediyorum, oynama sıklığımı azalttım falan.Oyun sırlarla dolu..Bir karanlık köşede kaybolduktan sonra LSD içmiş gibi her tarafın saçma sapan olduğu bir koridorda Minecrafttan izler görüp, dışarı çıkınca  Serious Sam'den Kamikaze sürprizi...	Lütfen, bu yazıyı okuyan herkese sesleniyorum.. Lütfen bu "oyun"u ölmeden mutlaka bir kere oynayın. Ama anlayarak oynayın, her yazıyı okuyun, her köşeyi didik didik arayın..  Minecraft WTF

Esse é um daqueles jogos que você fica abismado em como cada aspecto foi extremamente bem trabalhado. Aqui você controla um robô que não sabe quem é, onde está e o motivo de ali estar. Uma voz fala com você constantemente e te guia, enquanto você pode vagar livremente pelas várias áreas do jardim, tendo o direito de ir e vir e resolvendo enigmas para acessar novas áreas.O jogo é claramente uma referência ao Jardim do Éden, mas por quê? Aos poucos você vai descobrindo cada vez mais. E o jogo ainda é dublado em português brasileiro! Enfim, confiram uma análise detalhada dessa maravilha aqui:http://www.nerdmaldito.com/2015/07/the-talos-principle-um-jogo-filosofico.html

Without a doubt one of the best games I have played, ever.  The basic mechanics and puzzles alone are fantastic if you're not someone who really cares about story or concept. BUT, if you enjoy digging in to what this game has to offer, you're in for one of the most amazing experiences any form of media or art can provide.      They have managed to seamlessly blend so many wild concepts and ideas, from philosophy to theoretical physics to religion to morals and morality.      The puzzles alone are enough to fry your brain, but when you dive into the deep end of this game, your brain is in for an all-out meltdown! After completing this game I sat in front of my computer for five minutes contemplating my very existence. Truly a remarkable experience. The main story puzzles are challenging but not impossible, gradually increasing in difficulty  with a smooth learning curve. Some of the later levels are relatively easy to complete, others seemed rather difficult however once you figure out the necessary steps it's all so obvious it's funny. If you want to challenge yourself even further there are extra puzzles to complete, these range from relatively straight forward to near damn impossible (if you figure these out on your own I salute you).The characters, whether they be alive, dead, or neither, are so relatable and real you actually start to feel for them as if they were your family. A father, a mother, a pesky sibling... The snippets of humanity, the mythologies of ancient civilizations and the superficiality of modern day chat rooms, the words of scientists, philosophers, and commoners alike, all gradually form an image of what it means to be human, piece by piece. As you complete the puzzles your understanding of the greater story behind this place you found yourself in and your purpose in it grows.In the end, because everything must come to an end, you are faced with a question. What does it really mean to be human?10/10 Will sit in front of my computer for five minutes contemplating my very existence again, as I want to experience the other two endings, finish the star puzzles, and go on an Easter Egg hunt because they're hilarious.If you like 3D puzzle games get this. If you like contemplating the meaning of life, the universe and everything, definitely get this.

One of the most peculiar and convoluted gaming experience I've ever had. Definitely Not a game for everyone, but if you love complicated puzzles, enjoy pondering about moral and ethical dilemmas and drift on themes that verge on existentialism, this is the game you were looking for.Oh, and don't miss to take a look at "Sigils of Elohim" to get some nice extras during your gameplay!

Я приверженец лаконичного ведения речи(наверное поэтому в школе учился на 4-ки). Игра мне очень понравилась!!! Я действительно в перерывах между работой и перед сном думал над решение головоломок. Права была Александра Дренан "Мы решаем проблемы даже когда это не необходимо. Мы делаем это ради забавы". Хотя не согласен с термином "проблемы" скорее это ЗАДАЧИ. Пройдя игру мне хотелось еще головоломок, процесс решения невероятно сильно затягивал. Я проходил игру три раза, второй и третий раз я искал альтернативные варианты решения головоломок. И находил!!! Есть одна камера которую я решил уже тремя способами, и каждый раз я забывал предыдущий вариант решения.  И знаете что очень приятно, соотношения положительных обзоров к отрицательным примерно 28 к 1 . По моему это очень хорошо. В игру будут играть не все. Но компании разработчику огромное спасибо!!! Жду продолжения.

Short story short; Pretty awesome 3D puzzler. With a cool story and a some nice bits of philosophy.The worlds look lovely, and some of the puzzles can be a bit of a challenge. You can also solve a few by thinking outside the box. Music seems to be rather relaxing and quite fitting to the scenery. And everything, just, looks, nice.Also gotta say they seemed to have thought of anything when making the options menu. And I really appreciate that.Some seem to compare this game with Portal, but I guess that's just because it's also a First-Person-View Puzzler. They really don't have much else in common, it's a whole different type of thinking than with portals, also an entirely different story.And remember; frogs are people too.

Хорошо...я не буду лукавить и скажу правду! игру я купила из-за заставки котёнка на обложке...лол, но для меня в итоге игра оказалась ШЕДЕВРОМ запавшим в душу и не из-за котенка в итоге!С первых минут загадки в игре начали затягивать( о их там много) Далее архивные записи или девушка с голосовыми записями капсулы времени(они же и являются основными повествователями печального сюжета в игре)... читать и слушать все эти философские изречения и даже глупые чат беседы работников это было неимоверно кайфово...особенно под музыку. О кстати о музыке... где то она была жуткой, где то напряжённой, где то с церковными или философскими нотками, а где то печальной ...в любом случае мои уши получили полный экстаз!Игра настолько меня затянула, что я стала пытаться обыскивать каждый уголок(ведь все панорамы и открывающиеся виды просто великолепны)так вот пока я рыскала в поисках секреток..хе хе я даже смогла найти внутри игры того самого котенка)Пройдя игру (смогла пройти на 2 концовки) у меня осталось приятное ощущение на душе и кажется будто горы готова свернуть начитавшись всех этих философских записочек)В любом случае я влюбилась в эту игру! говорят будет 2 часть...чтож я буду в числе первых, кто купит вторую часть!!!

One of the best first-person puzzle games on market, and I think it's the most important release in the genre since Portal 2. It offers variety, depth and enough motivation to keep playing the game, and at the same time it has a deep storyline tackling topics that are not usually presented in modern media (and probablu we should thank for that Jonas Kyratzes, the writer of the brilliant The Sea Will Claim Everything). The graphics aren't that great, but it's good enough and, which is more important, maintains the right atmosphere well.

作为一款纯粹的解密游戏，很好的贯彻了解密的设定，一旦进入游戏就全TM是谜题，每一关都是一个新的谜题，每一个谜题又有不同的小题，数个题目之间还可能存在着隐藏，而开启后续关卡的钥匙则需要不同谜题通关的符文组合其实就是拼积木。与大多数线性解密不同，游戏里的路线并非一条直线，如同半个开放世界，完全可以在解密之余四处看看风景前提是忍住眩晕，玩久了是真的想吐，这就给予玩家更多的探索欲望反正我当初每进个地图都不停的找电脑，解密是啥完全不知道，而在各个区域留下的言语中，又有大量引人思考的话题，解密之余还可以思考下人生。在游戏内，关卡附近都有指示牌的存在，对于以获得的符文会进行涂黑，放置地图过于复杂忘记哪是哪，而对于隐藏的指示也更方便了玩家的寻找然而并没有什么卵用，该找不到还是找不到，而每个关卡都是单独的一个区域，是个独立的小岛，更方便了玩家的辨认特别是看攻略的时候，所以是个区域开放世界，可以在区域内随意探索，但不能超出区域，一旦到达边界就会被强制踢回，没有任何余地毕竟机器人下海短路很正常嘛。

For me it rivals and even defeat portal as one masterpiece of puzzles gamesThe scenarios are stunning, this game has excellent aesthetics using superb graphics, 10/10 would stop looking a wall texture for minutes again.The puzzles difficult stands in a crescent linear curve, you feel how rewarding it is as you pass throught harder and more advanced levels, mechanics are portal like, but you got prims to deflect light rays instead of a portal gun, among with other elements that you will have to combine sometimes.then the story: this game has a good philosophical background and interactions with NPCs that will leave you wondering about the very meaning of life while you're already breaking your head and stacking boxes on top of fans with a prism over it

ใครที่กำลังคิดจะชื้อเกมนี้มาบอกเลยว่าคุ้มครับ 699 บาท แต่ถ้าใครไม่รีบร้อนแนะนำให้รอลดประมาณ 200 กว่าบาท จะดีที่สุดใครที่เป็นคนที่ชอบเกมแนว puzzle เป็นชีวิตจิตใจยิ่งต้องลองด้วยประการทั้งปวง เรืองของที่จะแก้ปริศนานั้นมีทั้ง เลเชอร์ บล็อก ที่เหยียบ บลาๆ และ ของอันตรายต่างๆที่จะทำให้ต้องมานั้นเริ่มใหม่ = =" ส่วนเรื่องฉากในเกมออกแนวโบราณๆ ในป่า หรือทะเลทราย ดูสวยไปอีกแบบ คอมสเปคล่างๆ ก็สามารถเล่นได้นะถ้ายังสวยด้วย แนะนำให้ลองโหลดตัว ทดลองมาก่อนแล้วกันขนานปรับ Low นะคนที่ชอบเรื่องกราฟฟิกจะชอบเกมนี้ด้วย ส่วนความยากถ้าจะให้เทียบเกมระหว่าง Portal 2 กับ The Talos Principle ขอบอกว่า The Talos Principle ยากกว่า และใช้เวลาเล่นจบนานกว่า Portal 2 แน่นอน เราใช้เวลา 22 ชัวโมง กว่าจะจบและถ้าใครคือว่าเล่นจบแล้วไม่มีไรทำ คือมันมี DLC The Talos Principle: Road to Gehenna ให้เรามาปวดหัวเล่นอีกแล้ว รอมันปล่อยอีกประมาณ 1 สัปดาห์ 6 วัน และ 2 ชั่วโมง และเราหน้าจะเสียเงินชื้อมันมาเล่น = =" หลังจากเราเขียนบทวิจารณ์นี้นะ =w=" ถ้าให้คะแนนเกมนี้ผมขอให้ 9/10	 แล้วกันนะ โอเคขอให้ชื้อมาเล่นแบบมีความสุขนะ...ป.ล.หลังจากเล่นจบมาแล้วเราพึ้งมารุ้อีกว่า มนจบได้ 2 แบบ =[]=
Tentarei ser objetivo:O gráfico é lindo, historia massa que faz pensar, dublado em pt-br, desafios incríveis.Se você gostou de portal 2, vai gostar mais ainda desse.

I'm loving this game.A huge world, graphically perfect, a long series of clever, difficult and mind stimulating puzzles.Philosophy, thoughts about life and stuff... and God?Nothing to say, try it if you like puzzles, huge well-made environments and a deep lore.

The Talos Principle  		Une capture d'écran de The Talos Principle 		Par : vulrahnd 		 					 	 8/10Kurzkommentar/Short comment/一言感想DE/ Ein großartiges Spiel. Die Rätsel, die Story und das ganze Drumherum, es passt einfach alles zusammen, was dieses Spiel zu einem Triple A Titel macht. Du magst oder mochtest schon immer Portal oder Portal 2? Dann wirst Du auch dieses Spiel definitiv mögen. Allerdings muss man sagen dass der Schwierigkeitsgrad in dem Spiel um einiges höher liegt als das was wir aus der Portal-Serie gewohnt sind. Dazu vielleicht noch wichtig zu wissen, dass man in diesem Spiel mit sehr viel philosophisch angesiedelten Texten konfrontiert wird. (Auch wenn evtl. nicht wichtig zum durchspielen.) Es ist auf jeden Fall die 10Euro während des Weihnachtssales wert. Vielleicht ist es sogar die volle 40Euro wert. (Ich hätte nie gedacht dass ich das mal bei nem Denk/Puzzle Spiel sagen würde) Einzig was diesem Spiel fehlt, ist die Multiplayer-funktion wie bei Portal 2.EN/ A great game. The puzzles, story and environment, everything matches in this game, really making it a AAA title. You love or loved to play Portal, Portal2?  You will definitely love this one too. Though, the difficulty level is higher than that what we are used from the Portal series. Also be aware, that you have to read a lot of philosophical texts (Maybe not essential to play through) . It's definitely worth the 10bucks during the Xmas sales. Perhaps it's even worth the full price of 40 bucks. (never thought that I will admit this for a puzzle game...) Only ♥♥♥ is, that it has no multiplayer like we had in Portal 2. JP/ 一言でいうと素晴らしいゲーム。パズル、物語に世界観、全てが巧妙に絡み合い、このゲームをトリプルＡタイトルとしてせしめている。過去にＰＯＲＴＡＬやＰＯＲＴＡＬ２のプレイ経験があり、尚且つ楽しめたというなら、このゲームも存分に楽しめることだろう。しかし、難易度的にはＰＯＲＴＡＬシリーズよりは幾らか上だと思われます。それに、哲学的な文章も結構読まされる羽目になるので、苦手な人は要注意かもです。（とは言ってもクリアするにあたり注意して読む必要は余り無いかもしれませんが。）取り合えず、クリスマスセール中の約10ドルの価値は十分にある作品なのは間違いなし。下手すると正規価格40ドルだって妥当なのかもしれない、と思えちゃう出来です。（パズルゲームで40ドルの値段を正当化する日が来るとは夢にも思っていませんでした・・・）唯一思いつく残念な点は、ＰＯＲＴＡＬ２みたいにマルチプレーが出来ないといったところでしょう・・・

I don't think anyone could have really prepared me for this game.  I was aware of it's first person puzzle gameplay plastered with a veneer of philosophical trappings but figured the musings would just be there, tacked on.  A lot of care and thought went into the narrative.  It questions what it means to be human, what is life, and where are we as a species going.  It's pretty heavy stuff that resonated strongly with me as I age and hit life milestones.  This story feels core to the game's identity, but the developers took care in preventing it as a distraction if the player just wants to solve puzzles.Boiled down the game is a first person puzzler ala Portal, with a story presented in a similar manner through text logs and an omnipotent presence guiding the player.  While Portal was inherently funny Talos Principle takes a more serious tone.  It does a great job of skirting the line between hope and nihilism, so the game isn't truly depressing (I'm looking at you, SOMA). I can't really say too much more without giving away spoilers.The puzzles are truly excellent.  The first handful serve as a tutorial, and the difficultly quickly ramps up from there.  The most fantastic feeling in this game is conquering a puzzle that seemed impossible, that "aha!" nirvana.  As a helpful hint, if the reader gets stumped on a puzzle take a break!  There were only a handful of puzzles that required more than a brief break before I banged out the solution rather quickly.  It's kind of an odd parallel, but it seemed similar to the Souls games.  This can be a 40 hour game if you bang your head against the wall and try to brute force a puzzle solution that just isn't coming, or it's 20 hours or less if you tackle puzzles while fresh and put the game aside when it feels like a drag.I can't think of anyone who shouldn't play this game.  Highly recommended.

The Tetris PrincipleA philosophical cluster bomb warped in a FPS puzzler c(r)oating. Game is a mixed bag of positives and negatives where the few masterfully done elements outweigh the few, but more numerous, frustrating ones. Flaws won't affect casual players as much as they will nitpicking die-hard veterans so that's something to keep in mind.Right from the start you are thrown into this mysterious Garden, as your guide called Elohim (present in voice only) calls it, with a sole purpose of solving puzzles to fulfill your ultimate goal of reaching eternal life. Elohim actor btw, in my opinion, has the best combination of calm authority in his voice that I can remember hearing. I really made the atmosphere work and ties-in very well with the philosophical aspect of Faith later on (but not Religion).Puzzles always have the same goal - to overcome physical barriers and reach the final area containing... a 3D tetris piece. They call it Sigil in game but let's get real and call it what it is, lol. Hence my witty title. Collect enough and you will be able to unlock a new tool to help you with more complex puzzles. There are 5 such tools and each adds a new element of complexity. Luckily it never gets unfairly difficult, at least regarding regular Sigils, and maximum number of tools in any given level never exceeds 4 if I'm not mistaken.There are 21 levels split into 3x7 with distinct visual art style Hubs although the puzzles general layout remains the same but with a different texture pack. There are few more levels IF you embrace the philosophical aspect of Doubt at the right time. Each of the levels has between 3-6 puzzles so if you do the math and add few secret levels I haven't mentioned yet you get a nice bunch of over 100 puzzles to play around with.The cool part is that some of the puzzles have secret Sigils in form of a Star, usually hidden out of view, and getting them gives that really rewarding felling players always seek. The Stars unlock 3 secret levels with total 9 puzzles containing special Sigils that unlock yet another secret.Speaking of secrets, Talos is packed with them and with various hard-to-reach Easter Eggs. And that's IF you become aware they even exist because how well they are hidden. I found maybe two dozens and still believe I missed just as much. Some are references to Croteam's Serious Sam, old famous movies, Portal (comparable puzzle game to Talos), and some contain useful but temporary powerups that make solving some puzzles trivial. Easter Eggs provide the highest self-confidence fix of any difficult puzzle there is! I recommend keeping your eyes peeled at all times.Each level (not puzzle) also has a computer terminal (or two) which provides some vague story pieces which will start making sense if you are able to keep your concentration and discard many of the meaningless text dumps. Through these terminals you will eventually reach the game's peak strong point - the sentient program called Milton. He will test you beliefs, both as in-game roleplay but also your real-life ones. This is handled by a large set of predefined questions you get asked based on many possible, also pre-defined, answers you gave earlier. It's done so well it doesn't feel cheap in the slightest. It's closest most will get to debating a high-end philosopher. Themes range from what does it mean to be human, having a free choice, morality, reality, and stuff like that. Depending how you thread the long but interrupted chunks of the ever escalating conversation, one of several endings might get affected. All these choices feel like they lead somewhere, it's a refreshing experience.One other neat thing you can do is leave pre-defined personal messages on puzzle walls for your friends to read later when they play the game. All you have to do is find a one-time-use can of paint hidden somewhere in the level. Set of messages are some light wisdom advice or general observations or even pure troll ones. They are never too revealing because that would defeat the purpose of puzzles. Never seen such friend integration mechanic so I was in awe for a good while. Even got me thinking a buddy of mine worked on a game.* * *Not all is fine and dandy as there are annoying flaws that got me tethering on the verge of a Negative review early on.Game runs on Serious Same 3 engine and basically looks the same. I'd even argue the whole B puzzle section is lazily ripped from SS3. Flat rectangle geometry all the way regarding level design as is characteristic for Croteam. But what bothers me isn't that - in fact clean, simplistic design is favorable for quick & clean puzzle overview - but how, in order to mask it, they slapped so much lightning techniques onto every texture the game runs like a dead horse. Coupled with enormous graphic options made finding the culprit hard. It was shadow size btw.The even more annoying is "Level Caching" option. ON is supposedly better because levels load faster they say. Well it is if you have excess RAM/VRAM, and even then I'm not too sure. For the rest of us put it to OFF to avoid reducing live of your SSD/HDD. Levels load the same and the whole ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ game doesn't stutter every step or even 10° rotation you make.Story is dumped on you via walls-of-text exclusively, no exception. It is mixed with unrelated nonsense in ratio of about 3:1 against the story. Along with large time gaps until the next terminal is reached it makes remembering, following, and even deciding what to discard from what was read a real challenge to say is mildly. Near the end I realized there's no way to make any sense of it all so I just clicked through the text without paying much attention. After the true ending I still wasn't sure so I cheated and went to wiki for a summary. At hindsight, yes the story is fantastic but only if you read the important bits without your mind having to keep the filler clutter. Story should have been conveyed much better with show-don't-tell approach.Teleporters are wonky, often sending you back as you step out. C'mon guys, Doom had it right 25 years ago. Jumping mechanic is the dumbest ever coded. You can jump freely but unless it's a designed landing spot you will bounce off into random direction and ♥♥♥ 10 mins long puzzle solution setup is worst cases. Often the suitable ledge will turn out to be off-limits and there goes your whole solving concept.Puzzles themselves ALL lack verticality. Game could have easily been made as 2D top-down with far better and quicker puzzle overview allowing proper difficult puzzles. At it stands the most of the challenge is simply getting to understand the puzzle by exploring all of it rather than solving it. Not that they're bad but could've been far more. They even nodded Portal via Easter Egg but didn't capitalize on all its strengths. Check "Talesworth Adventure" duology as a good example (Flash game), or SubTerra from Crystal Shard at the high end of the spectrum as a pure masterpiece of puzzle design.For a game that has deep branching conversations and multiple point-of-no-return endings to have a console-like single-slot/single-save gimmick with only rudimentary restore feature is downright insulting. I had to resort to frequent manual backups via file explorer in order to experience everything in one go... Definitely did not expect such downgrade from Croteam, a group of fellow compatriots I hold in high regard.Some of new mechanics are poorly introduced because of non-linearity of puzzles within levels but nothing too serious. Bigger impact was poor execution of the 2 Star Sigils right at the begging. Unlike the others these two are completely unfairly hidden. Both you aren't even aware of unless you inspect every brick of every wall for a hidden switch and second even involves decoding a hexadecimal string and input it in a unintuitive way. Made me think the whole game will be a mess right from the start but luckily those are the only weird ones.

С первых же головоломок игра выглядит страшно знакомо. И, как показывает дальнейшее, ощущение это совершенно верное: духовным отцом Thalos Principle был первый Portal. Всё те же бесчисленные головоломки, перемежаемые общением с компьютерами.Но есть и существенная разница: в Портале сюжет начинается медленно, затем ускоряется всё больше и больше, завершаясь кульминацией экшена. Талос же не давит на тебя никогда, до самой последней головоломки - да и там всего лишь ограничение по времени. Это плюс, но это же и минус: на поверхности никогда ничего не происходит.В принципе, на поверхности вся игра - это чистая головоломка. Если не заморачиваться компьютерами, можно, я так полагаю, пройти весь Талос, и так и  и не понять ничего, увидев, лишь довольно простые головоломки с тетрамино.Вторым же слоем идут задачи повышенной сложности - по добыванию звёзд. И тут уже головоломки сильно веселее - хоть и не настолько, чтобы вызвать какие-то существенные проблемы. Исключением для меня явилась только головоломка со Сфинксом - кто б знал, что на груди у него невидимая точка приёма луча?! Впрочем, и это - всего лишь головоломки, хоть и более высокого уровня.К счастью, и это - не вся игра. "Настоящий" сюжет продвигается общением с компьютерами. Они являются частью древней (и, по всей видимости, уже разрушенной) сети, и содержат кучу обрывков информации, которая, собственно, и рассказывает историю произошедшего, с разных точек зрения и под разным углом. Кроме того, через компьютеры вам представляется возможность пообщаться - хоть и очень ограниченная.В целом, если анализировать мои ощущения от игры, я бы сказал, что все компоненты сделаны правильно - головоломки, секреты, диалоги и исполнение всего этого - но вот соотношение между частями мне не понравилось. Если бы головоломок было хоть на треть меньше, а освободившееся время ушло на общение, игра бы мне понравилась куда больше.С учётом этого - 8,5/10. Рекомендую. Но учтите, что терпение вам очень и очень пригодится.

来自“神”的考验，以及人工智能对“人”的向往与哲思。——《The Talos Principle(塔罗斯法则)》从整体上来说，《塔罗斯法则》并不能称为一个“完美”或是“精美”的游戏，这款游戏存在着诸多不足。但却也无法掩盖其优点，精良的关卡设计与剧情，使其足以称得上一款“优秀”的解迷游戏。怎样才能称之为“人”？在评测这款游戏之前，我首先就要提到其世界观与故事背景剧情。为了防止我的理解不太详尽，亦或是解释不太周全，因此请允许我先引用一段资料：百度百科 a écrit : 关于游戏名称，塔罗斯（希腊语：Ταλως；英语：Talos / Talus）是希腊神话中的机械巨人（Automaton）。该名义为“砍伐”或“太阳”。塔罗斯的法则就是在依照神话故事中的机械巨人塔罗斯来命名的。在游戏中，整个世界分成了三个部分：废墟，死亡之地，信心之地。废墟是一片郁郁葱葱的森林中的人类遗迹，充满了古罗马古希腊时代的印记；死亡之地是漫漫黄沙中的古埃及，远处的金字塔预示着这里是诸神陨落之地；信心之地是中古时代欧洲为背景，在有显著人类活动的雪中古堡里，瑟瑟秋风中教堂旁解开一个个谜题。游戏的中心是一座围绕高塔而建造的现代化建筑，位于一座被寒冰和雪山包围的孤岛之上。当中还有如诗如画般信使们居所，家可以通过解谜拜访信使处，然后获得为数不多的帮助来解决所遇到的难题。游戏的立意不禁使我们联想到诸多类似的影视作品，包括最近Google的核心产业Alpha GO，都是以“人工智能的发展与成长”为核心的。而怎么样才能成为“人”呢？这点在游戏中有详尽的定义：只能根据指示完成任务的，只能称之为低级人工智能，或是机械。而要懂得思考、从经验中学习、并且懂得质疑的，才能称之为高级人工智能，某种意义上说便可以称之为“人”了。而以此对应的三个结局也是令人深思：（含剧透）●如果你只是按照“神”的指示一直走到最后，却不懂得质疑，那便不能成为“人”。只能迎来死亡的结局。    ●而如果你懂得质疑，不去第六层直接去终点，那才能成为“人”，并且获得自由。    ●而如果你兢兢业业地收集完了所有星星、所有关卡，却会因为过于完美而被选为“信使”，就是棺材里躺的那个。从剧情上来讲，《塔罗斯法则》绝对称得上“优秀”我是谁？我在哪？我要做什么？很多人都喜欢拿这款作品与《传送门》两部相比较。而实际上这两款游戏确实有很多相似之处。主人翁都扮演者类似于“世末行者”的角色，都听从着“造物主”的指示，完成其设计的一个又一个的关卡。并且随着剧情的推进，都向“造物主”提出了质疑，并且反抗，最后追求“自由”。但世界观上却又背道而驰，《传送门》两部讲的是:在人工智能发展的末期，逐渐被人工智能所取代的人类，终于作出最后的“挣扎”。而《塔罗斯法则》则是讲的人工智能对“人”这个概念的哲思，并且努力想成为“人”。而很多人都喜欢说:“《塔罗斯法则》在很大程度上借鉴了《传送门2》”我觉得这个说法不无道理。精巧且颇具难度的迷题设计单纯的从“解密”这个角度来讲，《塔罗斯法则》不可谓不是一款优秀的解谜游戏。甚至在整个世界、各个关卡与魔符的协调上，可以说是比《传送门2》更优秀了。设计思路非常清晰，并且关卡可以自由选择，难度也颇具挑战性。而对应的 神之魔符也值得一试，并且两个游戏联动这点上做得非常棒！这可以说是我玩过最优秀的解密游戏之一。可以说，优秀的谜题设计为这款游戏加了不少分。强烈的眩晕感我是不晕3D的，玩《半条命》和《传送门》的时候也从没晕过。但在玩这款游戏的时候真的非常难受，想吐。我想大概是因为镜头太晃，和游戏本身的动态虚化，导致大脑产生了强烈的眩晕感。而强烈的光影特效也加剧了视觉疲劳。另外游戏主题元素和BGM带有强烈的宗教风格，使游戏风格更加“神圣”，但也使玩家在游戏过程中更加压抑，加剧了身体上了不适。建议玩这款游戏的时候合理安排游戏时间，因为真的会很晕，不管你晕不晕3D。独特的画面风格游戏引擎的贴图质量其实还算优秀。但由于其独特的画风，导致游戏画面并不算“真实”。作者仿佛是想往希腊神话里的神庙靠拢，却又掺杂了许多机械元素。对于这种画面风格，我不置可否。但是这款游戏强烈的光影效果，确实很容易引起视觉疲劳，一定程度上也加剧了玩家的眩晕感。糟糕的汉化我是很少以语言来评测一款游戏的，因为我觉得这与游戏内容无关，语言只是传播的工具，一款游戏是否优秀与语言是无关的。并且对于那些小作坊游戏，制作组没钱请汉化组，总不能用机翻吧？但对于这款游戏，这比机翻还糟糕的汉化，我真的很难用语言来形容。汉化做成这样是否显得太没诚意了？这款游戏就算直接不支持中文，也会比这毫无语言逻辑的汉化要好得多。迷一样的优化这款游戏的优化让我感觉很迷，说好也算好，说差也算差。差到750Ti之类的入门级显卡也能玩，960之类的中低端显卡也可以开高特效，并且比较流畅。但好到1080Ti这样的顶级卡却有时候也会卡一下。总体优化感觉很迷，再好再差的显卡都基本流畅，但偶尔都会卡一下。但总体来说，游戏的配置要求确实比较低，算是一项加分项吧。值得一试，但并不完美，打折扫货推荐总体来说，这款游戏还是称得上“优秀”的。原价的一百多，在我看来并不值得。因为这款游戏由于种种原因，并不能算很好玩，甚至你连坚持玩通关都很难。但还是一款值得一试的游戏，打折扫货的话，5折就很值了。总体评分：5.8/10
Portal 2, pero sin portales
啧，买游戏不送CSGO里的同名音乐盒我不是很认可，建议向隔壁哈迪斯和光环学习，买游戏就送音乐盒好吧。（塔罗斯的法则这音乐盒还不便宜，普通的就要二十块，游戏还是打折的时候花三十买的....）

Desculpe Portal, mas esse game conseguiu te superar.Não tenho palavras pra descrever esse game, foi um dos melhores jogos que joguei, não só na categoria puzzle, mas em todas.O jogo te passa um sentimento de paz e tranquilidade que consegue te transportar pro paraíso onde ele se passa.

+ wymagająca z wyważonym poziomem trudności+ świetna fabuła przedstawiona w oryginalny sposób+ długa i nie pozwalająca się nudzić+ dopracowany, otwarty i zróżnicowany świat+ filozoficzne rozważania skłaniające do refleksji+ kilka różniących się diametralnie od siebie zakończeń+ oprawa audiowizualna+ easter eggi- w pewnych momentach optymalizacjaOcena 9,5/10

An absorbing puzzle game with a rich, intriguing backstory. Some puzzle mechanics will remind you of Portal 2, but The Talos Principle puts comedy aside and asks you to consider what it means to be a human, a person, or an intelligent puzzle-solving organism. Recommended.

This game is absolutely stunning.I am a fan of the portal series and so Steam recommended this game to me. After reading the store page and reviews I was really excited for the game. I immediatelly downloaded the Demo version and just after some twenty minutes I knew that I absolutely have to have this game.  And I don't regret buying it at all.PuzzlesThe Talos Principle is logically challenging, starting with easy to solve puzzles but as you progress the difficulty slowly increases. However the real defficulty generally lies in the approach you take. Some levels may seem impossible to solve but once you make the first steps you realize that it was in fact easy all along.GraphicsThis game looks gorgeous even though the minimum specs are low. I played this game on a mid-range mobile GPU without any problems. I really like the games design and feel, it gives a special feel the game.Highly philosophicalThroughout the game you will be talking to the Milton AI who will be asking deep questins about your views uppon the world and some of your opinions. These were so fitting to the story and gameplay that they made me question not just the in-game world but our own real world as well. Sometimes I just had to stop playing and think about them. However there is one thing worth mentioning and that si: You don't have go through this part of the game at all but you will miss a lot.Soundtrack and voicesThe audio is deffinitely the best one I've had the opportunity to hear. Elohim's voice is exactly what I would imagine from someone like him. And the soundtrack is just perfect. It is so fitting. I just had to buy it as well.

Io faccio una premessa pericolosa. Detesto i puzzle game. Mi danno sui nervi e non sono in grado di rilassarmi.Però. Però... Sto continuando a macinare ore su The Talos Principle nonostante tutto.Perché?Innanzitutto (motivo banale) perché è una bellissima esperienza visiva. La grafica e il design sono curati bene, pur conservando uno stile un po' spartano (il gioco dopotutto utilizza l'engine di Serious Sam, che è sempre stato bello essenziale). Tutto il primo mondo ricorda un po' una passeggiata tra rovine romane.Ciò che più mi ha intrigato è il lato filosofico e misterioso del gioco. Sì, c'è un sacco di lore ci vuole impegno per stargli dietro, ma ciò non deve intimorire chi, come me, non ha troppa sbatta di leggere, confrontarsi su internet, interrogarsi.....E qui viene la parte super interessante: ad un certo punto del gioco - molto presto - si avrà modo di discutere ed intervenire in prima persona su questioni particolarmente delicate della filosofia uomo-macchina. Non spoilero perché per me è stata una bella sorpresa, ma c'è un tipo di interazione col videogioco veramente tanto originale, che darà modo addirittura di restare colpiti sulle proprie stesse idee. In pratica sto sopportando l'idea dei puzzle (che però sono fatti bene, intriganti e mai troppo impossibili) solo per avere nuovi momenti di questo tipo. Un bel gioco, molto interessante e soprattutto originale. Consigliato agli amanti degli enigmi, a chi ha giocato e gradito Portal e a chi vuole fare una pausa dal pew-pew ignorante in favore di qualcosa in grado di comunicare alla persona dietro allo schermo ♥♥♥ una facilità che raramente si vede in un videogioco.

30+ часов великолепных головоломок и детально продуманных уровней, которые интересно изучать вдоль и поперек в поисках многочисленных пасхалок. Все это вкупе с философским сюжетом, заставляющим задуматься о многих вещах, приятной музыкой и красивой графикой мало кого оставит равнодушным.

Nagyon jó játék, logikai, gondolkodós. Sok-sok órát ellehet vele szórakozni míg 1-1 rejtélyre rájön az ember :) Ha megvan vegyél fel és segítek ha elakadsz vagy csak osszuk meg egymás gondolatait mondjuk egy kulcskeresés közben :D

Zu aller erst: Ich schreibe nicht oft Bewertungen hier auf Steam, nur in Ausnahmespielen wie diesem hier ringe ich mich durch eine Bewertung zu schreiben...Zu aller erst: Ich habe das Spiel im Weekend-Sale für 9.99€ gekauft, und habe damit jz gut 22h verbracht und habe alle drei Enden gesehen. Hier nun meine Einschätzung:Grafik:9/10Die Grafik ist der Oberhammer. Gleich in der ersten Minute war ich verblüfft was aus der Engine alles rausgeholt wurde und dass ein Spiel (das später auch recht komplex zu rendern ist) dermaßen gut aussehen kann. Normalerweise wäre das eine glatte 10 für mich gewesen, es kam nur in ein, zwei Welten zu ein paar Grafik Problemen wie nicht geladene Models bzw. einfach schwarze Texturen. Daher der eine Punkt Abzug.Gameplay:10/10Das Gameplay ist ebenfalls sehr erfrischend und hammer gestaltet mit vielen Rätsel Elementen. Die Rätsel (insgesamt 129 Stück) sind alle ausgewogen und es sind zum Teil auch extrem harte dabei. Immer wieder ist mir aufgefallen wie genau manche Rätsel aufgebaut sind, sodass manche Lösungsansätze schon im Keim erstickt werden und einem nicht etwa durch Glitches o.Ä. zum Erfolg verholfen wird.Performance7/10Leider kam es bei mir (FX-8120, R9 270X) immer wieder zu starken Performance Einbrüchen, gerade wenn eine Welt neu geladen wurde oder ich mit den Aufzügen in die Keller gefahren bin o.Ä. Ansonsten hatte ich immer konstant über 60FPS, teilweise schon über 120.Story(-telling):10/10Ich hatte selten so ein Spiel, das mit einer solch tiefgründigen Story aufwarten konnte. Im Laufe des Spiels muss man über sehr sehr vieles Nachdenken und auch für sich Entscheidungen treffen, auf die man sonst nie gekommen wäre. Ein kleines Manko dazu aber: wenn man nicht auf die vielen Terminals achtet kriegt man die Story wohl kaum mit. Diese piepen und blinken aber, sodass man gut mitbekommt wenn es neue Nachrichten gibt. Ein weiteres Element ist eine 'göttliche Stimme' und rund 20 Sprachmemos, die die Geschichte noch weiter vertiefen und erzählen.Als nettes Extra sind überall in den Levels noch QR Codes verteilt, die man zum Teil am Computer lesen kann, aber auch zum Teil ein QR-Code-Leser am Handy benötigt wird. Für ein bestimmtes Ende lohnt es sich sogar ein paar dieser Codes gelesen zu haben. ;)Audio9/10Die Auswahl an Musik, Geräuschen und Erzählerstimmen ist mehr als genial und passt sich perfekt an Die Atmosphäre bzw. der Story des Spiels an. Eigentlich eine glatte 10, aber durch ein etwas 'schwammiges' Audiomenü hier einen Punkt Abzug.Atmosphäre5/5Die Atmosphäre, die in diesem Spiel erreicht wird ist gigantisch. Sei es durch die etwas erdrückende göttliche Stimme oder durch die Hintergrundmusik, ich war gleich versunken.SonstigesMenü: Ein wirklich innovatives und perfekt gestaltetes Menü: +1 PunkteInteraktion mit (Steam-)Freunden: Es gibt Möglichkeiten überall im gesamten Spiel seine Fußstapfen zu hinterlassen und durch ein bestimmtes Ende sogar zu einer Art 'Promi' zu werden: +2 PunkteFazit:53/55Eine klare Kaufempfehlung: Klar es fällt durch die 22h etwas knapp aus, aber es lohnt sich. Ich hatte wirklich selten so ein Spiel, das mich derart in den Bann gezogen hat wie The Talos Principle. Es hat ein paar Macken, aber diese werden durch einiges wieder wett gemacht. Kurzum: Ich denke ich habe ein neues Lieblingsspiel in der Kategorei Rätsel gefunden. In meiner Rangliste ganz klar vor den Portalteilen und Antichamber.Hut ab an die Entwickler, Desiger, etc.!
先不说游戏本身制作精良这游戏除了有简体中文和语音，还有广东话！这比连中文字幕都没有的厂商高到哪里去了

THE TALOS PRİNCİPLE MACERA, BULMACA, BAĞIMSIZ YAPIMCI	 Bu oyun, oynarken beni en çok kararsızlığa düşüren oyunlardan biridir. Oyun o kadar gizlice saklanmış göndermelerle dolu ki kimin tarafını seçeceğini şaşırıyor insan. Önemli Detaylar;     Oyun öyle ahım şahım grafikleri olmasada, bir bulmaca oyununda olması gerekenden çok daha güzel olduğunu söyleyebilirim. Modellemeler ve kaplamalar gayet yerinde olmuş. Yeri geldiğinde oturup manzara izlenebiliyor.Böyle bir oyunda grafiklerden fazla söz etmeye gerek yok açıkcası.    Oyunda 3 dünya mevcut ve müzikleride ona göre seçilmiş. Oyunu oynarken müzikleri de dönemle ilişkili olduğundan sizi o dönemin havasına sokmayı başarıyor. Ayrıca oyun içinde göndermeler bulduğunuzda onlarla alakalı müziklerde çalmaya başlıyor. Kullandığımız nesneler genel olarak bu dünyadan olmadığı yada henüz keşfedilmediği için, keşfedilseydi sesleri nasıl olurdu gibi bir tahmin yürütemiyorum. Sonuç olarak oyundaki sesler gayet tatmin edici seviyede.    Hikayemiz kısaca insan aklını/ruhunu robot üzerinde yaşatarak bilinçli bir robot birey elde etme çalışması diyebiliriz :P Oyuna beyniniz sıfırlanmış bir biçimde doğmuş ( Yeniden doğmuş	) olarak kendini elohim olarak tanıtan tanrının dünyasında belirli aşamaları geçmek ve testi tamamlamak amacıyla doğuyorsunuz. Oyun boyunca yeri geldiğinde elohim yeri geldiğinde elohim karşıtı bilgiyasardan konuşan abimiz size yapmanız gerekenler doğrultusunda yönlendirerek bir seçim yapmak zorunda bırakıyor, hangisini seçeceğiniz size kalmış. Oyununun birden fazla sonu olması ve oyunun sonunu kendinizin belirlemesi gayet hoş olmuş.     Oyun ilk başta bulmaca çözmek üzerine olduğu için Kontrollerde ona göre dizayn edlmiş. Oyunun oynanması gayet kolay ve kontroller hiç sıkıntı çıkarmıyor. Oyunda yaklaşık 150 adet bulmaca var ve bulmaca severlerin en az 25 saatini harcar diye tahmin ediyorum. Bulmacalar yeri geldiğinde zor yeri geldiğinde kolay olabiliyor. Her odada kolay ve zor bulmacalar beraber bulunuyor, bu şekilde oyuncunun sıkılmamasını amaçlamışlar diye düşünüyorum. Oyunda 3 adet dünya mevcut (A,B ve C şeklide) bunların arasında gidip geliyorsunuz, örnek olarak 1. dünyada bir odaya girebilmek için 3. dünyadan bazı nesneler getirmeniz gerekiyor. Oyunu oynaması gazetedeki bulmacaları çözmek gibi canınız sıkıldığında 1-2 saat rahatlıkla eğlendirir. Oyunda gördüğüm tek eksik şeyler ise bazen saklanmış göndermelere ulaşmaya çalıştığımız anda hareket zorluğu yaşıyoruz. Ayrıca 3. bakış açısında oynarken çok saçma bir yürüyüş tarzı var robotumuzun ama ben pek sorun etmedim genelde 1. bakış açısıyla oynadım. Hikayesiyle, atmosferiyle, sesleriyle, bulmacalarıyla tek kelimeyle muazzam bir oyun.

"Talos, Yunan mitolojisinde, Hephaistos tarafından bronz dövülerek şekillendirilmiş dev. Zeus, sevgilisi Europa'yı Girit'e gönderdikten sonra, Talos'u onun koruyucusu olarak görevlendirmiştir. Daha sonra Talos'a adada devriye atma, korsanları kıyıdan kayalık yerlere doğru uzaklaştırma görevi verilmiştir." Wikipedi Bu oyun kelimelerle anlatılamayacak kadar güzel bir başyapıt. Aslında yalnızca oyun demek hata olur, Felsefe bu oyuna öyle bir yedirilmiş ki kendinizi gerçekten yaşamı sorgularken buluyorsunuz. Bulmacalar gerçekten çok zekice, Portalı sevenler bunuda sevecektir eminim.Bölüm tasarımları oyunun felsefesine göre hazırlanmış. Oynarken etkileşim içine olduğunuz dünyayının gerçekliğini sorgulayıp ikilemde kalıyorsunuz. Oyuna adsız bir robot olarak kendini Elohim olarak tanıtan bir ruhani sesin yönlendirmesi ile başlıyoruz. Sizi Keşfetmek ve aydınlanmaya giden yolun bir parçası olmak için çeşitli bulmacalar içinde gizli "Sigils" denilen parçaları toplayarak Elohim'in ölümsüz yaşam vaadi ile yarattığı dünyalardaki bulmacaları çözmeye çalışıyorsunuz. Elohimin oyunun başında sizden  tek isteği vardır. Kule denilen yere tırmanmamanız. Burda yasak elmaya bir gönderme var.Oyunda pek çok felsefeciden alıntılar var. Oyunun müzikleri ve Seslendirmeleri de (özellikle Elohim) çok güzel yapılmış, sizi oyunla bütünleştiriyor. Oyun verdiğiniz kararlara göre farklı sonlarla bitiyor. Kısaca bu oyunu oynamayan çok şey kaybeder.

I've never played a game that made me appreciate the real world this much. Somehow, staring at beautiful vistas in-game has made me stop and notice them in life, too, and it's magical. Sometimes the puzzles drag on, but other times tje game makes you feel like you outsmarted it by finding a solution you "weren't supposed to find." There seem to be endless secrets and easter eggs to find, if you look. I bet this game would be fantastic in virtual reality.

Comprei Talos Principle com receio de estar comprando uma simples imitação de Portal. Apesar de Portal ser uma das inspirações e os desenvolvedores não negarem isso, na minha opinião o "discípulo" superou o "mestre".Os puzzles são legais e divertidos de solucionar, mas o que mais me cativou foi a narrativa envolta em mistério, que te coloca para refletir sobre vários aspectos da vida. É um daqueles games que transcendem o entretenimento por si só, é uma obra de arte.

万圣节期间40入的本体+全dlc，还是很划算了翻译差劲，但是配音质量出奇地好。尤其表白lily pan小姐姐（没错就是alexendra的配音，特意看了，笔芯）都说挺简单，确实挺简单的，跟传送门比。。。感觉似乎难度差不多？然而下一步要准备all star和road to gehenna了，emm。。。 挺不错的作品，引人深思，音乐也还行对了，配置不高。其实不够配置也没事，会提醒你配置不够，但是对配置不够的也能很流畅的进行，可以说优化很好了一个意外之喜：发现闲逛的时候捡到的喷漆可以在墙上涂qr码，不止如此，你涂完以后，等你steam上的好友后来也买了这个游戏以后也玩到那个地方的时候就会发现你留下的qr码，所以要慎重选择你要留的，可能成为过关或者剧情的提示（信息很隐晦所以剧透是绝对不可能的）。另外，如果你是messager，等以后你的好友再打的时候，去坟墓里唤醒的三个messager里会有你~ ><因为提前看了攻略和剧情解析，我是肯定被剧透过了（有点后悔），不过即使如此最后的结尾还是挺震撼的。如果想尽情享受乐趣的话建议还是避免剧透吧，至少先通关一遍之后再追求全收集全结局都过去一年了，居然还加入了dx12更新，很良心了。。。等等，创意工坊居然出了？！什么时候的事儿。。。工坊都出来了，好友联机什么时候能加上啊。。。。

ストーリー（雰囲気）、適度な難易度、美麗な風景で構成されたＦＰＳ（ＴＰＳ）パズルゲーム。非常に面白かった。■日本語あり（吹き替え・字幕）steamのパズルゲームというとPortal2がありますが、あちらよりもカジュアルな印象です。開発者の難易度設定が絶妙で、クリアに必要なパズルは、難しくなりすぎないように作られています。ストーリーに重きを置いているゲームではありませんが、ミステリアスな雰囲気が素晴らしく、美麗な風景も相まって飽きさせません。パズルが得意な人は、高難易度収集（スター）もあるので歯ごたえが足りないということはないでしょう。解法も必須部分は基本的に小マップ内で完結していますが、敢えて他のエリアからパーツを持ち出して来たりといった「裏技的」な解法を探るのも非常に楽しく、Portal2にはなかった部分だと思います（スター収集では必須な場合も在り）。日本語が字幕と合っていない部分も多々見受けられますが、おそらく録音ギリギリまで翻訳を苦労していた部分だと思いますので、むしろ開発者のがんばりの現れだと思います。P〇TAL2と比べて・風景が綺麗（閉鎖的ではない）・ステージ毎の繋がりがある場合がある（但し、クリアに必須部分は小ステージで完結している）・難易度はやや低い（ボーナススターは探すのが大変だけど必須ではない）一言ボーナススターを自力で集めようとしたら、１個足りず（発見できず）、１個は自力入手不可でした。 時計のやつです・・・足りなかったやつは探索不足だと思いますが、後者はできればイースターエッグ（完全なオマケ要素）にしてほしかったですね日本人には理不尽な難しさ＠＠；
When i saw this game i expected something like a PortalBut what i got is 10x better! Mind blow story and complex puzzles!11/10

Красивая головоломка с отличным философским сюжетом. Обязательно ознакомьтесь.

塔罗斯的法则是一款3D解谜游戏，游戏中对几何物理的运用炉火纯青，常常给玩家意想不到的惊喜和收获（当然，长时间解不开也会非常的烦恼和躁动）。和其他解谜游戏不同，此款游戏的重点不在“思考”，而是“尝试”——只有你想不到的，没有你做不到的，在思考的同时更注重尝试，这点对于培养实践能力来说是很重要的。个人认为游戏的内容略有些晦涩枯燥，但是对于场景解谜游戏来说，内容并不是重点，只是一个细微的引导和游戏世界观的介绍。游戏的画质真的是很棒，对风景的打造也是很用心的，玩家们如果玩累了，不妨站在海边看看海，在巨大的遗迹上到处走走，欣赏一下风格迥异的“异国风情”。

The Talos Principle is one of my favorite games of all time. Never has a game's story been this intriguing.Pros-Fun puzzles-Lots of puzzles-Intriguing story-Very long-Good soundtrack/ambience-Optional in-game hints for when you're stuck-Extremely immersive-Phenominal narrator♥♥♥♥-Main puzzles were a bit too easy for my taste-Optional puzzles could be flatout ridiculous (not very often though)Before I get more in depth I want to say one thing. Many people compare this game to Portal, but it's very different. The only thing that's the same is that it's a first person puzzler. The way you solve puzzles is completely different. I don't understand the comparison to Portal.There are three hubs full of puzzles in this game. Each hub has 7 areas that you can enter that contain anywhere from 3 to 6 puzzles in them. I figured out how to play the game pretty quick so I went pretty quickly through the first hub. The second hub gave more of a challenge to me but it wasn't too hard. When I got to the third hub I was expecting it to get a lot harder. That didn't really happen. The difficulty did increase, but not by a ton. Maybe it's because I was abnormally good at the game. I've seen that many people found the last hub to be very hard. I very rarely spent 15 minutes on a puzzle, I probably averaged 7-10 minutes. The difficulty not increasing a ton might be because the hidden stars were meant to be the biggest challenge.The difficulty I had finding the hidden stars went from pretty easy to how am I supposed to figure this out. There is one star in particular that was pretty much impossible. When you entered one of the levels there was a QR code. Normally the game tells you what they say, but it didn't for this one. You had to manually figure it out. Then I believe there was another process you had to do. This let you figure out what numbers you had to press on the pillars surrounding the QR code. I'm not sure how I was supposed to figure out to do that. Another issue I had with the stars was it was very hard to figure out where the stars were when I came back to a level to find them. It tells you how many stars are in each level, but once you're in the level there's no hints. I ended up using a guide to find them since I didn't want to spend hours of my life looking for them.I've been pretty negative so far in this review, but I really love this game. The story hooked me from the beginning, which rarely happens to me. Every puzzle was a lot of fun. There was never a dull moment. The final sequence of one of the endings is one of the most intense moments I've experienced in a game. I was constantly immersed in the game. I was so immersed that I usually played the game for over 4 hours straight.Do yourself a favor and buy this game right now. It's definitely worth it.

If you're reading reviews to decide whether to buy the game or not, I will just say this: if you enjoy puzzle games and philosophy, this has the potential to be your favorite game. Just keep in mind the story element of the game is optional, and without the story this game is just a series of puzzles with a potentially confusing ending. Don't get me wrong, the majority of the puzzles are great! But the story is what makes this game amazing, and it's simple to ensure you don't miss it: interact with the terminals and listen to the voice logs. One could arguably say the first couple of encounters with the terminals is somewhat dull, but it quickly blossoms into something unique and interesting, and you don't wanna miss it if you're playing this game.Massive spoilers ahead. I will talk about what the game means from a programmers point of view, which for the non-technical person is hopefully interesting.The Talos Principle is the story of a post-apocalyptic world. A virus has eradicated humans, and in a hastened effort to preserve the qualities of humanity a group of scientists at the Institute for Applied Noematics (IAN) created the Extended Lifespan project. It consists of two parts: a computer simulation that hopefully would result in a general artificial intelligence, and a physical robot of which that artificial intelligence could be uploaded into when the simulation completes, such that the world could be inhabited again.You, the player, play as a "program" in this simulation, which in the game is called "the Process". It is highly implied that this "process" is actually an iterative machine learning training loop, where the "program" you play as is one of the iterations of this training loop. From a technical standpoint, when you start the game, what is really happening is that you, the program, has been spawned into existence as part of the new epoch/iteration of the machine learning training loop. Fun fact: in the games' lore the simulation is actually running inside a game engine as the scientists at IAN were short on time and had to use something prebuilt. So the fact that the game looks like a game is lore friendly, as in inside the game you're inside a game engine!The goals of the simulation is to create a general artificial intelligence, and the scientists measured this in two ways, which is reflected in the simulation:1. The iteration must be general and intelligent, which is indicated by an iteration solving the puzzles.2. The iteration must be curious, which is indicated by an iteration defying Elohim and climbing the tower. As the project lead Alexandra Drennan says in one of the voice logs: "is there anything we associate closer with intelligence, than curiosity?"To summarize, The Talos Principle is about the last iteration of a machine learning training loop which finally met its creators criteria for preserving the qualities of humanity; intelligence and curiosity.That's the literal way to interpret the game anyway. The philosophy of the game is equally interesting, but others have already written about that.

Bazı oyunlar ateş ettirerek eğlendirir , bazıları yarıştırarak . Bu oyun ise düşündürerek eğlendiriyor. Beyni her şekilde çalışmaya zorluyor . Hem bulmacaları çözmeye çalışıyor hem de bilmiş bilmiş konuşan kütüphane asistanına laf yetiştirmeye çalışıyorsun . Bu o kadar da kolay olmuyor tabii. Bulmacalar gittikçe zorlaşıyor ama hiçbiri öyle çözülemiyecek gibi değil. Size önerim bu oyunu oynarken internetten yardım almamanız ve OyunÇeviri'nin yayınladığı çeviriyi indirip  kütüphane yardımcısının felsefi sorularına düşünerek cevap vermeniz. Hiç unutamadığım bir oyun olacağına eminim.  Umarım bu oyunu alır ve sonuna kadar oynarsınız.

The best first person puzzle game there has ever been! (Sorry Gabe!)Weird, but typical Croteam humor with LOTS of easter eggs,  many ways to end the game, beautiful soundtrack, STUNNING graphics and athmosphere. Difficulty varies from beginner to hard to superhard (if you want to search and collect all the stuff)Croteam games has always been very high quality and this is not an exception, "Serious" engine is getting better on every release. If you're a hardcore PC gamer and you think there's not enought options to tweak the graphics/performance and other stuff (there is plenty, really) hit "§" to pop up the console and tune up the game even more (not like in most games, where you can merely turn the FPS graph on/off)11/10 from me.

I came into The Talos Principle thinking I would just be solving Portal-style puzzles with lasers and buttons. I left the game with several philosophical questions on what it means to be human.I enjoyed The Talos Principle thoroughly, and later on became very engaged with the story, even more so than the puzzles. There's plenty of depth to both the gameplay and the writing, both of which will make you think outside the box.
