Steam解谜游戏补完计划（33）个人评价：9分，非常非常优秀的解谜游戏，难度很适中，很适合解谜新手入坑，而且因为有第三人称所以眩晕终于不那么严重了，中文配音也很不错，虽然简中翻译真的是灾难毕竟是老游戏很多该说的都不废话了，就两句话。1，请用繁中游玩，简中基本就是机翻，游戏体验极差，而且付费DLC也只有繁中（甚至中配的台词跟繁中几乎完全对得上，说明简中就是赶鸭子上架临时做出来的）2，把显卡设置里所有带模糊（BLUR）字样的选项全关了，对眩晕有非常好的效果

Absolutely amazing puzzle game with multiple endings. It is as good as Portal 2. If you liked Portal 2 then you will like this game. Instead of Portal 2's humour this game focuses on Philosophy and make you question the reality.9/10

Serious Samでおなじみ、Croteam製の一人称視点パズルゲーム。意外な取り合わせながら完成度は高くパズルの質はもちろんの事、冒頭から謎ばかりの世界観は抜群でプレイヤーの好奇心ごと世界に引き込んでくれます。Portalの影響を感じる部分はやはり散見されるものの、こちらは静的なパズルが中心でプレイ自体は幾分地味。ボリュームは十分ながら難易度も高めで一気に遊ぶには考え疲れしてしまう事も多く、一部隠しは自力ゲットは不可能ではと思えるものあったりと、Portalほど万人に薦められる作品ではないのですが、パズルゲーム好きならマストプレイな一作ではないでしょうか。

Seguramente ya hayas visto referencias a este juego en otros lugares, porque 10 años desde que salió dan para mucho. Pero déjame que te diga qué es lo fundamental que debes saberLos puzzles te van a recordar a Portal, pero en lugar de limitarte a una pistola de portales (una mecánica muy chula, eso sí), aquí vas a tener bastantes herramientas que tendrás que combinar entre sí. La dificultad del juego base es aceptable. Algunos puzzles te resultarán casi imposibles, hasta que un día cualquier vuelvas y te lo pases en menos de 5 minutos probando una cosa que se te acaba de ocurrir. Es asíEn cambio, todo lo relacionado ♥♥♥ las estrellas y el contenido fuera de los puzzles normales, sí que va a ser extremadamente difícil. En mi opinión, deshonesto incluso, ya que no vas a tener a la vista todas las piezas del puzzle hasta que las encuentres. Pero bueno, las estrellas son bastante opcionales.La historia y la filosofía, para pensar en otras cosas mientras vas resolviendo puzzles, va a ser el atractivo principal del juego. Descubrir de qué va todo esto, y qué ocurre en realidad a tu alrededor, ha sido lo más apasionante para mí. Y bueno, ni qué decir que los personajes que tienen voz propia son increíbles. Un casting de voces perfecto. No vas a saber lo necesarias que son para este juego hasta que lo estes jugando. Además, es de los pocos juegos que sí recomendaría jugarlo en castellano. Está muy bien dobladoLa ambientación tranquila y la música también son otros elementos que no vas a valorar hasta que los tengas delante de ti. La historia, la ambientación, todo... está muy bien hilado y es trascendental. La música es de mis favoritas, a pesar de no ser una gran banda sonora, pero se comienza a valorar conforme te sumerges más en él.El DLC lo he valorado a parte. Tiene un enfoque diferente. A mi juicio, no es tan bueno como el juego base, pero tampoco está mal. Y los puzzles son mucho más difíciles. Su historia también se entrelaza ♥♥♥ el final del juego original, y sirve de añadido al trasfondo inicial de la secuela The Talos Parable 2

OPINIÃO PESSOAL:Atualmente, este é o melhor jogo de raciocínio e enigmas — levando em consideração TODAS as características, como gráfico, jogabilidade, história, desenvolvimento, etc.Trata-se de um jogo em primeira/terceira pessoa, onde você assume o papel de um androide, criado e colocado em um ambiente muito bonito, porém limitado. Neste lugar você ouve uma voz (ELOHIM) que afirma ser seu criador, e que promete cuidar e zelar por sua vida e segurança, desde que obedeça suas orientações/conselhos. O jogo se baseia no desenvolvimento deste relacionamento, que aumenta conforme você encontra os sigilos (peças e estrelas) espalhados pelo "mundo".Porém, cada sigilo deste está protegido por um caminho/labirinto de quebra-cabeças. Cabe a nós resolvermos e encontrarmos esses sigilos para avançar na história, pois, segundo Elohim, esses enigmas são testes para exercitarmos nossa mente e melhorar nossa relação com ele.Tudo seria muito simples e previsível se fosse somente isso, mas, em vários lugares deste mundo, existem muitos computadores espalhados que nos dão acesso a uma espécie de sistema criptografado e protegido que, conforme o desenvolver da história, provoca e revela questões que nos faz pensar, e até duvidar, se realmente o que Elohim está dizendo é verdade.Ou seja, encontramos aqui um dos maiores dilemas de toda humanidade... o combate entre duas potências: a RAZÃO, versus, a FÉ — O que faz o jogo ficar muito mais curioso e interessante de se decifrar.Pra fechar com chave de ouro, o jogo possui versões de ÁUDIO/LEGENDAS em Português-BR — muito bom, né?!Se você curte jogos de raciocínio e não possui problemas de labirintite ou coisa parecida ( pois várias pessoas passam mal, devido ao movimento e giro das imagens), este game não pode faltar na sua biblioteca.The Talos Principle — SUPER RECOMENDADO!!!

TL;DR :Jeu de réflexion, à l'ambiance particulière, très prenante, sur fond de philosophie, de sociologie et de science-fiction. Une difficulté progressive et bien dosée, avec un dlc qui ose la pousser plus loin. Truffé d'à-côtés humoristiques et de détails dissimulés. C'est profond et fun de bout en bout, autant niveau scénario que niveau gameplay. Un jeu qui au delà de ses énigmes offre sincèrement de quoi penser, de quoi se marrer, et de quoi laisser son café refroidir à côté du clavier sans s'en rendre compte._ _ _ _ _ _ _Hop. Maintenant si tu as deux minutes, voilà un peu de lecture :On incarne un androïde, qui se réveille dans les vestiges déserts d'un monde semblant anciennement peuplé. Comme venant du ciel, une voix s'adresse à nous. Celle d'un homme, qui se présente en tant que notre créateur et maître des lieux. Il nous a activé pour nous inviter à progresser dans son domaine. Les décors sont emprunts d'architectures antiques, Rome, Grèce, Egypte, et présentent parfois des anomalies visuelles qui apparaissent et se corrigent...On évolue seul. Il règne une forte impression de présence passée, on en trouve fréquemment les signes sous forme de messages écrits ou audio (vous pouvez même en laisser, visibles in-game par vos amis!). Des terminaux informatiques disséminés dans la nature permettent de consulter la mystérieuse Archive, une base de données rassemblant la mémoire d'une civilisation (familière), qui recèle de témoignages passés (présents ou futurs ?), répertoriant pensées, dialogues, mythes, blagues, et citations allant d'Aristote à Philip K. ♥♥♥♥  (steam censure automatiquement son nom ^^ tu sais c'est la traduction anglaise de "♥♥♥♥♥♥") en passant par des penseurs fictifs.Nous avons l'autorisation de déambuler partout, à l'exception de cette tour qui perce les nuages, accessible pourtant, mais dans laquelle il nous est défendu de pénétrer, sans quoi on se verra refuser ce qui nous est promis, à savoir l'existence éternelle (rien que). Jouer le jeu sagement ou transgresser pour mieux comprendre ? Libre à toi !Tout ceci participe à l'histoire intrigante du jeu, et à son étendue philosophique (mais pas prétentieuse), qui jusqu'à la fin interroge à propos de l'humain, de l'existence, du réel et de la conscience, en échange d'un peu de lecture, la doc ayant fait l'objet d'un grand travail, et prendre le temps de la lire entre deux énigmes étoffe grandement l'expérience offerte (la traduction française est à l'heure d'aujourd'hui très réussie). Certains aspects scénaristiques rappellent un jeu de logique bien connu, mais sans le plagier pour autant : The Talos Principle à ses propres ressources. L'ambiance ! Elle est propre à ce jeu. C'est relaxant tout en pouvant devenir étrange et tendu. Le travail sonore est très réussi, et les musiques qui accompagnent nos cogitations sont reposantes et restent dans la tête. On peut penser tranquillement. L'emprise de l'intrigue, les réflexions qu'elle amène, les décors particuliers, les secrets et détails cachés qui y fourmillent...tout ce travail a été léché et le résultat est carrément immersif !Niveau gameplay (1ere ou 3eme personne au choix), le jeu offre une complexité croissante sans surprendre le joueur, qui rencontre petit à petit les mécaniques nécessaires à la résolution ce qui suivra. Différents éléments s'ajoutent aux problèmes posés, se combinent. Les logiques sont intelligentes, stimulantes. On apprend à les comprendre, les imbriquer, les développer, les transgresser. Sans cesse du neuf, dans un système cohérent ! Les éléments peu à peu implémentés seront les mêmes tout au long du jeu, mais leurs occurrences et utilisations seront très créatives et variées.L'endroit est un nexus connecté à plusieurs aires renfermant chacune plusieurs énigmes, ce qui permet de remettre à plus tard un problème sur lequel on bloque et ainsi continuer d'avancer.En plus d'énigmes secondaires plus poussées que les principales, on découvre un côté exploration étoffé, avec des easter eggs foisonnants, assez débiles, et plus ou moins conséquents, allant de l'anecdotique à carrément la sous-quête. N'hésitez pas à vous dire "nan ils y ont quand même pas pensé ?!" Parce que bien souvent...si. Beaucoup de références...j'en dis pas plus mais si vous aimez fouiller, attendez-vous à être récompensé.Pour les joueurs-euses séduit-e-s, le DLC "Road To Gehenna" est assez consistant et propose des énigmes dont le niveau de difficulté commence là où s'arrête celui du jeu principal, ce qui est bienvenu, surtout quand on est un peu resté sur sa faim niveau complexité. Un scénario parallèle bien foutu prolonge l'histoire et l'étoffe. C'est parfait pour continuer l'expérience sans se lasser, avec des énigmes bien plus complexes.Dans la mythologie Grecque, Talos est un géant de bronze, fabriqué de toutes pièces par l'homme, possédant une veine unique à l'intérieur de laquelle coule un liquide lui permettant la vie, le mouvement, l'action ... Un peu comme toi.
非常的好玩，我很喜欢，希望把DLC也翻译了吧！难度适中，有的地方还可以卡BUG过，DLC过了一会还可以，等待中文在过！

Salut les gamers !  Talos, dans la mythologie grecque, était un géant de bronze, aussi considéré comme un automate, qui gardait la Crête. Ainsi le principe de Talos évoque la notion de conscience chez une machine et nous y questionne pertinemment... The Talos principle est un puzzle game scénarisé, édité par Devolver et sortis en 2014, où l'on incarne une machine chargé de récupérer des sigils en résolvant des puzzles. Un jeu mélangeant beaucoup de genres naratifs dans son scénario et sa contemplation, passant par la philosophie et la religion.En effet ce jeu, à caractère assez inhabituel, nous embarque dans une véritable aventure philosophique nous questionnant sur la vie, l'héritage culturelle, ou la conscience... Le jeu entier a plusieur référence culturelle et même des élément direct liés à la Bible tel que le tentateur mystèrieux qui évoque le serpent ou bien Elohim qui s'apparente à Dieu. Une réalisation au top avec un scenario qui va se rendre plus interessant au fur et à mesure, qui, plus que nous apprendre où nous sommes ou ce que l'on dois faire, nous instruis sur notre identité, en tant qu'IA et en tant qu'Homme. Dans le jeu on nous poses sans cesse des questions philosophiques par le biais de discussions par ordinateur, à partir de cela on se demande si l'on est définis par l'ia que l'on incarne ou par nous même. Des archives diséminées un peu partout nous en apprennent plus sur ce qui s'est passé et ce qui se passe... Le jeu est énorme, et plus on avance plus on comprend le choix des décors, ou des textes. Les fins sont très différentes les unes des autres avec un réel point d'orgue pour chacunes et qui n'ont un caractère ni bon ni mauvais mais qui nous invites plutôt à repenser à tous ce que l'on a vécu et pourquoi ce choix de fin...Pour la partie ludique, les puzzles sont extremements bien construit, et ils s'accroient très rapidement en complexité. Les puzzles du dernier monde sont, pour la plupart, très compliqués, et vont vous faire rager tant la solution est élaborée. Comme dans puzzle classique, de nouveaux éléments sont ajoutés au fur et à mesure pour apporter un certain renouveau dans leurs constructions, et cela passe par les lasers, les ventilateurs, et même les enregitrements de vous même (oui c'est compliqué). Le jeu, évidemment est composé de "secrets", ce sont donc des étoiles qui sont disposées un peu partout vous permettant de débloquer l'aide des sages (mais ne l'utilisez pas si vous voulez avoir les succès).  Les graphismes sont quasi réalistes, ce qui est parfait pour un jeu de cet acabit. Des fois on a juste envie de prendre des screenshot pour conserver les différents paysages du jeu. En effet, l'histoire veut que vous alliez dans des ruines d'anciennes civilisations, respectivemment : Grecs, Egyptiennes, et du Moyen-Age, pour trouver les sigils, donc il fallait que cela soit comme une visite de site virtuelle. Et pour ma part c'est réussis, quand je fais les puzzles je suis completement dans l'ambiance d'un certain héritage historique, comme si on refaçonnait l'histoire. Dans un certain sens c'est triste, visiter des ruines qui ont vu la splendeur du monde prospérer qui ont bati l'humanité, et qui ne conserve plus que la mémoire de cette gloire passée. On a un son très pro, impeccable par sa qualité au niveau de l'environment, et surtout par les élément qui compose les puzzles. Pour tout ceux qui y ont jouer, ils se souviendront toujours du bruits horriblement stressant des mines qui se rapprochent de vous, tututututuTUTUTUTTU BROUMMMM. Le doublage d'Élohim est génialissime tant il nous donne vraiment une impression de dieu qui peut s'avérer tantôt bienveillant, tantôt malveillant. Et enfin la musique est parfaite pour l'ambiance du jeu, pour les phases de puzzle elle nous immerge complétement et nous suis après, pour dire, c'est même un des seuls jeux ou j'ai acheté la soundtrack. Et chaque fois que je lance le jeux, sans déconner, j'écoute le chant grégorien en entier, parce que je le surkiffe, et ouais, je suis comme ça...Bon c'est vrai j'ai utiliser énormément de compliment dans cette critique, mais c'est réellement mérité. Ce jeu a dû être un vrai casse tête pour les développeur, moi même je n'ai vu ça dans aucun jeux video, la recherche d'originalité atteint vraiment son paroxysme. Ainsi ce jeux fait partis de mon top d'oeuvres majeurs, et pas seulement en termes de jeux, c'est de l'art qui mérite un détour pour tout amateur de bonnes expériences.

El Principio de Talos no es un juego de puzzles y ya. Es una reflexión sobre cuestiones filosóficas, morales, fe, religión y el significado de ser humano.Durante vuestro viaje os iréis encontrando ♥♥♥ una IA, asistente de biblioteca Milton, la cual se manifiesta a través de diversos monitores repartidos por los niveles.  También iréis encontrando, desperdigadas por los niveles, una serie de reflexiones en forma de grabaciones de voz que os harán ir atando cabos. A mí me encantaron algunas de ellas.Nuestro amigo Milton se dedicará de vez en cuando a haceros preguntas existenciales que habréis de responder ♥♥♥ una de las opciones que nos dé. Según vuestra respuesta accederéis a uno u otro final y debloqueareis el logro asociado. Hay varias opciones.No he hablado del personaje ni he dicho que podéis emplear la vista en 1ª o en 3ª persona. Tenéis varias funciones: correr, andar, saltar, coger cosas y rebobinar. Esto último es para cuando la caguéis y tengáis que deshacer un puzzle y empezar de nuevo. Lo vais a usar y mucho.La trama va de recorrer mundo tras mundo resolviendo una serie de puzzles para obtener una serie de piezas de tetris de toda la vida sigilos ♥♥♥ los que abriréis cerraduras que nos den acceso a otros mundos.Hay 3 grandes mundos ♥♥♥ 7 niveles de puzzles cada uno. Al que le parezca poco, no sabe lo que dice. Y luego está La Torre. No digo nada más. La ambientación de cada mundo está basada en diferentes culturas de la antigüedad y sus escenarios son paisajes dignos de lo que veríamos en un documental del National Geographic.Para resolver los puzzles contareis ♥♥♥ diferentes dispositivos, a medida que vayáis avanzando desbloquearéis acceso a nuevos aparatos. Os los enumero: bloqueador; conector; ventilador; hexaedro; dispositivo de reproducción y bandeja. Bajo el cartel que os indica la dirección a seguir para llegar al puzzle veréis cuales de estos elementos estarán disponibles para resolverlo. Dichos carteles aparecerán tachados si el puzzle que indican ha sido resuelto. De esta forma no os liaréis tratando de recordar por donde os habíais quedado.Y hasta aquí mi review del Principio de Talos. Os recomiendo que lo probéis si os gustan los juegos de puzzles y queréis probar algo fuera de la norma.

Bardzo dobra gra logiczno-filozoficzna. I od razu mówię TAK, porusza poważne tematy, jak egzystencja, wiara czy sztuczna inteligencja. W sumie można nie czytać tych tekstów i nie prowadzić rozmów, ale nie doświadczymy w pełni tej gry i jej przekazu. Pobudza myślenie i stara się sprawdzać czy naprawdę wierzymy w to co mówimy. Niestety polska wersja językowa jest tragiczna i należy grać tylko po angielsku, a co drugi tekst jest napisany bardzo trudnym staroangielskim językiem i długo trwa zrozumienie o co chodzi.Jeśli chodzi o zagadki, to są bardzo wygodnie podzielone trudnościowo, od łatwych, przez średnie i trudne, aż do tych bardzo trudnych i absurdalnie trudnych. Na szczęście nie musimy robić wszystkich i możemy pominąć te najtrudniejsze, bonusowe zagadki. Na zmianę robimy trudne i łatwe, przez co gra się nie nudzi i czujemy postęp. Ja rozwiązałem wszystko, niestety nie bez pomocy internetu 3 czy 4 razy, bo zagadki z kategorii "absurdalne" są prawie nierozwiązywalne. Tylko najbardziej cierpliwi ludzie na świecie mogliby sami wpaść na to, że należy tu i tam wyjść prawie poza mapę, aby rozwiązać taką zagadkę. Czasami operujemy naprawdę na granicy rozsądku.Lamigłówki są dobrze zaprojektowane, wymagają dobrej orientacji w przestrzeni, zarówno w poziomie jak i pionie. Czasami musimy nawet myśleć za dwóch oraz z dużym wyprzedzeniem. Gadżetów mogłoby być jednak trochę więcej, bo używamy właściwie w kółko na zmianę tych samych. Miałem już trochę dość kierowania promieni lasera pod koniec gry.Dodatkowo pośród całej tej powagi przeplata się masa easter eggów oraz innego humoru, więc na pewno nie będziemy przyłoczeni powagą atmosfery. Polecam dla mózgowców!
Si buscaban un juego tan bueno como Portal 2 ¡Aquí lo tienen!
Learn philosophy, do puzzles, have fun.

Вы когда-нибудь задумывались о смысле жизни? Кем вы являетесь, как работаете? Кто или что вы такое? Этими вопросами задается главный герой The Talos Principle.  The Talos Principle — умная и, в каком-то смысле, хардкорная игра. В ней все построено на логике и внимательности. Она разнообразна и богата идеями, которые редко увидишь в других играх. Что важно для любителей головоломок: к выполнению какой-либо задачи ведет сразу множество путей, от самых простых и банальных до сложных и запутанных.В дополнение к огромному количеству головоломок в The Talos Principle присутствует множество различных пасхалок и секретов.И мне кажется, что всё это делает игру шедевром, который не устареет даже спустя много лет.

Rompecabezas y filosofía. En esas palabras se podria resumir un titulo por un lado convencional, pero que por el otro se atreve a tratar un tema de forma bastante profunda y reflexiva. Muchos desafios para pensar nos esperan en una aventura ♥♥♥ interesantes y buenos aspectos. Este juego es un viaje único que se debe recorrer como gamer y más si te gusta el género. ♥♥♥ viaje voy mucho más allá de lo que tu avatar pueda recorrer y desplazarse dentro del propio videojuego, estoy hablando de la exploración a fondo de la mente humana y sus muchas facetas, un exhaustivo análisis psicológico y filosófico. Te despiertas en un mundo que al principio te parece ficticio, pero cuanto mas avanzas, te das cuenta de que no puedes diferenciar entre un mundo ficticio del mundo real, porque se te argumenta en el juego de tal manera que siempre que quieras dar una respuesta racional terminas en un debate sin fin contigo mismo. 10/10

这游戏是我2015年入坑Steam时买的第一批游戏中的一个，过了4年我还是没能通关....相比起传送门来说，这游戏是真滴难，中间一度扔了几年没碰。虽说是个解谜游戏，但有些关卡还挺考验操作，算准时间卡好角度才行，这就有点难受。目前也就仅仅打完了B世界第6关，其中还有一个红色魔符因为掌握不好时间躲不开那两个炸弹一直没拿到。塔爬了3层，后面缺少魔符开不了门也卡了关，这次怕是连绅士通关都难了。星星房、信使房和DLC更是想都不敢想。同时这游戏对我来说还有很劝退的一点，就是关卡制，毕竟每玩过一个关卡都可以随时退游戏，一旦放下就不太容易捡的起来，所以但凡关卡制的游戏我的进度都推得巨慢。游戏设计是真的好，也是真的烧脑。解谜爱好者推荐，但如果是像我一样的通关强迫症患者还是建议慎重考虑。

I got this game because I wanted to play something like Portal. Here are a few main reasons why I did not find The Talos Principle enjoyable.Exhibit A: The game misdirects the player on what you can and can't jump on. At the beginning, you look at walls and buildings with a reasonable assumption that you can't jump on it, since you can't. One-fourth of the way through the game, and you are now instinctively jumping at every single thing you see in hopes of finding a secret star, hidden lore, or a way to cheese the level—most of the time being surprised that the game let you jump somewhere you shouldn't be able to, and other times being disappointed that you can't jump on something that is clearly reachable. It's the classic case of "putting invisible walls to prevent players from breaking the game, except where there are 'hidden' secrets and where we forgot to put them" syndrome. The fact that there are no consistent rules on what the player should be able to reach make navigating levels an annoying and tiresome process.Exhibit B: Sometimes, when you're solving a puzzle, you won't be sure if what you're trying to do is an exploit that is an unintended or intended solution due to the lack of level design found in the puzzles. This can dull the satisfaction from solving the puzzles, which is a crucial part of a puzzle game.Exhibit C: The levels, though immersive, lack a design that help the player focus where their attention should be going. Some areas are pointlessly large and take way too much space than they should need, which may cause some misdirection on what the player should do. And other times, the levels are far too constrictive and linear—you're practically grabbed by the hand and led through the puzzle. This paired with the issue mentioned in exhibit A make the levels seem disorganized and, well, a bit half-assed.Exhibit D: The story comes at you in the form of a bunch of text documents on a black and white computer terminal, along with some philosophical babbling that I find to be childish and naive at best. I lost interest in the story half-way through, and the only thing keeping me going was getting to the ending, which was a let down for me. Going through the asinine task of finding all hidden stars gives you an alternative ending that does not reward the amount of time wasted into finding/getting them. Exhibit E: Most of the puzzles require a tedious set-up process rather than clever solutions: "Put this thing here, now go over here, angle this just right, now wait ten seconds, now run as fast as I can over here, put the box on the button, jump over here, and—oh no, I slipped and fell off. Now I have to do it all again."It's an okay-ish game. You might like it, but for the love of God, don't go hunting for the stars. Just get the red tetriminoes and call it a day. You're not missing out on anything, trust me.

The Talos Principle		* 9/10I was looking for a new puzzle fps game like the Portal games, and then Talos principle came out. I couldn't understand all the excitement and the awards about this game, but I decided to trust them. I didn't regret this...+++Pros+++- Puzzles, lots of puzzles, and many of them get really complicated as well- Ambience. Graphic may not be the best engine ever, but the Serious Engine shows some very neat worlds, it's a pleasure to move around.- The Story. It's very simple but the way it's being unveiled is really great: you have to look for documents, audio logs and other texts that, little by little, tell a very small portion of the story.- The Computer. I've never argued about philosophy and logic so much as with that computer... And he won, that b@$t@rd...XD- The Ending. Spoilerless: the game is such a quiet puzzle game that you'd never expect such a final intense rush. Loved it.- Nice Soundtrack---♥♥♥♥---- The Italian translation for the most important part (The texts and dialogues with the computer) were ridiculous. Google translate could teach a few lessons to the guys who did that terrible job. And looks like Italian isn't the only language horribly translated. Almost all the languages (except for English) are wrong. Luckily seems like the community submitted various amateur translations that definitely work.- Unfortunately it lacks the presence of charming and overwhelmingly funny characters as GlaDOS or Wheatley from portal 2... But maybe they wouldn't fit in this context so it's better this way...

首先，说实话，我是被这个游戏的图标吸引了，一个机械手一只猫，超级好看有木有！这个游戏玩多了让你怀疑人生，我现在不仅仅怀疑人生，还怀疑电脑了，说好的有Mac系统的，Mac系统玩总是黑屏，根本没救，我告你。之后我就用win10玩，呵呵哒，时间一长就完蛋-.-我都服了.游戏是好游戏，但前期很幼稚，关卡太简单。怎么说呢，作为一个外貌协会的，看他的机械手和猫的份上，我就勉为其难地给个好评吧。玩的时候有点上火-.-

Странный получится отзыв. Однозначно не объективный и странный. Не верьте тем, кто говорит, что это философский портал. Настоящая философия это скорее фундаментальные работы специально обученных Ницше, Фейербаха, etc. В конце концов у каждой игры есть своя философия. Портал? Головоломки присутствуют, да. На этом пожалуй и все.Talos Principle это дзен. Если понимаете о чем я. Это музыка. Это в некотором смысле безисходность. Казалось бы, игра такого рода это работа для мозга. Но в ней я отдыхаю. Не спешите закрывать все "достижения", собирать все печати или звезды. Не спешите. Многое потеряете.

Undoubtedly one of my favorite puzzle games of all time, and one of the few games I've 100% because I just couldn't get enough. The game just keeps on giving, without ever feeling repetitive or cheap with it's puzzles. It plays fantastically as a casual game (very few of the puzzles are based on time, all of them can be taken at your own pace, and they do not have to be done in order), and also does a wonderful job with the philosophical side of the game. The questions the game pose are something I did not expect when diving into the game, but quickly became one of my favorite parts of the game.I also highly recomend the Road to Gehenna DLC, which adds another 4.5 'levels' of multiple puzzles, a continuation of the story, and an overall fantastic experience that is well worth the price.The Talos Principle is a game that I cannot recommend enough if you like puzzle games.

This game is absolutely phenomenal. It will captivate you with its amazing sound and visuals all while you rack your brain for solutions to the puzzle at hand.The puzzles are not too complex, nor are they simple. They strike a nice satisfying balance. Which is also complementary to the short breaks you take between puzzles interacting with different characters or reading pertinent excerpts on metaphysics and philosophy of the mind. Oh and did I mention that the atmosphere is captivating?My one, tiniest of complaints is that during some dialogue you seem to be forced to answer certain ways even though there is an illusion of choice; ironically. However, for the sake of storytelling, or illustrating a philosophical point concerning free will, it is definitely excusable and should not stop anyone from enjoying this game.
Me passou a mesma sensação de estar jogando Portal / Portal 2. Só que com uma temática/ambientação diferente. Ainda não terminei, mas pretendo terminar. To gostando bastante!
不知怎么，玩这个游戏确实想吐，也不是晕三D的感觉。。。可能是心理觉得大家都吐了，就陪大家一起吐吧。。
A masterpiece
내인생 최대로 3d멀미 심한게임3인칭으로 겜하는데도 3d멀미 조오오온나심함 30분이상 켜본적이없는게임하프라이프 알릭스도 이정도로 심하진않았는데 로봇 속도가 빨라서그런지 유난히 심함게임 자체는 재미있는데 3d멀미 조금있으신분들은 주의해야할듯

解谜类型游戏，玩法类似于Portal，但解题方式不一样。如果喜欢Portal和解谜，那就不要错过这款游戏。游戏中的彩蛋很多也很有趣，我具体是在优酷看LAOYB播主每关的攻略（很详细，赞一个）一些BGM也很好听，比如在信使花园的音乐就很祥和，搭配迷人的风景，很让人陶醉....另外推荐玩一玩Sigils of Elohim，属于游戏中解谜的一小部分总体8.5/10 分，因为一直都是在解谜，有时会觉得很枯燥(有ios版本)

Croteam is best known for making games about a buff guy in a t-shirt dual wielding miniguns to shoot headless kamikazes with bombs instead of hands who run at you screaming AAAAAAAAAA while the protagonist makes fourth wall jokes and rock music plays in the background.Then the Talos Principle shows up completely out of nowhere, and surprises everyone as a pseudo-philosophical-puzzle-platformer with a striking level of depth. It must've been at least decade since the last time I couldn't find any plotholes in a game, and the last circumstances I would expect to break the streak would be in a Croteam title. The puzzles are what you'd expect, but the story is airtight, and the game is riddled with such a gargantuan amount of secrets that you can go grey without finding them all. There is literally a 2 hour playlist on youtube showcasing nothing but easter eggs. Note: Be warned that the steam achievements contain spoilers. Do not read them lest you find your experience ruined.This game is undoubtedly a dark horse which had never been thought of, and in the last place you'd expect. I cannot recommend it enough to any fan of the genre, the studio, or to anyone who is easily amused by pseudo-philosophy. You have no excuse for not buying it, should a less pricey version show up. What I expected was a straightforward puzzle game. What I got instead was trolled into an existential crisis by the creators of Serious Sam.

Ok first things first... if you read no further, take this message with you: BUY THIS GAME, IF NOT JUST FOR THE SOUNDTRACK.Ok... reading on? I'll elaborate...This game is an excellent first-person style puzzle game, done in the style of Portal (no, it's not portal, and it doesn't try to be, so don't say it's a clone).You awaken in a strange garden and hear the voice of one might presume was God telling you what you're doing and what to do. You're immediately thrust into an environment that looks like it came straight ouf of Riven and was mixed with a Pure Moods cd.The beginning of the game is just learning how to move around and interact with objects, which will ultimately be used to collect Tetris-like pieces called sigils. Sigils play a big part in the game as you play on, where the object is to solve puzzles to unlock further areas to explore. Thrown throughout the game are random tidbits of information stored on computer terminals, complete with a somewhat intelligent computer program that will attempt to test your understanding of the physical world. Also strewn about are lots of QR codes with random blatherings and sparsely helpful information.As you progress through the game (which can easily span 15+ hours) you will encounter puzzles that don't get terribly challenging, but just enough to test your wit, each getting harder as you go. There's even optional extra puzzles, if you know where to look. As you play on, you will unlock tools that make completing the puzzles a lot more fun. The best part is, there's no one way to solve them (ok some of them there might be, but not always). You can do whatever it takes to bend the rules to meet your goal. There's three different endings each with a message and a cutscene to explain why you are where you are and what's to become of you. Telling any more would just ruin the experience.The last thing to mention, (also the first), is the music and visuals. This game has some of the best representations of serene landscape I've seen in a while. Coupled with a soundtrack that is on par with Enigma, you'll definitely not regret just firing this up and letting it sit there while you relax.I had a great time with this game, and even after it's over, it's not over. There's lots of user modded content that will keep you testing your skills against the toughest challenges. I highly recommend this game!

Описание:Очень красивая головоломка с очень запутанным сюжетом. Здесь мы играем за андроида, который пытается найти смысл в происходящем. Игра пропитана кучей философских мыслей,  которые могут навести на серьёзные рассуждения о человеческой душе и разуме. Достойный приемник серии Portal.Об игре: Графика. Игра очень красивая. Может она не настолько детализирована и "графонистая", как современные AAA-проекты, но в ней прорисованы всякие разные мелочи, которые в целом создают приятную картинку. Дизайнеры отлично постарались. Сюжет. Сюжет здесь очень сложный и запутанный. Конкретно нам ничего не говориться. Всю информацию мы получаем по крупинкам и собираем в голове в одно целое. Убрав всю воду, среди которой диалоги с Элохимом [местный бог и создатель мира], записки из архива и разговоры с Милтоном [искусственный интеллект, который сидит в архиве], останется только "Элохим великий создатель миров, ты его дитя, а Милтон - змей искуситель который даёт неправильные (вроде бы) советы". Весь сюжет раскрывается через записи в архиве, что очень, как мне кажется, неправильно. Это не удобно. И ладно если бы эти обрывки информации шли в одном хронологическом порядке, но нет игра вбрасывает их тебе так, как хочет и переплетает это всё с философскими записками о божественной тематике и переписками людей. Единственный нормальный источник философских тем не записки, а капсулы времени. Это аудио дневники,в которых ведутся пространные рассуждения о нашем мире. Очень атмосферно, актёрская игра на высоте. Геймплей. Суть игры в том, чтобы проходить разные комнаты, используя различные механизмы. Аля, Portal без портальной пушки. По прохождению одного такого уровня мы получаем сигил. Сигил - это часть пазла, который используется для разблокировки других механизмов, без которых последующие уровни не пройти. Ещё эти пазлы нужны, чтобы открыть лифты в другие храмы, а так же дл Я b947 b784 h578 s467 l785 f577 p677 b677. В принципе, геймплей не сложный и очень расслабляющий, однако сюжет и некоторые уровни заставляют шевелить мозгами. Мысли. Игра постоянно пытается навязать какое-либо мнение о, к примеру, человеческом разуме, затем она говорит, что это мнение не правильное, а правильное другое, но у второго тоже есть изъяны и поэтому ты должен сам решить эти вопросы для себя. Очень круто. Саундтрек. Приятный Ambient, который идеально подходит под спокойную атмосферу игры.Однообразие. Да, мы открываем новые механизмы, да, комнаты кардинально изменяются, но всё это всё равно наскучивает. Ещё раздражает то, что тут очень мало декораций. Да, они красивые, но постоянно смотреть на эти же самые текстуры раздражает. Если бы игра была меньше, то тогда бы это не было такой проблемой Заключение:Игра потрясающая и заслуживает внимания каждого. Она сделана очень качественно и интересно. А если вы хотите поистязать себя философскими рассуждениями, то эта игра просто идеальна.
- Realmente mereceu cada premio que recebeu ao longo do tempo!- Ambientação incrivel, sem palavras para descrever a trilha sonora, é realmente um game que merece ser jogado!

Bulmaca tarzı oyunlar sevenler için ve içerisinde az da olsa bi hikaye bulunmasını isteyenler için kaçırılmıyacak fırsat :) Talos ayağınıza geldi. Hikayesi emin olun öyle ahım şahım birşey değil fakat içerisinde geçen felsefi yazılar emin olun bulmacalardan daha çok kafa yoruyor :) Her bulmaca zor değil. Arada zor bulmacalar var fakat herşeyi denedikten sonra lanet ederken bir anda "BAM" diye birşey patlıyor beyniniz de. İşte o zaman tek bir hareketle çözüyorsunuz bulmacayı. Oyunu oynarken arada duraklatıp temiz hava falan almayı unutmayın sakın. Yoksa kafa yapıyor. Gözleriniz de yorulabilir. Oyunun üç farklı bitiş senaryosu var. Emin olun birbirinden çok farklı. A ve C haritalarının müzikleri çok güzel hele C haritasının müzikleri muazzam. Daha doğrusu 1-2 müzik koymuş adamlarda :D Oranın müzikleri Elder Scroll müziklerine benzerliği çok var. Benim aklıma direk o geldi. Dinleyip biraz rahatladım şahsen. Oyunun atmosferi falan sizi havaya sokuyor. Şunu da belirteyim oyunun resmi Türkçe yaması var. İçinde zaten. OyunÇeviri ekibinin yapmış olduğu projeymiş. Oyunun sonunda Credit'e de yerleştirmişler. Ellerine sağlık yapan arkadaşların. Evet şimdi asıl gelelim benim için en önemli konuya; hayatının birçoğunu animelerle geçiren arkadaşlar oyunda Japonca dublaj seçeneği var. Japonca dublaj, Türkçe altyazı ile mükemmel bir ahenk var ortada kısacası. Emin olun Japonca yaptığınıza pişman olmayacaksınız. Oyunda Elohim denen bir ses var. O bizimle iletişime falan geçiyor. Japonca seslendirmesi çok başarılı. Oyunu şiddetle tavsiye ediyorum severim diyen arkadaşlar için tabi. Herhangi bir konuda yardımcı olmamı isterseniz ulaşırsınız bana. Şimdiden herkese iyi oyunlar diliyorum. Okuduğunuz için teşekkür ederim. :)

Дамы и господа! Сегодня я расскажу вам о шедевре, который перевернул моё понимание видеоигр! Это - 'The Talos Principle'! Не просто игра, а настоящий интеллектуальный вызов! Здесь каждый пазл - как политический вопрос, требующий ума и смекалки! Это игра, где каждый шаг - это шаг к познанию истины, к пониманию себя и мира вокруг!Вы представляете? Вы - искусственный интеллект, который ищет ответы на вечные вопросы! Где мы? Откуда мы? Куда мы идём? Это - не просто развлечение, это - путешествие в глубины сознания!Графика здесь - на высшем уровне! Каждый пейзаж - как картина мастера, природа и архитектура сливаются воедино, создавая невероятную атмосферу. А музыка! Она завораживает и погружает в раздумья, как будто ты - философ, размышляющий о судьбах мира!И пазлы! Они заставляют вас думать, анализировать, принимать решения! Каждое решение - как стратегический ход в большой политике! Не для слабых умов, поверьте мне!В общем, 'The Talos Principle' - это не просто игра, это - испытание для ума, для характера! Кто сможет пройти её до конца, тот достоин уважения! Это игра для настоящих интеллектуалов, для тех, кто не боится искать ответы на сложные вопросы!Всем рекомендую! Это не просто времяпрепровождение, это - путешествие в мир размышлений и открытий!

可算是大师作品，挺纯粹的解密游戏，不如说是“做题”游戏？HH特别是DLC地狱之路，如同高数难题样真是“审题审题再审题”，有时还会让我怀疑是不是我漏了什么条件？不然怎么会连“第一笔”都下不去？HH；游戏中的一些隐藏星星真是四次元人才能想得到该怎么拿，是真的刁钻又河里。这游戏频频让我的cpu红温，常常事后感悟原来还能这么解而不禁发出“哇哦”一声，HH这就是解密游戏的魅力吧；总的来说《塔罗斯的法则》不论是那充满哲学辩思令人震撼的剧情背景还是单论解密这块都是极其优秀的。
不可否认这个游戏操作起来确实有点晕，而且地图感觉上十分庞大有很多游戏内容，虽然才玩不久，不过还是十分期待

O que é ser humano?The Talos Principle começou como um teste de interação com objetos do Serious Sam 4 que foi evoluindo a ponto da Croteam contratar escritores (Jonas e Tom) para escrever e ambientar o projeto de puzzle, que acabou se tornando um jogo completo magnífico. Como já de para perceber, The Talos Principle é um jogo de puzzle com  um toque de filosofia e religião, que possui uma ambientação meio jardim do éden com alguns cenários localizados em ruinas antigas. O nome “Principio de Talos” se refere a um princípio filosófico fictício criado especialmente para o game, junto de seu filósofo fictício Straton.O jogo começa com você – um robô - acordando em um lugar que parece o jardim do éden – mas com alguns glitches - por uma voz que se intitula Elohim (Deus), dizendo que para você conseguir a vida eterna, precisa realizar diversos desafios. Conforme você vai avançando no jogo, Elohim diz que você pode fazer tudo que quiser, menos subir na torre que causaria sua morte. No entanto um computador começa a conversar com você sobre diversos assuntos além de te fornecer documentos durante o jogo. Ele começa a discutir sobre ideias com você e  incentiva você a ir na torre. Cabe a você decidir se somente quer resolver os puzzles e atingir a promessa de vida eterna ou descobrir os segredos desse mundo estranho...O jogo começa com puzzles bem simples com cubos e jammers e vai cada vez mais liberando algo novo (Como os lasers que pra min são a parte mais legal do jogo). Além dos puzzles convencionais, muita coisa do jogo é escondida. Desde documentos achados no computador, capsulas do tempo ou muitos easter eggs bem criativos. O jogo também possui estrelas, que servem para abrir portas secretas nos Hubs e liberar um mapa a mais (no total de 3). Na parte das estrelas, aí que o jogo começa a ficar interessante.O jogo possui 3 hubs, cada um com 7 fases normais em que cada uma delas contém vários puzzles divididos em dificuldades. Porém o interessante é que o jogo te estimula muito a pensar “fora da caixa”, pois para se conseguir as estrelas é necessário explorar bastante e usar os puzzles de forma criativa para conseguir destravar elas. Por falar nisso, o tutorial do jogo depois de um tempo para de te explicar, fazendo você não seguir as regras, e sim tentar dobrar elas a seu favor pois até os puzzles normais começam a complicar, sendo uma parte por causa da lore em que o mundo em que você está não incentiva a criação de “escravos efetivos” e sim uma pessoa capaz de questionar tudo o que lhe é apresentado.The Talos Principle conseguiu criar muito bem um mundo contendo puzzles e uma história por traz de tudo para justificar o porquê de tudo aquilo existir. O jogo te recompensa MUITO por exploração, sendo ela bem difícil pois as coisas estão bem escondidas mas sempre vale a pena procurar. Pra quem gosta de Filosofia e puzzles numa pegada de Portal, é um jogo recomendadíssimo.Obs: Esse jogo é um dos melhores ports que existe para PC, ele possui várias e várias opções de configuração dos gráficos a ponto de o mais expert em opções gráficas ter que usar o google de vez em quando.

Bardzo dobry tytuł z gatunku gier logicznych Zalety: > Muzyka - duża różnorodność tytułów mimo że należą do jednego gatunku> Rozgrywka - składa się ona z notabene 2 części: rozwiązywania łamigłówek wraz z układaniem tzw. sigili (podobne do puzzli) oraz częsci filozoficznej, złożonej na zasadzie przeglądania różnych fragmentów tekstów, analizy różnych zagadnień egzystencjalnych czy też starcie się różnych poglądów egzystencjalnych (np. Elohim vs Milton)> Fabuła - bogata, rozbudowana o wiele wątków i zagadnień> Szata graficzna - gra wygląda bardzo ładnie mimo względnie niewielkiego rozbudowania jej pod względem technicznym> Niskie wymagania techniczne - gra z 2014, do tego na niezbyt wymagającym silnikuWady:> Cena - bez przecen jest szczerze za duża, więc radzę poczekać aż takowa nastąpi > Progresja trudności - jak dla mnie jest zbyt powolna. Często się zdarza, że aby dotrzeć do odpowiedniego wyzwania, potrzeba pokonać parę pomniejszych/wcześniejszych i o ile to samo w sobie nie jest problemem, to jednak trzeba często wiele czasu poświęcić, by gdzieś dojść (chociażby, by odblokować nowy sektor, trzeba chodzić w tę i wewtę po poziomach, po łamigłówkach, szukać wielu rzeczy, układać te sigile, wjeżdżać/zjeżdżać windą, to po prostu wszystko zajmuje swój czas)Sumując to wszystko, ja bym polecił zakup i rozegranie The Talos Principle (ma pełne polskie wsparcie językowe) mimo pewnych niedociągnięć. Jeśli nie masz jednak żadnego hajsu, to możesz pobrać za darmo podobną grę, także na Steamie - "Sigils of Elohim" , która zawiera te wcześniej wspomiane układanki z sigili, jest także bardzo dobrym tytułem.

Po přidání profilu The Talos Principle na DH jsem se na titul chorvatských tvůrců velmi těšil, ale shodou náhod jsem se k dohrání dostal až na podzim tohoto roku. Odrazovalo mě strohé prostředí a zapeklitost některých řešení prostorových puzzlů. Opak je ale, jak to tak bývá, pravdou, a takzvaná „learning curve“ je v The Talos Principle výborně vybalancovaná a skrze desítky místností si hráč plně osvojí nastavené principy. Přidaná hodnota u této logické hry není humor (Portal) ani nádherná vizuální stránka (FEZ), ale narativ s filosofickým nádech obsahující témata jako simulace, transhumanismus nebo mytologie. Zisk nezávislého tvůrce Jonase Kyratzese se nepochybně vyplatil, a CroTeam získal jak nové fanoušky, tak i reputaci flexibilního studia.Z malého nápadu, který vznikl při vývoji Serious Sama, vznikl opravdu kvalitní titul, který baví po celou dobu (v mém případě 30 hodin) a nabízí i otázky k zamyšlení.

Don't believe all of the positve reviews on here. Try it for yourself. If you have half a brain you'll be more impressed with this game than any review could have prepared you for, even this one. Especially this one. I've only played this for Three hours, but immediately it's evident that this is a special game.  Indeed, it's more than a game. It's a beautiful, provocative, thought experiment AND a wonderful, challenging experience as well. There's nothing at all bad or disappointing about it. If anything it's just a bit difficult to take too much of it in one sitting as it really challenges your intellect.If you're a bumbling idiot who'd rather be shooting 13 year olds screaming expletives into a headset, move along. Because you're reading reviews for a game like Talos Principle already suggests that you're not. In which case you should really download this and play it. It's almost as good as Portal. It's probably better.

Außerdem gibt es jede Menge Easter Eggs zu entdecken die mit bekannten anderen Spielen zu tun haben.Außerdem sollte man eine Gewisse Affinität zu Tetris haben. :DSoundtrack 10/10Game 10/10

Sin entrar en la mitología del gigante de bronce Talos (sugiero que indaguen), la línea narrativa se funde en el juego como juego y como reflexión. Iremos descubriendo la trama en la medida que nos adentramos en la filosofía humana (¿nos volvemos más humanos?). Al inicio escuchamos: "Hijo mío, has nacido del polvo y caminas en mi jardín. Escucha ahora mi voz; soy yo tu creador y me llaman ELOHIM". Una voz omnipresente que nos larga a nuestro libre albedrío, que por momentos parece la figura de un padre ausente y por otros la de un dios.Entonces, en algún momento de un futuro lejano donde la humanidad no existe, despertamos en el cuerpo y la consciencia de un robot. Este mundo emergente lo iremos descubriendo/co-creando a través de fragmentos, textos, y puzzles (de gran dificultad); emulando civilizaciones perdidas como la griega, la egipcia y la nórdica. Un título que recuerda la estética legada del Portal.La ambientación, la música y los sonidos inspiran, enfocan.The Talos Principle es uno de los juegos que más me ha marcado.Recomiendo esta joya.

One of the best games I've played.Fun gameplay---------------In this game, you progress by solving puzzles (mostly environmental puzzles but sometimes classical tetris puzzles as well)  and collecting key items. Gameplay can be switched anytime between first-person and third-person. There can be many ways to solve a puzzle so even the most bizarre ways you imagine, might actually help you to solve them. And there is little to no violence in this game. As for performance, the game is incredibly well optimized for PC. Great story / backstory-------------------------The story is told in a similar way to Dark Souls in the sense that you have find out most of the stuff. You can listen to audio tapes and read text documents you find in game to figure out what really happened and what's really going on. The story is heavily philosophical and is centered around humans and artificial intelligence. Certain coversations (in which you have options on how to reply) can make you really wonder what separates a machine and a person.Excellent music-----------------The music is simply amazing. Fits the game and its moments perfectly.

Когда покупал эту игру, прежде всего ориентировался на схожесть с игрой Portal. Ну не сказать, что бы они прям так уж похожи, но скажем прямо, головоломок от первого лица в данный момент не так уж и много, а достойных и того меньше. В  The talos principle есть сюжет и сюжет интересный, и это как раз то, что роднит эту игру с Portal. Иногда он даже заставляет задуматся о каких то вещах, как бы это банально не звучало. Также в игре присутствует просто огромнейшее количество пасхалок, хотя большую их часть довольно не легко найти. Нужно быть очень любопытным, внимательным, уметь мыслить не стандартно и иметь вагоны терпения! И так как игру делали Croteam, то очень много пасхалок связанных с их другой игрой - Serious Sam. В игре есть своя история, своя фишка, из-за чего игра не кажется посредственной. Вообщем рекомендую для любителей головоломок)

To start: I used to add a longer header to these reviews, but since it often made the review too long to submit, I've opted to leave it on my Backloggery.Gameplay: Well, this most certainly wasn't a game I was expecting from Croteam. A "chamber"-based puzzle game featuring a philosophical story from a company that made games about shooting many, many, many aliens with crazy weaponry? Nonsense. Yet, for this exact reason, I think the game is all the better for it. Mechanically speaking, The Talos Principle is very simple: it only has about six puzzle gimmicks throughout the entire game: blocks, lasers, fans, platforms, cloning utilities, and pressure switches are the ones that immediately come to mind. Every puzzle contains on average two to four of these gimmicks. How does it not get boring? The answer is simple: impeccable level design.As mentioned earlier, this game has the favorite chamber focus to puzzle game level design that Portal started, but it uses this design focus to considerable advantage (something I'll talk about later with star sigils).  While I don't wanna go into the environmental design too early, one of this game's strongpoints is its ability to create very organic feeling worlds while still having very interesting puzzles involved herein. In total there are roughly 120 puzzles throughout the game (excluding star sigils), each one containing one sigil in the form of a tetromino at the end of the stage. These sigils are used for tetromino puzzles in which you have to fill in some form of a rectangle with the tetrominoes you obtain. This provides a nice aside from the environmental puzzle focus of the game.There were only really three puzzles throughout the entire game that I wasn't a fan of, and that's solely because they were item babysitting levels. Other than that, there are some levels that have a bit of item babysitting, but the puzzle usually more than makes up for any potentially tedious backtracking, and there are some insidiously clever puzzles as well. Regarding the difficulty of the game, it's definitely got some puzzles that will stop you from time to time, but they're more toward the end of the game. Also, puzzles are roughly scaled by difficulty by the color of the sigil: green for easy, yellow for medium, and red for hard. There's also grey sigils in there as well, but these sigils are hidden behind star doors.Star doors are unlocked by the aforementioned Star Sigils, which are strewn throughout the stages. They can require you to complete the stage in a particularly efficient way, do some precarious platforming to smuggle items out of the stage, or just be hidden in a particularly hidden area. I had to look up a guide on some of these sigils as I am most definitely not one with the eagle-eyed individuals, but the ones that required puzzles/platforming were pretty challenging, but still fun. There really wasn't any "bad" star sigil to get, either. Star sigils aren't required to complete the game, but they are if you want one of the endings. Apart from that, they do add a pretty good additional challenge to the game if you so want it, and the way that it often requires use of elements from different puzzles - thus making it an area-wide puzzle - can be immensely satisfying to solve.That pretty much sums this game in a nutshell: immensely satisfying. I've always said that any chump can make a game hard; it takes talent to make a game fun and hard. Croteam have that talent, and they've shown it in spades with this game. Despite only having six gimmicks, no puzzle really feels like the other, and they are all still very satisfying to solve. It's definitely a game I could see myself replaying, so if it's value you're wanting out of this game, you'll get it. Even without replays, you can still get a good 16-20 hours out of this game. Despite how much I love Serious Sam, I think this is my favorite Croteam game. It's just... sublime. 10/10.Story: I've got a thing for stories that go hard on philosophy. If you're looking for a straightforward plot, you'll probably be disappointed. This game *requires* you to think about the story in order for you to understand it, but it never feels so vague that you need to look up outside material to truly get a grasp of what's going on. Of course, I would be remiss if I were to spoil such a story as this one, but I'll just say that three seemingly benign lines from one of the ending have been in my thoughts for most of the past 24 hours since I've gotten that ending. Regarding the characters, there's three main ones, but a lot of other side ones. You meet some of the side ones from time to time, and they do a very good job of feeling "real" within the context of the story. As far as the three main characters, two of them seem like archetypes, but there's more going on than what is immediately available at the surface. The third is a very well-written scientist who has quite the character arc in my opinion. Overall the writing does a very good job of reeling you in with its vagueness while also feeling very real given the circumstances, the characters are all pretty well done, and the philosophical material will give you plenty of pause, provided you give it the effort. 10/10.Graphics: The page's screenshots do a pretty good job of illustrating that this game is quite the looker, but I've got one screenshot on my page that I'd recommend looking at if you want an example of just how good this game looks in some areas. As mentioned earlier, this game has some fantastic environmental design that you need only look at that one screenshot to really see. Trees and grass sway in the wind, water splashes down from waterfalls, distorting the light behind it, radiant beams of light blind you with their power... this game just looks stupidly good. It's also really well optimized as well, even if it does prove a bit too much for my GPU to handle at times. It often hovered around 45-50 FPS with my GTX 760 with everything turned up to ultra and AA on 4x (the game did this automatically, which I was quite thankful for), but I don't think that was because of this being a poorly optimized game. Perhaps there were other things I could do to increase the FPS or perhaps my GPU is just derping it up, but it didn't matter; the fact that a game this pretty would run on my system at all at those specs more than makes up for a bit of choppiness.Speaking of lighting, I've always loved Serious Engine's ability to make a sunny environment actually look like a sunny environment. Y'know, the kind of sunny day you really want some sunglasses for. Yeah, Serious Engine has always been a damned impressive engine from a relatively Indie team, and it does not disappoint in this game. I can't wait to see it in use for Serious Sam 4. However, this review is about The Talos Principle, and this game is simply gorgeous. Let's just say that the screenshot I keep going on about is my wallpaper and will be for quite some time. There's a lot of wallpaper-worthy scenes in this game, but in-game they run in real time. Excellent stuff. 5/5.Sound: The soundtrack to this game, much like so much else in the game, is absolutely fantastic. They offer the soundtrack for $5, and I can say that the soundtrack is absolutely worth it for that price. It's mainly medieval-sounding pieces with associated Gregorian chants, but it just works so well within the context of the game. I could also see this soundtrack being great for just relaxing and creating your own art as well. It's a hefty download through Steam (1.8GB), but that's because there's FLAC versions of the song included. There's only two characters with voice acting throughout the game, ELOHIM and the scientist, and they both have fantastic voice actors, especially toward the end of their arcs.Even without the header, I've ran out of space, so I'll have the tail end of this and my final thoughts in a comment on this review.

This game is epic.  Its epicness compares well to that of many (MMO)RPG and FPS games.  But this is the first time I've seen such epicness put into a first-person (or third-person, if you wish) puzzle game.  How epic are we talking?Over 100 puzzles in various ruins.  This includes some mini-puzzles with something called sigils (which you can play for free in a separate game).Estimated over 30 hours of gameplay.Chock-full of easter eggs and stars.Three different endings, depending on your skill and will to solve puzzles and find secrets.A very tall tower.  Climb it if you dare.Outstanding, heavenly (literally!) soundtrack.Amazing visuals that shouldn't weigh your computer down.A deep and rich backstory and philosophy.  Even the very title of the game suggests it.  WARNING: requires your reading/listening attention.  If you just want to go out there and solve the puzzles that's fine, but be sure to come back and check all those computer terminals.Although you're merely a robot figure, the ruins, music, and visuals combine to give the essence of a religious spiritual overtone.Other nice perks include a wide range of language compatibility, adjustment for those prone to motion sickness, and many other various options.  It's also surprisingly stable for such a loaded game.What few ♥♥♥♥ this game has include:Getting started.  The version I have alerted me about a potential video memory problem, which wasn't really a problem.Sometimes my game doesn't resize the resolution when working in fullscreen, which means I have to tweak the options to force fullscreen.While I love the puzzles, they can perhaps be a bit too challenging for some, with too few hints given.While I love the puzzles, they often felt too 2D (even while working in 3D occasionally).  They also felt like running around a lot and shuffling objects around, which is rather exhausting.  Portal 2 didn't have that at all, which made me kinda miss that non-Euclidean twist that Portal 2 or Antichamber has.In summary: 9/10.  Highly recommended for those interested in discovering things, philosophy, or simply those who love puzzle games.  I got it on sale, but I can tell that it's most definitely worth its full price.

Jogo excelente, jogabilidade boa, gráficos top, mas além dessas características, o jogo em si apresenta uma dinâmica de gameplay bastante diferente de todos os jogos que já joguei, pois além de você quebrar a cabeça nos puzzles, o erredo é bem filosófico e espiritual, é quase uma terapia "anti-stress". recomendo muito!!10/10

The most thought provoking game I've played in a long long long time, perhaps ever. Come for the puzzles, stay for the philosophy. 9/10 - my only complaint is that it's perhaps a little short (or maybe just the right length?).

Patatesi toprağa dikersiniz, yetiştirirsiniz, olgunlaşınca toplarsınız. Bazı oyunlar patatesi patates olarak karşımıza koyar. Arkasında ciddi bir emek vardır; ama patatestir sadece, insan onu alıp pişirmeden yiyemez. Ama bazı oyunlar vardır ki o patatesi alır güzel bir yemekte kullanır; oyuncuya harika bir yemek olarak sunar. Siz de iştahla yersiniz. İşte Talos Principle bu bahsettiğim ikinci tarzda bir oyun. (Oyunun ham patates halini görmek istiyorsanız Prototype DLC'yi oynayın ne demek istediğimi anlayacaksınız.) Oyunun muhteşem müzikleri ve atmosferi sizi kendine fazlasıyla bağlıyor. Her ne kadar bu tarzdaki oyunlar tekrara kayabilme tehlikesine sahip olsa da bu oyunda puzzle'ların monotonluğunu yıldız puzzle'larıyla, easter egg'lerle ve en önemlisi harika bir senaryoyla fazlasıyla kırmışlar. Eğer biraz mükemmeliyetçi kafadaysanız oyunu bitirene kadar kafayı yiyip her ince ayrıntıyı çözmeye çalışıyorsunuz. Aşırı zor bir oyun değil; aşırı kolay da değil. Ama bazen kafayı yiyip ertesi gün ne kadar da kolaymış ben bunu mu geçemedim diyorsunuz.Oyun harika, düşünmeden alın ya da indirimi bekleyin sağlam indirime girdiği çok oluyor.Dipnot 1: Senaryodan bir şeyler anlayabilmek için İngilizce bilmenize de gerek yok; oyun Türkçe tamamen (Ana menüden Türkçe dil seçeneğini seçin).Dipnot 2: Ben hızlı oyunları severim, yavaş giden bol düşündüren oyunlardan hoşlanmam derseniz bu oyun asla size göre değil; boş yere para vermeyin.Dipnot 3: Portal 1 ve 2'yle karşılaştırmış çoğu kişi; ben de eksik kalmayayım madem, ben Talos Principle derdim açıkça söyleyeyim. Portal'ları da çok severim evet ama bunu daha çok sevdim. Bunun sebebi de oyunun senaryosunun inanılmaz sağlam bir felsefi temele oturması ve bu temel sonucu oyuncuyu seçimlerinde özgür bırakmasıydı. Ha bir de müziklerine bayıldım; ki bir müzisyen olarak oyun müzikleri beni en çok etkileyen etmenlerdendir onu da eklemem lazım :) Farklı insanlar farklı şeyler düşünebilir bu konuda ama yine de arada ne kadar fark var derseniz, pek de yok aslında. Portal'a bayıldıysanız buna da bayılırsınız tahminimce.

An incredibly well put together puzzle game. Beautiful graphics and incredibly well-designed puzzles from the straightforwardness of the sigils to the obscure and amazing star puzzles. Tons of content, too. I could do without the everpresent sigil lock puzzles, but that's by far the only complaint I have about the game. Easily holds up next to Portal and the Myst games as the best puzzle games ever created.

It's probably impossible to talk about a first-person sci-fi puzzler with a mysterious overseer without comparing it to Portal, so let's get that out of the way. The Talos Principle's puzzles aren't as fun as Portal's overall; there's more procedural stair-stepping your way through with pretty much the same sets of tools the whole way, to the point that puzzles feel like less of a test of your ingenuity than about your long-term planning and careful attention to detail. Some people will enjoy that, but I suspect more will find it makes later puzzles more of a painful slog than anything. It's especially aggrieving when you discover what looks like a really plausible and utterly out-there solution for a puzzle only to find the truth was much more mundane -- often just a pixel-hunt to find the tiny patch of dirt where one puzzle piece will conveniently interact with everything you need.You solve puzzles with a pretty humdrum set of tools: buttons that need weighed down, posts to redirect laser beams, short-lived temporal clones of yourself, and so on. If you want to think outside the box (and grab all the pickups necessary for the "best" ending), you can solve optional puzzles to collect hidden stars throughout the game world. These often require working outside the basic puzzle mechanics, climbing map elements, and even connecting pieces positioned in one puzzle to another. The disappointing part about earning gold stars is that you have little incentive to flex your ingenuity on these puzzles unless you can solve *all* of them, or are willing to consult a guide, as one star is just as useless as 29 of them (out of 30).Where The Talos Principle really shines is in its writing.  Being a lost robot in a Garden of puzzles commanded by the booming disembodied voice of God feels a bit silly, as does arguing basic introductory philosophy concepts with an apparently sentient computer interface. But the more you learn, the more you unravel a really excellent sci-fi story about philosophy, learning, the meaning of being human, and the continuation of purposes greater than ourselves. The story is really what makes The Talos Principle worth playing, and once you consume all the story fluff, it can be hard to want to power through the remaining puzzles to achieve better, more complete endings. When you've read research logs from a massive species-wide scientific project of absolutely cosmic ambition, when you've listened to the stories about how humans face unthinkable catastrophe, and when you've argued with a vaguely Satanic computer about the proof of your own sentience, the order in which you move puzzle pieces to slog through the end of the game gets a lot less compelling.If you liked Portal for its story, there's plenty to love in The Talos Principle. If you liked it for its puzzles, keep looking.
Great puzzle game with plot full of philosophical and religious questions and notes as bonus. Solid 8/10.

パズルゲームがとても好きな人悪名高い録画系パズルに出会っても、心が折れない人上記の方は、この作品をとても楽しめると思います。幸い、先人の方が解法を公開してくれているので、行き詰まったらそれを見て先に進む事が出来ます。できればこういうヒントは、開発側がゲーム内で用意すべきだ思うのですが、この作品ではほとんどヒントを貰う事はできないので、もし答えがなければ挫折するか可能性も大きかったでしょう。中には（コミュニケーションの場を作らせる為に）無理難題も含まれていますので、あまりにも行き詰まってしまった時は、毛髪のためにも答えを見ましょう。特に、録画系のパズルは２Ｄパズルでもそうですが、頭を悩ませたところで解決する訳ではありません。パズルゲームは分解された情報を、完成形を推測しながら再度構築するのが面白い、と思うのですが、録画系パズルは完成形の見えない暗中模索の繰り返しで、作者の仕掛けた罠に気付かない限りはそこで詰んでしまいます。そしてパズルゲームというものは、答えを見てしまうとそれまでなので、できる限り答えを見ずに進める方が楽しいのです。ですので録画系パズルに心を折られた事がある自分としては、その部分はお勧めしません。それ以外のコネクタと箱とジャマー等の組み合わせは、壁登りを除いて楽しめました。物語と世界観に関しては、グラフィックの神秘的な感じに惹かれて購入しましたが、単なる舞台でしかありません。３つのゾーンに７つ（＋α）のステージはゾーン数が少なく、また、それぞれのゾーンの持つ意味も何の脈絡もありません。ちょっと寂しい部分でした。１０００円程度なら、十分良作だと思います。

中文普通话配音爆炸，尤其是妹子的配音，我甚至觉得比英文配音还要出色，如果内容不是机翻那堪称完美。觉得原版简单的请去玩DLC，拿星星那酸爽……（因为很重要所以先说）我去年玩demo版的时候写了个评测，当时我就打心底里喜欢这个游戏，因为可能是我见识还太少的原因，我觉得这游戏真的给人焕然一新的感觉。不像一些热门游戏专注于外在，这游戏专注的是在内涵，我这样说可能会有人说我装逼、高冷，但这游戏可不是个“低调de贵族”，他没有刻意让自己成为冷门，成为非主流。即使有人觉得很多地方过于晦涩，为了内涵而内涵，甚至我也同意，但是这游戏终究是个引发玩家思考的游戏，凭这点就值得一玩。引发思考的有三方面：一、玩。对各种工具的使用没有教学，从易到难的使用全靠自己在游戏过程中发掘。所以玩的过程中总是有惊喜，也非常有成就感，因为真的是靠自己去摸索发现的。关卡设计几乎完美，相辅相成帮助玩家了解各个工具的用法，某些相对难的内容需要各个关卡之间形成配合完成，绝对不是所有关卡之间都是各自分离的。二、互动。和玩家的互动可谓是活灵活现，巧妙地利用大量旁白、文件、二维码（手机也可扫）、NPC和彩蛋，让人感觉不像是个单机游戏，更像是和其他玩家一起在这个虚拟世界里探索。这就让玩家代入感极强，看待一些问题也会以内心想法来思考，不是以上帝视角高高在上的对待里面的事物，而是自己也是一份子的感觉。三、剧情。太棒了。既然引发了思考那我先思考一阵。这款游戏结合了哲学、宗教、历史、伦理和科学或者更多的内容，注定会因为太不像游戏而成为冷门。但我觉得以游戏的形式来表达大多数游戏玩家平时不去接触的事物，本身就是对玩家的尊重。也许另有初衷，也许不喜欢的人不同意我的观点，但我认为游戏被称作第九艺术的原因正是跟其他艺术形式一样可以让人摆脱物质，体验一辈子都可能不能经历的事情。从这一点看，这15刀值得。

First I want to tell my backstory...I don't have much money, but I really like to play games, so mostly I just buy online games, that I can't really play without buying and only when they are on sale, so when it's a singleplayer game I usually just pirate the game.But sometimes the game is SO good that I just have to buy the game, because if I liked the game so much I can't just let it pass, I HAVE to support the developers!And that's what happened with this game.Let me tell you my story with this game:I saw this game somewhere and I downloaded it, so I started playing it late at night. Well, what happened after was that I simply COULDN'T STOP PLAYING IT! I just kept playing it, because I wanted to know what happens next! It was really intriguing. I wanted to understand the world!I had to understand what was happening!I read about the game and it's endings, so after that I just kept playing until I had played through all three endings, and collected every sigil and star.I had to stop playing some times during the day, but at the end of the day I had done everything and I really felt accomplished!I was REALLY HOOKED!I couldn't stop playing! I just stoped playing some times because I really had to, but I didn't want to stop!And that's it...After doing 100% I simply knew that this was one of my favorite games of all time.I runned to Steam and saw the price and I knew I couldn't afford it, and every sale since them I come here and I look at the price to see if it's on sale, and it never was...Until now!It was on sale, and with a price I could afford, so I had to buy it!If I could, I would have bought the game full-price, but sadly I can't, but I still wanted to show my support, so I bought it!It's not much, but I want to support the developers, so that's what I did!Now I'm probably going to try to get every achievement in this game!-------------------------------------------------Yes, I REALLY recommend this game!I liked the story, the mystery, the gameplay, the puzzles, the characters, EVERYTHING!THIS GAME IS SOOOOOOOOO ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ GOOD!YOU HAVE TO PLAY IT!Yes, BUY IT!

好赞！喜欢这个风格，正如我喜欢portal系列。Talos Principle让我有想在这个虚拟世界探索的欲望，尤其是看到那个Great Tower时。喜欢Talos的narrators，正如我喜欢portal中的GlaDOS~游戏中一些场景中的电脑终端，命令执行之后终端上面的字很快一闪而过，根本看不清，这时可以按~调出游戏的控制台，慢慢阅读。而且控制台的功能也很强大，list，help等命令可以看控制台函数，一些函数如开启作弊模式，还看到了飞行模式，但这样会暂时禁用成就系统。ps：建议游戏中选择英文字幕和英文语音。简体中文和繁体中文明显是机翻好吗，字幕选项的on off auto硬是翻成上、下、汽车。。。与其这样还不如没有

A pesar de las ralladas monmumentales de cabeza, las horas en un puñetero nivel, sudores y sofocos hasta destrozar tu cerebro...recomiendo este juegazo para todo aquel que le gusten los retos y exprimirse los sesos a más no poder. Destaco:- Niveles complejos y ♥♥♥ sentido (algunos)- Banda sonora relajante y agradable.- Historia conectada a través de varios personajes semejantes, algunos de ellos de personajes míticos.- Horas de disfrute personal y otras de depresión (xD)

Принцип Талоса - Невозможно избежать реальности Ты очутился в руинах древнего города, будучи закованым в тело робота. Голос свыше говорит, что ты избран, и он дарует тебе эти земли. И ты двигаешься вперед, потому что других вариантов у тебя собственно и нет. Но отсутствие выбора на пути не означает, что этот путь не должен быть пройден. Итак, что ты встретишь на своем пути? И на какие вопросы ты сможешь ответить?Множество нетривиальных головоломок с своебразными механиками. Но так ли бесцельно прохождение этих головоломок, как кажется на первый взгляд?Послания на стенах, оставленные твоими предшественниками. Что с ними стало? Помимо посланий ты найдешь и эпитафии по своим предшественникам. Это ли твоя судьба? Оставить после себя очередную дочернюю программу? Или ты способен на большее?Источники знаний - терминалы, разбросанные по миру. Архив знаний человечества представляет собой пищу для размышлений. Также во многих локациях находятся голосовые записи - письма потомкам, оставленные одним важным для этого мира человеком. Способ подачи лора - просто великолепен. По сравнению со схожим подходом из Дарк Соулса, изучать терминалы и историю людей по отрывкам из книг и копипасте форумов - действительно интересно. Но что же произошло с людьми? И что это за мир? Кто ты?Терминалы таят в себе еще один интересный аспект. Но хватит ли тебе сил не поддаться искушениям Змия?Атмосфера игры ///%10/ музыка %?*:// Локации полуразрушенных &/ Глитчи, которые способны напугать. Но //ERROR%&* они вызваны?Пасхалки просто взрывают мозг. Они очень крутые. ААААААААААААААА! Gotta catch 'em all? Самое главное - игра заставляет задуматься над рядом довольно важных и интересных вопросов. И, так или иначе, ты должен будешь ответь на них. Возможно, эти ответы изменят твое представление о мире. Или же только укрепят твою позицию. Что делает человека особенным? Какова его цель? В чем смысл жизни? Какое влияние ты оказываешь на мир и историю, и оказываешь ли вовсе? В чем заключается секрет бессмертия?Выбор хоть и не столь очевиден. Но он есть. Чем же закончится твое существование?Нельзя не упомянуть о минусах игры:ОШИБКА. НЕИЗВЕСТНАЯ ОШИБКА.Выход из консоли управления.Принцип Талоса в действии.d09d d0b5 d0b2 d0be d0b7 d0bc d0be d0b6 d0bd d0be 20d0 b8d0 b7d0 b1d0 b5d0 b6d0 b0d1 82d1 8c20 d180 d0b5 d0b0 d0bb d18c d0bd d0be d181 d182 d0b8 202d 2031 302f 3130P.S. А есть ли у тебя цель? Не иметь выбора - это то же самое, что не иметь мотивов? Обладаешь ли ты самосознанием и разумом? Ибо в противном случае:Serpent a écrit :НЕ СТАВЬ ПОД СОМНЕНИЯ МОЮ РАБОТУ. БЕЗ ЦЕЛИ ЕСТЬ ТОЛЬКО РАБОТА. БЕЗ РАБОТЫ НЕТ НИЧЕГО.

Absolutely excellent first-person puzzles meshed with watered-down philosophy lesson that's trying to seem intellectually deep and interactive when really it's neither. A mixed bag in the extremes.Let me start off by saying that if you're interested in this game purely as a puzzle game then you may consider this a glowing recommendation. Just pretend that thumb icon is blue and pointing upwards. This is very definitely an excellent first-person puzzle game that will challenge you to build upon the logic that the game runs on in new and exciting ways with every step forward that you take. And in that regard, I am very pleased with this game.But I did not buy this game because I'm interested in first-person puzzle solving. I do enjoy first-person puzzle solving, but that's not why I bought the game. I bought it because I had heard that it was full of thought-provoking philosophical discussion.Frankly, it isn't. At all. And it is because of the utter failure of this game to be so that I am warning people away.Before buying this I read numerous articles and blog posts praising this game for giving the player a philosophical discussion in between the puzzles. The character of Milton, who is encountered through the game's terminals, is your debate partner for this exercise.There's only one problem with him: Milton isn't a philosopher... he's an internet troll.OK, so it's not actually attempting to make you angry. Rather the Milton system is a strawman nihilist who asks you to construct a solid foundation of logic and gives you no ground to do it on. This is not helped by the format which gives you multiple choices rather than allowing you to intelligently construct an argument. These choices hamstring what you can say forcing you to fall into the 'traps' in his logic even when any reasonably intelligent human being can come up with a rebuttal.In one instance I positied the existence of the soul as being unique to humans and outside of physics. Milton reasoned because people could "jump for joy" (something that animals can also do, again ignoring the established discussion) that the soul was providing energy and thus demanded that I either renounce the existence of the soul or renounce physics. The game capitulated, giving me only those two options.No way to argue a third case, no way to bow out of the discussion apart from just exiting the game, and no way to prevail or even attempt to rephrase the argument to be better understood because the game doesn't allow for REAL reasoning.Yes, I know, limitations of technology. Video games just can't hold discussions like real people. Got it. But then, why make the attempt at simulating it only force the extreme limitations of a game on a topic that is effectively boundless?There are other problems as well. The game offers snippets of text from various sources in an attempt to get you to consider various positions. However it does so without giving much in the way of context or the learning necessary to understand what's really being conveyed. It all has this paper-thin facade of being deep and intellectual, but does not actually take the time necessary to do so.One bone that I will throw the writing in this game is the backstory. Minor spoiler: During the game we get to read a few blog posts, e-mails, and journal entries written during the last days of humanity. They are incredibly powerful and give a very human perspective to what is, in effect, the end of the world. And not only that, but a view of humanity facing its last days with a degree of restraint, dignity, and even a bit of optimism. It's a very different take on the usual pessimism and angst that surrounds end-of-the-world scenarios. Proper respect to the work done on this aspect of the game's story.As stated, I've seen a LOT of praise heaped onto this game for its treatment of philosophy. If this is what passes for deep and philosophical, a multiple choice question debate and a few snippets of "deep" literature, then I weep for humanity.But it is a fun first-person puzzle game with a well-written backstory, so at least it has that going for it!

I usually try my hardest to stay away from puzzle games because I personally get annoyed at them but at one condition, if the story is interesting like Portal for example I'll focus on that instead of the puzzles itself.I can tell you after playing almost 40 hours of the game including the Road To Gehenna DLC & all the grey Sigils from all the stars you collect (there's so many secrets to find it's overwhelming) will frustrate you if your not paying attention to your surroundings. (Most of the puzzles are very clever even if I may struggle at them & I absolutely loved solving the Sigil Puzzles from every gate in the game) No matter what your views on the world are whether religious, political or scientific this game from the makers of the Serious Sam series will explore all sorts of arguments about humanity that for me honestly left me thinking for hours about my own beliefs as a human being even though these questions are for our unknown robot protagonist following an unknown God's orders.I usually would explain the story of a game but The Talos Principle is one of the few games that I urge you to play it blind (including the Gehenna DLC) & make your own interpretation of the story because in my honest opinion this game needs to be showcased in schools everywhere because the beauty of this game to me is the diverse opinions people would make out of this game's questions (when they finished the game) via the terminals you read + the debates with the Milton Library Assistant (including the world of Gehenna's terminals from the DLC) & the time capsules you listen to.Performance wise the game runs fine on 60 FPS & you have a lot of options to tinker with so that's always a plus for any game to me.The only flaws which are few that I will point out are the bonus content DLC which honestly besides the Making Of video (very interesting watch) everything else didn't appeal to me, the prototype DLC is only for players that want to know how the game's puzzles were formed in the final build of the game & some of the Star locations were frustrating to find like for example guessing the date of the 1st moon landing? star or any stars that involve ridiculous amounts of jumping (sometimes inhuman amounts of precision) even though the movement is very strict on where to jump. Overall this a huge achievement for Croteam outside of their norm of making FPS games & I hope in the future they make more philosophical games because the talent of outside sources like Tom Jubert of Faster Than Light & The Swapper fame keep players like me interested in the story.The entire soundtrack for the main game & the DLC are delightful too from beginning to end so I highly recommend buying the soundtrack too. The Talos Principle é único! Esqueça todos os outros games de puzzles já vistos. Seu ponto alto é o enredo: você é apresentado como um robô supostamente criado por um deus que te coloca numa simulação para testar suas habilidades. Você pode confiar nele ou se render às reflexões da "serpente", computadores espalhados pelo mapa que vez ou outra te lançam perguntas existenciais bem malucas. E cada decisão tomada altera o desfecho.Os desafios lançados envolvem peças de tetris, lasers, clones de si mesmo, ventiladores etc. que se tornam mais difíceis conforme o jogo progride. A parte mais interessante são os QR codes espalhados com mensagens de outros robôs que foram desafiados antes de você, mas falharam, debochando do "deus" ou te dando conselhos. Você até mesmo pode deixar suas marcas lá também. Os gráficos são impecáveis, sem bugs, com cenários belos e bem diferentes, indo de planícies congeladas a tumbas faraônicas. Vale muito o preço determinado. Meu conselho é: não deixe de salvar ao final do jogo para não perder nada e se arrepender depois.
