Great game. A first/third person puzzle game that makes you think, and not just because of it's puzzles: it has a very interesting story with lots of philosophy in between. It also has some funny easter eggs (as expected from Croteam) and multiple endings. The graphics are pretty good in general, with the only downside of some backgrounds and animations looking dated, but it makes up for it with great performance across all kinds of PCs. The music is great too, although it can get a little repetitive because of the nature of the game (as in, you will be spending a lot of time in one level, and even more if you get stuck on a puzzle).I highly recommend this game to anyone who liked games like Portal or Antichamber, and for those who like games that are full of surprises. It's truly an unforgettable experience.

For many years, people have debated whether video games can constitute art--not just a collection of pieces of art: musics, images, video, etc., but art in its own right. While I think that recent years have definitely tipped the scales in that direction, this is the first game I have ever played that is to my mind, unquestionably a piece of art that is much more than the sum of its parts. The puzzles themselves are clever and inventive, and the gold star puzzles are often magnificently devious. On its own, as a puzzler, this would be a great game. What makes it superb is the game engages the player in questions of philosophy, ethics, religion, and metaphysics, woven into a powerful extended metaphor. This game is in a league of its own.

When you start solving all this puzzles, you are like: "Why am I doing this?" But then you discover more and more new sides of the story, and at one moment you catch yourself on desire to find more puzzles and walk through all this world from the beginning to the end, and it's adorable.

Если вам нравится игра PORTAL то эту игру вам просто необходимо купить!С самого начало сюжет игры имеет великолепную тайну которая заставляет вас брызгать слюной от любопытства и желанием двигаться дальше.Головоломки уникальны и сложны что бросают вам вызов.И так же как и в Portal Финал удовлетворит вас полностью.... единственное только, что захочется это ЕЩЕ!10 из 10

Firstly, this is a pure puzzle game and almost all of what you'll do is just solve puzzles. If that doesn't sound like something you'd like then this is most certainly not a title for you.Initially I was quite put off with this game. There isn't a lot of environmental variety and I was just blazing through the first zones incredibly quickly. However I assure you things pick up and the puzzles become much more interesting and some are deviously difficult, especially if you want to get all the stars. Further the Road to Gehenna DLC has some very difficult puzzles in it if you want to test your mettle.There are basic mechanics in this game that all puzzles revolve around and more get introduced as the game goes on and they layer on top of each other in interesting ways. The puzzles, by and large, were extremely satisfying and well made.However, the crowning achievement for this game is the story and deep philosophical insight the writing team has. As someone with a minor in philosophy I found it extremely engaging and it was interesting to see literal excerpts from famous philosophers in the game and how they were applied. It was indeed interesting to see the writing team weave their own philosophical works on what "The Talos Pinciple" is and what it means into the greater context of everything.I was not expecting to be this drawn in by the world, but I was highly engaged with everything happening in this game. I even wrote a simple hex converter so I could read "corrupted" text in the game and get the whole picture of it (I later found out it's all translated in the wiki so it was a waste of time lol).Anyways, if you like puzzle games this game is for you.

If you love to ponder about philosophical/existential matters and you like puzzles, this game will keep you hooked. One of my classic favorites and I am beyond hyped for all of the philosophical questions Talos Principle 2 has in store

先插句题外话，看评论里很多人说会晕这个游戏，一开始我是担心的，因为我最近特别晕3D，没想到进了这个游戏一点都不晕，感觉很神奇。一进到游戏就被游戏精致的场景震撼到了，没有冗长的背景介绍和操作介绍，完全在游戏过程中自然而然地学会，看得出游戏制造者的奇思。谜题设计很有意思，可以用笨办法，也可以想出简单的方法，甚至有些方法有些鸡贼，但不管怎样，都是这个游戏有意思的一部分。玩的还不够多，需要继续体验，目前满分推荐。

TLDR: Ein kniffliges Rätselspiel mit erstklassiger Atmosphäre in einer offenen Spielwelt voller Geheimnisse.Puzzle: Das grundlegende Spielprinzip ist schnell gelernt: Welchen Gegenstand muss ich wann wohin befördern, um zum Ausgang des Levels zu gelangen. Gefragt ist also räumliches und zeitliches Vorstellungsvermögen à la Portal. Die Rätsel sind mittelschwer bis knifflig, sie kombinieren auf originelle Weise bekannte Elemente mit Neuem. Das Lösen eines Puzzles fühlt gerade deshalb toll an, weil man drei mal um die Ecke denken musste. Wenn man mal nicht weiter weiß, geht man eben erst einmal zu einem anderen Level. Mit den erbeuteten "Siegeln" schaltet man besonders schwere Bonus-Level frei, die es noch einmal in sich haben. Am besten gefielen mir allerdings die Rätsel, die gar nicht als solche erkennbar sind, sondern sich in der umgebenden Spielwelt verstecken.Story: Wer bin ich? Wo bin ich? Was will die allgegenwärtige Stimme Gottes von mir? Kann ich den kryptischen Nachrichten der "Anderen" trauen? Wer will, kann in dutzenden Terminals Hinweise auf die Geschehnisse der Vergangenheit und die Schicksale der Figuren finden. Oder über existentielle Fragen philosophieren. Und vielleicht sogar die vierte Wand durchbrechen. Ich fand es spannend. Ist vielleicht nicht jedermanns Sache, aber auch nicht zwingend notwendig, um die Rätsel zu genießen.Technik: Die ehemalige Serious-Sam-Grafik-Engine liefert eindrucksvolle Bilder ohne zu hohe Hardware-Anforderungen zu stellen. Das Spiel läuft wunderbar unter Linux. Die Vertonung ist 1A, sowohl auf Deutsch als auch im englischen O-Ton, begleitet von einem angenehmen Soundtrack. Umfangreiche Einstellungen und präzise FPS-Steuerung (Serious Sam eben) runden das Paket ab.Ähnliche Spiele: Portal, The Witness, The Swapper (gleicher Autor), MystFazit: Mein Spiel des Jahres 2014.

Notes about what this game is: For the most part this is a slow paced, first person puzzle solver. Much like the original Portal, things pick up when you start getting to the juicy bits of the story. There are ALOT of puzzles to solve and this game can be a grind. But if you like puzzles, long gameplay times, and a compelling story, this game is for you. On to my review:This game had some extreamly talented writters behind it. I loved how this game makes you think not just by puzzle solving but by debating things you think you already know such as your own contiousness, morality, and faith. The puzzles can be difficult to solve at times so dont be ashamed if you need help from your old pal Google. Some control elements didn't make sense to me as there are invisible walls everywhere in an attempt to keep you from breaking the natural order of things. But other then that a HUGE THUMBS UP to the developers. I would definintly recommend getting this game especaily since it has some amazing discounts a few times in the year.

What do you get when you cross the Portal seires with an existential crisis?The Talos Principle.What starts as a fairly beautiful puzzle game gets stranger and stranger as you work your way through the levels. Fro unique puzzle elements, to hidden puzzles with much higher difficulty, it is a game which can not only soothe but also cause distress. From the gentle coaxing of the narrator to the nagging doubt put by the computer, the only advice I can safely give is to trust in yourself.The story begins slow, but builds up into a terrible and awe inspiring thing. It leaves the game feeling like a love letter, one I never knew I wanted.If you love puzzle games, this is a gem for you.If you like collectables, this is a game for you.If you like existential dread, this is the game for you.All in all, I went through all endings and can say I was deeply satisfied.

The Talos Principle mostly consists of the player completing level after level of complex puzzles involving crystal beams, weighted objects, fans, turrets, locked doors, recording devices, and puzzle pieces which you use to unlock new areas. These puzzles range from being easy to very difficult, with the common theme being having to reuse objects from previous parts of the puzzle. The player is often questioned about the nature of life, their place in the universe, meaning, purpose and what it means to be alive, conscious and human. If you enjoy having to think long and hard about puzzles and unanswerable philisophical questions, then this game is for you.

The Talos Principle is a fantastic game by Croatian studio Croteam.In TTP you are a kind of android who has just woken up in a strange place, a mix of ancient ruins and advanced technology. You don't know who you are or what's going on. A booming voice from the sky says it loves you and wants you to have faith, but also it has some tests in store for you. You feel like Adam & Eve in the Garden of Eden, except you're alone.TTP is about personhood, consciousness, AI, the Turing test, and related ideas. And I really mean it addresses those topics. A lot of games that try to incorporate philosophy fail at it; often it boils down to superficial mentions of standard ideas, maybe they name a character Nietzsche or some ♥♥♥♥, and you're supposed to go, "whoa".Not this game. TTP draws from incredibly varied sources and truly approaches its questions from all sides. For instance, in the game we hear about men made of metal from Greek myth, conceptual precursors to Turing's thinking machines and our android, in a sense. We learn about how ancient Egyptians believed the soul to be composed of five elements (heart, shadow, name, personality, spark) and are treated to a breathtaking parallel between each of these elements and what it takes to be a person (I won't spoil it). This kind of fullness of exploration --- what can we put into a machine to make it a person? what do we need to take away from a person to make them no longer a person? --- characterizes the whole game.An important character in TTP is someone you only chat with through a computer terminal. They question you on your beliefs regarding the nature of consciousness and personhood and encourage you to rebel against the voice in the sky --- a Turing test with the Serpent, as it were. What I found amazing was that you can choose how you answer the questions, and the game CALLS OUT inconsistencies in your responses!The actual gameplay consists of solving Portal-style puzzles (there are no portals though). They're very well designed and a lot of fun. To get through them you employ geometric, combinatorial, physical, and even temporal reasoning (there's a mechanic reminiscent of Braid). What's more, the puzzles tie in with the overarching theme --- one can easily imagine puzzles like these being the very basis of an intelligence test!Once you realize this, you start paying attention to your own thought processes as you solve them, wondering, "what exact thoughts make me intelligent?" I've been playing puzzle games for years and I'd never done this; it is mind-blowing. You actually realize that a lot of the time you're not being intelligent at all, but running an algorithm you can even put into words: "where do I need to go? What's blocking my path? What do I need to unblock the path? Let's look for that thing." There are plenty of moments where you need to get creative, but given all the ideas in the game, you can't help but wonder: maybe creativity is just when you can't put your algorithm into words?Finally, on top of being extremely thought-provoking, the story is moving, and truly epic --- in the original sense of "epic". I had a lump in my throat at the end.An amazing game on all levels, I give it 11/10. This is one of the games to rub in the face of anyone who claims games aren't art. The visuals are gorgeous to boot, it had been a while since I'd audibly gasped at graphics in a videogame.

This is truly a wonderful puzzle game. Puzzle designs are inventive, and it has got a decent (though at many times, vague) philosophical narrative. If you've played a game like Portal and liked the puzzle solving there, then I suppose you'd like The Talos Principle as well. Some puzzles will have you stumped for a while, but thankfully the game has an "open" system where you can play puzzles in any order you like, so long as you have unlocked an area. Many times, I'd skip a difficult puzzle after pulling my hair out for an hour or two, only to return after playing all other puzzles in a given area to solve it within seconds or minutes. Perspective matters. It's nice how the game has multiple endings based on how many puzzles you solved (there are basic puzzles, advanced puzzles, and then collecting stars), as well as depending on how well you listened to or disobeyed Elohim. And say you get Ending A...the game has a unique save system that allows you to go back a little in time to experience another ending, instead of needing to start a wholly new game. Though in one case, if you do something, it wouldn't lead to one particular ending no matter what. I solved every single puzzle, and it took me 20 odd hours to complete the game. I didn't go hunting for the stars though, cause that seemed quite challenging and I thought I got what I needed out of the game by then already. There's also a text based choice mine-game with the computer program, that is kinda interesting. My singular complaint would be that the game kinda drags along around the 2/3rds point. It definitely could have been condensed a bit more, something which the devs have admitted in their post-mortem. Also, it was kinda disappointing that the 3rd area looked a lot like the first area...would have been nice if there was a whole new setting/landscape. The visuals as such while impressive, did get boring after a while. Overall, I would say this is a great game. It has got multiple tiers of puzzles, so you can choose to do the easy ones, or the challenging ones, or the hardcore ones (getting all stars), and get "rewarded" accordingly with different endings. The narrative at times also makes you to pause and think for a moment, ponder over what was just said. Oh, and the soundtrack...SIMPLY AMAZING! This is the first time I have purchased a soundtrack for a game on Steam!

Только что прошел игру, и черт возьми она ПРОСТО ШЕДЕВР от Croteam, Этот геймплей, эта нелинейность, этот сюжет, все это настолько захватывающе что хочется играть в нее и пересматривать варианты азвития событий, Вообщем ребята Всем рекомендую эту игру, и честно говоря не ожидал что кротим умеют делать логические игры да еще и с филосовским подтекстом. 11/10

Jeśli lubisz myśleć, jesteś fanem/fanką gier logicznych/zagadkowych, to Talos da ci tej frajdy dużą ilość.Mnóstwo nawiązań - nie tylko do gier croteam'u ale także do np. Portala.Trzy zakończenia fabuły.Dobre przejście z poziomu łatwego na średni na trudny(opcjonalnie jeszcze na poziom najtrudniejszy - gwiazdki i bonusowe poziomy oraz wieża). Genialny soundtrack. Świat B przynosi mi na myśl Serious Sama(jak dla mnie talos i serious sam jakoś się wiążą ze sobą, ale to tylko moje spekulacje). DOBRA OPTYMALIZACJA. Świetne zagadki(niekiedy głowa boli od ich rozwiązywania, szczególnie w ostatnim świecie). Filozoficzne polemiki z AI. DLC które dodatkowo lecz nieobowiązkowo rozwija historię gry.Polecam grę bardzo serdecznie, nawet jeśli nie uważasz się za wielkiego myśliciela. ;)

The Talos Principle is an aesthetically pleasing puzzle game, with a light touch of questioning existence and the meaning of life. This game definitely a musts for those that enjoy puzzles and leisurely cognitive games. The graphics of The Talos Principle were very well done. The game is not system intensive, and runs smoothly. I had zero bugs and glitches the game, and find it to be a worry-free gaming experience. The story is mildly entertaining, but is enjoyable to follow. You are given several ways to branch your decisions, which I found without the use of a guide, simply by reading everything as it was presented. The only thing I had to look up was two of the stars. One, which I just missed the clue, and the other I have no idea how you would have known it was there. Aside from that, this game is relatively easy to acquire all the achievements.My only frustration was in the DLC, which seemed to turn the story into the feel of a social media board. It appears intentional, but I found it tedious to read through it all. The puzzles are still very enjoyable, however. I definitely recommend this game for those that enjoy puzzles; and given the game is already praised and raved, I think any further is just piling it on.

Балдежная игра, мое первое знакомство с ней произошло в пиратской версии ксочки. Там был саундтрек "Main Menu" от Damjan Mravunac. Он вцепился мне прямо в душу и хотелось узнать с какой же он игры, как оказалось, с принципа Талоса. И вот, спустя почти 6 лет, купил игру. Отличные головоломки, некоторые мимолетно проходятся, а на некоторых ты сидишь и ломаешь голову.  Зачастую сложные головоломки очень легко решаются, только нужно до них "допереть". Никогда не сдавайтесь, ответ всегда близко.Наша, русская озвучка хоть где-то выглядит божественно, именно божественно. Голоса здесь "живые", актеры отлично играют.

打折豪华版44买的，一个没忍住玩了一晚上全收集World A，目前游戏本体+DLC全收集全成就，Demo版全收集，Prototype玩了Puzzle Set 01、02和Lost Levels，还有3个Puzzle Sets不准备玩了，就是本体里面的谜题。真是一个好游戏，我近期花的最值的44块钱。谜题突出一个多，但是由浅入深、从易到难，如果卡关可以跳过继续，基本不设置门槛。虽然说不设置门槛，但是除了普通结局，其他结局都和完成度相关。普通结局可以说是Bad End，所以为了Good Ending，努力解谜吧。但是最难解锁的结局既不是Good Ending也不算Bad Ending，很奇特。DLC的难度比本体高两个档次，收集到10颗星之后解锁的隐藏关，解法需要用到之前根本没有用到过的各种机制，比DLC的其他关再高两个档次。另外，本作和Sigils of Elohim有联动，在Sigils of Elohim里获得的兑换码在本作中可以兑换相应的墓志铭、玩家信息、信使提示或星星，每样3个。当然联动的是本体，不是DLC。也就是说本体一共有33颗星。因为只需要30颗星解锁隐藏关，所以有了联动的兑换码可以少收集3颗星。DLC还有几个迷你文字RPG，也很有趣。所以总体来说这个DLC和巫师3的DLC一样，质量极高。操作很舒服，不会因为操作方面的不便造成谜题难度的增加。宗教元素、末日后幻想的世界观和剧情给人神秘莫测的感觉。但是不感兴趣的话完全可以不去了解，这是个解谜游戏，不是RPG。剧情真的是好，DLC剧情也是。音乐也为了迎合世界观有那种神秘的感觉，但是整体还是解谜游戏惯常的那种轻松、玲珑剔透的质感。游戏内场景很美很美，真的是美。制作者很懂事，成就一周目即可全解。解谜游戏强行二周目蠢如狗比如某个叫做《磁力：牢笼禁闭》的，游戏不咋地，成就里还有个75分钟速通，强行给自己加戏。唯一不好的是，官中除了语音字幕其他都是机翻。虽然如之前所说剧情是非强制的完全可以不看，但是机翻也过分了。另外值得一提的是，这个游戏有非常多彩蛋，而且不和成就挂钩。大部分彩蛋都是同社游戏《英雄萨姆》的梗，少数几个和塔罗斯法则本身有关，这为数不多的几个，碰巧是和剧情紧密相关的，我就不剧透了，有兴趣的可以上网找找。塔罗斯法则的横幅，就机器人抱猫这个，的确是游戏中有的，就是和彩蛋有关。自从看了彩蛋之后，这游戏在我心中的评价就从好游戏上升到了神游戏。当然，也可以说是开发者给自己加戏，不过这个加戏我买账。我只想问这游戏能出续作么？

Mit The Talos Principle haben die Macher von Serious Sam etwas geschaffen, was mir persönlich selten untergekommen ist. Um es gleich auf den Punkt zu bringen. Story, Gameplay und Optik passen für meinen Geschmack perfekt zusammen.Da ich mich nicht groß spoilern wollte, war ich sehr unvoreingenommen. So war die erste Annahme, dass es sich um einen Portal-Klon handelt. An sich ist diese Annahme auch richtig, jedoch kreieren hier die Macher vieles anders oder besser gesagt: intensiver.Angefangen bei der Story, welche ruhig und schon fast schleichend beginnt. Doch hier wird dem Spieler viel Interpretationsspanne in die Hand gegeben. Genauso setzt sich das Prozedere auch fort. Viel passiert mehr im Kopf des Spielers. Auf welcher Seite will der Spieler stehen? Widersetzen oder das tun, was einem "geraten" wird? Fast nur durch Texte wird einem der Hintergrund erklärt und für mich rief dies zum Ende schon fast eine bedrückende Stimmung hervor..Neben der Story liegt das Augenmerk natürlich auch auf den Rätseln. Diese sind für meinen Geschmack gut lösbar. Für Leute die mehr Herausforderungen suchen gibt es Extralevel und Bonus-Bonuslevel. Eben jene ließen meinen Kopf zum Ende hin gut qualmen. Querdenken ist dort angesagt. (Jedoch immer fair und machbar.)Zur Optik muss ich wohl nicht viel sagen. Jedes "Zeitalter" welches dargestellt wird, zeigt sich auf eine beeindruckende Art und Weise. Hier konnte ich oftmals einfach stehenbleiben und genießen.Zwar bin ich zufrieden mit der Grafik und der Darstellung, jedoch hätte man im Bezug auf Geschichte und Hintergrund, mehr aufgreifen können. Einige Details hätten die Atmosphäre noch intensiver gestaltet.Somit ist The Talos Principle, seit langer Zeit mal wieder ein Game, welches sich wirklich zu spielen lohnt!Hier noch einige Screen's, die ich während meiner "Reise" gemacht hatte: The Talos Principle
hard puzzles, deep story, beautiful graphics, great soundif you doubt - try demo, it have different puzzles and stars: )
이 게임을 30분 좀 넘게 게임 할때마다 멀미한다...몰라 이 게임만 하면 어질해지고 멀미한다...3D멀미인가..

Не трудные, но весьма интересные загадки с красивой графикой. Сюжет хоть и не блещет событиями, но полон философии и хорошо зайдет тем, кто любит искать срытый смысл. Так что если вас не воротит от головоломок, то в эту игру определенно стоит сыграть.

Однозначно вдохновляющий пазл. Если вы когда-либо задумывались о том, может ли машина, управляемая чем-то вроде искусственного интеллекта, думать, чувствовать и мыслить самостоятельно, то эта игра станет настоящим бриллиантом в вашей коллекции.Разработчики не стали устраивать нудную псевдофилософию из разряда "мы все знаем и сейчас тебе расскажем: сиди и слушай", за что им нижайший поклон. Они сделали очень простую вещь: поместили вас, игрока, в "шкуру" подобной машины. Вы просыпаетесь в этом мире, с вами говорит некий "Создатель", а дальше вы начинаете изучать этот мир и расположенные в нем головоломки. Признаться, я почувствовал себя в шкуре Deep Learning алгоритма, сначала не понимающего, что происходит, что делать и куда идти, но затем постепенно, учась на своих ошибках, приходящего к решению сложных задач: иногда не без "внешней" помощи, а иногда самостоятельно.Сами по себе головоломки безумно занимательны: вдохновением гениальной Portal здесь пропитана буквально каждая задачка. Даже Куб (!) есть! Самое интересное, как это все реализовано: это игра в открытом мире. Причем в самом прямом смысле этого слова. Вы ходите по миру, наполненному головоломками, и, с какой из них начать, решать только вам. Часто случаются и ошибки: например, для выполнения какой-то задачки у вас не может быть специального предмета. Но это не беда, ведь вы - сами себе интеллект (НЕ ЗАХОДИ В БАШНЮ!), спокойно решаете головоломки, чтобы открыть новый предмет, возвращаетесь и еще раз показываете всему миру, насколько хорошо ваш ИИ работает. Весь мир (а, точнее, миры) открыт(ы), но Создатель запрещает вам заходить в башню. Но вы же самостоятельный интеллект: сами решаете, зайти или нет. И в этом прелесть игры: она не заставляет вас делать что-то. Вплоть до того, что вы можете просто бродить по локациям, не решая НИЧЕГО. Никто ведь не говорил, что искусственный интеллект обязательно должен что-то делать, так ведь?Об этой игре сложно что-то сказать: пока вы сами в нее не сыграете, вы не поймете всю ее прелесть и то, почему люди испытывают от нее такой дикий восторг. Однозначно рекомендую, особенно, если вам нравятся игры, где нужно подумать и поразмышлять не для решения чего-то, а просто для себя.

Does watching Rick & Morty make you clever? I think not but this game might.Do you like philosophy and puzzle games? This is a game with a very deep story while solving brainstorming puzzles. Best game you can find after Portal in puzzle games if you ask me.The first few puzzles are easy and will only take 1-3 minute. You realize you are close to the end when puzzles can take up to 20 minutes to solve. (Depending on you ofc.) Still i found it challenging and fun.Should you buy? Of course. It goes to sale up to %80-%90, just don't miss it. This game will worth every second of your time.Tip: Don't miss the messages from the computers around and try to read it which they will make the game story deeper and gives you more questions than answers.

i would rate this game 8/10 the only reason i'm not giving a 10/10 is because it lacks a bit of variety but it is easily forgiven for it. The game makes use of its environment hiding all sorts of easter eggs and secrets related to the game making u explore the level to find parts scattered across it, which u can use to climb up walls or find secrets.the difficulty is fairly average most levels being easy to solve the challenge usually comes up when u need to find solutions to the bonus pieces in the level, but the challenge may vary from person to person.Best part is that the game actually has a story which is really deep and explores not only the world of Talos but our world as well by addressing the philosophical question which have not been answered and are still being explored to this day

比較繁瑣的大眾向解謎也許是謎題難度平易近人吧，本作獲得了極高評價令我相當意外。初期碰到的綠色與黃色題目，基本上只要稍加觀察環境就能理解謎題思路；後期則會出現相對較難的紅色謎題。值得一提的是遊戲裡有一種星狀物品名叫「魔咒」可以蒐集 (以下簡稱金星)，而獲取金星的方式需要打破既有思維，第一次接觸時挺新鮮的。集齊一定數量的金星可以再去挑戰更高難度的灰色謎題。然而，綠色謎題與黃色謎題數量龐大，就算是硬核解謎玩家，前期也大約會花費 7 ~ 9 小時處理這些題目 (包含蒐集金星)。但是，相對於謎題本身的低難度，解謎的過程卻相當繁瑣，每一關都需要花費大量時間搬移道具，這種耗費精力與謎題難度不成正比的回饋感，很難讓硬核解謎玩家有動力去解開下一個謎題。也就是說，如果你是智商較為一般的人，反而會覺得前期的謎題難度與複雜度搭配得恰到好處。這也是我認為本作之所以獲得 2 萬篇極度好評的原因，因為它的謎題水準剛好符合玩家的平均水準。接著談一下謎題數量。本作謎題的「量」很多，「質」卻沒有隨著進度提升。每一個世界有許多概念重複的題目，很容易降低硬核玩家對於本作的新鮮感。很多玩家會拿 Portal 做比較，確實這兩者不管是劇情或是解謎道具都有異曲同工的味道。不過， Portal 的謎題設計更富巧思，不會用同樣思路的謎題濫竽充數，拖長遊戲時數。雖然前面有誇獎金星獲取的方式頗具創意，不過後期思路嚴重重複，且部分的設計不是很好。例如有些金星需要找出藏在很不顯眼位置的機關，啟動後才能夠獲取，我認為這種設計對於腦力激盪沒什麼幫助。還有一些明明看似不與雷射起作用的景物，實際上卻能夠接收雷射，內部藏著金星，叫人無語。最後提一下，2B 關卡有一個彩蛋，它需要一把鑰匙才能啟動。不過實際上鑰匙非常非常不起眼，且不是平常在謎題裡看到的鐵門鑰匙。這種誤導玩家的設計個人認為挺失敗的。總結也許對大部分的玩家來說本作是款佳作，不過我不認為本作適合硬核解謎玩家。若你恰好和我一樣是這類玩家，我個人會推薦你試試《FEZ》、《The Witness》、《Antichamber》、《Ittle Dew》1 代。個人入手價格/途徑：NT$ 125，包含 Road To Gehenna DLC (-90%，Steam)
游戏配音连广东话都有，赞一个先
This game unfortunately did not resonate with me. The puzzles are often more tedious than mentally challenging. And when they are challenging it's for the wrong reason.
One of the best Games I have ever played!If you are interested in Games with a general vibe like Myst, Portal, The Room etc. or / and philospohical themes, this Game is for you.

Behold... there would be so much to talk about, and yet only a few words suffice.It is not only the well designed puzzles, the clever artstyle, this monumental atmosphere music. Rather, it is the great attempt to merge real philosophy with a game. I always wanted to play this as a gamer, and even see it as a developer. And yet it is a bittersweet moment when I think that I now want a lot more of it after this game, but out there... is nothing comparable.

Below you'll find a video and written impression on the game.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=icn-YVbvIbQThe Talos Principle is a philosophical first person puzzler. You'll be exploring gorgeous environments as you solve puzzle to puzzle, so you can collect pieces to complete other puzzles! While you tickle your brain, the game slowly unfolds a loose narrative that explores themes of the self, and the existential. Philosophy majors, this game is practically made for you!Though it all could sound slightly pretentious,  the creatively designed puzzles that seems to hit just the right mark in difficulty and satisfaction, that I think even the most modest of puzzle players (like myself) can find a lot of enjoyment from The Talos Principle. If you're not into heavy philosophical themes, the good news is the gameplay is more than enough as the focal point.The Talos principle also features some of the best graphics I've seen this year in games. Not only are the texture, model, and lighting quality expertly crafted, but the design, the idea of mixing multiple timeline motifs, is equally worth praising. Those who enjoy a great sound track from their games won't be disappointed here either.To be honest, I have a hard time coming up with a negative for this game. I am really enjoying it so far, and I find most every aspect of it very satisfying. I think the only thing that might be keeping some potential players away is the price point. $40 is defiantly a higher end price point for what a lot consider and indie game. I don't agree with the notion that indie games need to be set at a lower price point, but I am also aware it does exists. What I will say is that the game has a presentation quality that in my opinion, is on the same level as many AAA games, while retaining that creative freedom that indie games have come to be known for.Pros:- Creative and satisfying puzzles- Gorgeous art and design- Great OST- Intrigueing narrative♥♥♥♥:- Might be pricey for some

1010/1010An event not meant to be hastened as critical thinking and problem solving skills are prerequisite. Patience is a Virtue that will be greatly rewarded, reliant upon obedience vs. truth in a construct's daring and exciting activity calling for enterprise and enthusiasm.

世界先有了语言，语言造就了世界，我就是世界解谜类神作我觉得这款游戏从解谜上吊打传送门，一关关错综复杂的解谜，外加关卡与关卡之间的联动简直就是解谜爱好者的毒品，玩起来就无法自拔的那种。剧情也特别棒，从关卡电脑中透露出来的点点滴滴我们可以感受到人类在文明中所做的一切，感知一个机器人看待人类和世界的感觉。时间胶囊是我最喜欢的部分，一开始一个一个听觉得还行，但当我静下心来把所有胶囊都连在一起听时，竟然有点悲伤，胶囊里的女孩传达出来的东西进一步对游戏的世界观进行了补充，此外配音小姐姐的声音巨好听。结尾也有多个，取决于你是怎么样的人，如果你是匆匆路过的玩家，应该都会解锁永恒结局；如果你是一丝不苟的玩家，应该会解锁信使结局；如果你是全身心的去理解这款游戏并有充足好奇心的玩家，应该会获得新生结局。第一个结局是最差的结局，一切又回到了轮回起点。第二个结局是最完美的结局，玩家将一切都做得有条不紊，最终成为了神的使徒。第三个结局在我看来才是最正确的结局，玩家突破规则重获新生，这也是塔罗斯法则程序设计的意义所在，它不如信使结局来的完美，但是却是最有深度的最让人触动的结局。Ps：星星收集真的难受，太刁钻了。       游戏中的彩蛋真的多，看着都是情怀啊。
